社会中的思想

MIND IN SOCIETY

高级心理过程的发展

The Development of Higher Psychological Processes

LS Vygotsky 35 岁时的肖像

Portrait of L. S. Vygotsky at age 35

维果茨基笔记的片段首先提出中介作用是高级心理过程的基础。（“注意 ：工具方法的本质在于功能上不同的两种刺激的使用，它们以不同的方式决定行为；由此产生对自己心理操作的掌握。总是假设两种刺激，我们必须回答以下问题：1. 如何借助刺激 S2（其中 S1 是对象，S2 是工具）记住刺激 S1。2. 如何借助 S2 将注意力引向 S1。3. 如何通过 S2 检索与 S1 相关的单词，等等。”）

Fragment of Vygotsky’s note first suggesting mediation as the basis of higher psychological processes. (“NB . The essence of the instrumental method resides in the functionally different use of two stimuli, which differentially determine behavior; from this results the mastery of one’s own psychological operations. Always assuming two stimuli, we must answer the following questions: 1. How does one remember stimulus S1 with the aid of stimulus S2 (where S1 is the object and S2 is the instrument). 2. How is attention directed to S1 with the aid of S2. 3. How is a word associated with S1 retrieved via S2 and so on.”)

维果茨基

L. S. VYGOTSKY

社会心态

Mind in Society

The Development of Higher Psychological Processes

纪念

亚历山大·罗曼诺维奇·卢里亚

To the memory of

Alexander Romanovich Luria

编者序

Editors’ Preface

列夫·谢苗诺维奇·维果茨基自 1962 年出版其专著《思想与语言》以来，就在美国 心理学中占有重要地位。五年前，在维果茨基的学生亚历山大·卢里亚的敦促下，我们同意编辑维果茨基的散文集，这些散文集将反映他的一般理论事业，而研究思想与语言的关系是其中一个重要方面。卢里亚向我们提供了维果茨基两部作品的粗略译文。第一部《儿童发展中的工具和符号》（1930 年）从未出版过。第二部作品是专著《高级心理功能发展史》的译文 ，该书收录在 1960 年在莫斯科出版的维果茨基第二卷著作中。粗略研究了这些散文后，我们很快确信，维果茨基著作的范围远远超出了《思想与语言》 。此外，我们开始相信，维果茨基作为认知发展早期新行为主义者的形象——我们的许多同事都持有这种印象——与这两部作品完全相反。

Lev Semyonovich Vygotsky has figured prominently in American psychology since the publication in 1962 of his monograph Thought and Language . Five years ago, at the urging of Vygotsky’s student Alexander Luria, we agreed to edit a collection of Vygotsky’s essays which would reflect the general theoretical enterprise of which the study of the relation between thought and language was one important aspect. Luria made available to us rough translations of two of Vygotsky’s works. The first, “Tool and Symbol in Children’s Development” (1930), had never been published. The second was a translation of a monograph entitled The History of the Development of Higher Psychological Functions , which appeared in the second volume of Vygotsky’s writings published in Moscow in 1960. A cursory study of these essays quickly convinced us that the scope of Vygotsky’s work reached considerably beyond Thought and Language . Furthermore, we came to believe that the image of Vygotsky as a sort of early neobehaviorist of cognitive development—an impression held by many of our colleagues—was strongly belied by these two works.

本书的前四章是根据《工具与符号》编写的。第五章总结了《工具与符号》中提出的主要理论和方法论观点，并将它们应用于认知心理学的一个经典问题，即选择反应的性质。本章摘自《高级心理功能发展史》第 3 节 。第六 章和第八章（ 学习和发展，以及写作的发展前兆）来自一本死后出版的论文集，题为《儿童的心理发展和学习过程》 （1935 年）。第七章 ， 关于游戏的理论，基于 1933 年在列宁格勒教育学院发表的一场演讲，并于 1966 年发表在Voprosi Psikhologii（心理学问题）中 。完整的参考文献列在本卷正文之后的维果茨基著作列表中。

We have constructed the first four chapters of this volume from “Tool and Symbol.” The fifth chapter summarizes the major theoretical and methodological points made in “Tool and Symbol” and applies them to a classic problem in cognitive psychology, the nature of choice reaction. This chapter was taken from section 3 of The History of the Development of Higher Psychological Functions . Chapters 6 and 8 (learning and development, and the developmental precursors of writing) are from a posthumously published collection of essays entitled Mental Development of Children and the Process of Learning (1935). Chapter 7 , on play, is based on a lecture delivered at the Leningrad Pedagogical Institute in 1933 and published in Voprosi Psikhologii (Problems of Psychology) in 1966. Complete references are given in the list of Vygotsky’s works that follows the text of this volume.

我们在几处插入了来自其他来源的材料，以便更充分地阐明文本的含义。在大多数情况下，这些引述来自《高级心理功能发展史》中 除此处包含的部分以外的其他章节；其余部分取自 1956 年或 1960 年文集中出现的其他论文。在少数情况下，段落取自维果茨基的学生或合作者的作品，这些作品提供了原文以极其简洁的方式描述的实验程序或结果的具体例子。注释中给出了对这些来源的引用。

At several places we have inserted material from additional sources in order to more fully explicate the meaning of the text. In most cases these importations are from sections of The History of the Development of Higher Psychological Functions other than the one included here; the rest are taken from other essays which appear in either the 1956 or the 1960 volumes of collected works. In a few cases passages have been taken from the work of Vygotsky’s students or collaborators which provide concrete examples of experimental procedures or results which the original text describes with extreme brevity. References to these sources are given in the notes.

在将各个论文放在一起时，我们做了很大的改动。读者在这里看到的不是维果茨基的逐字翻译，而是我们对维果茨基的编辑译本，我们删除了看似多余的内容，并添加了一些似乎能使他的观点更清晰的内容。正如其他编辑所指出的，维果茨基的风格极其难以理解。他写了很多东西，但他的许多手稿从未得到适当的编辑。此外，在经常生病期间，他会口述他的论文——这种做法导致了重复和晦涩或省略的散文。原始手稿中的空白使得它们现在比写作时更难获得。由于很少给出适当的参考资料，我们对维果茨基所参考的确切来源提供了我们最好的猜测。追踪和阅读这些资料的过程本身就是一个非常有益的事业；他的许多同时代人在某些重要方面都非常现代。我们意识到，在篡改原稿时，我们可能扭曲了历史；然而，我们希望，通过陈述我们的程序并尽可能遵循工作的原则和内容，我们不会歪曲维果茨基的意思。

In putting separate essays together we have taken significant liberties. The reader will encounter here not a literal translation of Vygotsky but rather our edited translation of Vygotsky, from which we have omitted material that seemed redundant and to which we have added material that seemed to make his points clearer. As other editors have noted, Vygotsky’s style is extremely difficult. He wrote copiously and many of his manuscripts have never been properly edited. In addition, during frequent periods of illness he would dictate his papers—a practice which resulted in repetitions and dense or elliptical prose. Gaps in the original manuscripts make them even less accessible now than they might have been at the time they were written. Because proper references were rarely given, we have supplied our best guess as to the exact sources to which Vygotsky referred. The process of tracking down and reading these sources has itself proved a very rewarding enterprise; many of his contemporaries were fascinatingly modern in important respects. We realize that in tampering with the original we may have distorted history; however, we hope that by stating our procedures and by adhering as closely as possible to the principles and content of the work, we have not distorted Vygotsky’s meaning.

我们特别感谢已故的 Alexander R. Luria，他提供了第 1 至5章中大部分材料的初始翻译 ，孜孜不倦地查找参考资料并扩展实验细节，并阅读了我们的手稿。第 6 章和 第7章 由 Martin Lopez-Morillas 翻译。第 5 章和第 1 至5章 的部分内容 由 Michael Cole 翻译。我们感谢 James Wertsch 协助翻译和解释特别困难的段落。

We owe a special debt to the late Alexander R. Luria for providing an initial translation of much of the material included in chapters 1 –5 , for tirelessly tracking down references and expanding upon details of experiments, and for reading our manuscript. Chapters 6 and 7 were translated by Martin Lopez-Morillas. Chapter 5 and parts of chapters 1 –5 were translated by Michael Cole. We wish to thank James Wertsch for his assistance in translating and interpreting especially difficult passages.

这些作品的编辑工作已经耗费了我们好几年的时间。每个编辑团队在不同的地方工作，接受过不同的思想传统教育，他们发现了一些特别有趣的材料。由于如此复杂的思想体系需要阐明的问题不止一个，而是很多，所以我们写了两篇文章，反映了“阅读维果茨基”的各个方面。

The editing of these writings has occupied us for several years. Working in separate locations, educated in differing intellectual traditions, each team of editors found certain material of special interest. Since there is not one but many issues to be illuminated by such a complex body of thought, we have written two essays reflecting various aspects of “reading Vygotsky."

薇拉·约翰·斯坦纳 迈克尔·科尔
埃伦·苏伯曼 西尔维娅·斯克里布纳
新墨西哥大学 洛克菲勒大学

维果茨基的作品

Vygotsky’s Works

指数

Index

蜘蛛的工作方式让人想起织布工，蜜蜂在天空中建造的盒子可能会让许多建筑师的作品黯然失色。但即使是最差的建筑师从一开始就与最能干的蜜蜂不同，在他用木板建造一个盒子之前，他已经在脑子里把它建好了。在工作过程结束时，他得到的结果是在他开始建造之前就已经存在于他的脑海中的。建筑师不仅在自然界的限制范围内改变自然赋予他的形式，他还实现了自己的目的，这定义了他必须服从其意志的活动的手段和性质。

The spider carries out operations reminiscent of a weaver and the boxes which bees build in the sky could disgrace the work of many architects. But even the worst architect differs from the most able bee from the very outset in that before he builds a box out of boards he has already constructed it in his head. At the end of the work process he obtains a result which already existed in his mind before he began to build. The architect not only changes the form given to him by nature, within the constraints imposed by nature, he also carries out a purpose of his own which defines the means and the character of the activity to which he must subordinate his will.

卡尔·马克思，《资本论》

Karl Marx, Capital

人类思想最本质、最直接的基础，正是人类对自然的改变，而不是自然本身。

It is precisely the alteration of nature by men , not nature as such, which is the most essential and immediate basis of human thought.

弗里德里希·恩格斯，《自然辩证法》

Friedrich Engels, Dialectics of Nature

介绍

Introduction

迈克尔·科尔和西尔维娅·斯克里布纳

MICHAEL COLE AND SYLVIA SCRIBNER

列夫·S·维果茨基受过律师和语言学家的教育，在 1917 年俄国革命后开始心理学家生涯时，他已经为文学批评做出了许多贡献。他是实验心理学创始人威廉·冯特和美国实用主义者威廉·詹姆斯鼎盛时期的学生。他的科学同代人包括行为刺激反应理论的推广者伊万·巴甫洛夫、弗拉基米尔·贝赫捷列夫和约翰·B·沃森，以及格式塔心理学运动的创始人韦特海默、科勒、科夫卡和列文。因此，读者可能会认为，维果茨基的作品将主要具有历史意义——或许可以一窥现代心理学的奠基者如何影响革命后的俄罗斯的苏联心理学。这些文章从思想史的角度来看当然很有趣，但它们不是历史遗迹。相反，我们将它们作为对当代心理学中的难题和讨论的贡献。

Educated as a lawyer and philologist, Lev S. Vygotsky had already made several contributions to literary criticism when he began his career as a psychologist following the Russian Revolution in 1917. He was a student in the heyday of Wilhelm Wundt, the founder of experimental psychology, and William James, the American pragmatist. His scientific contemporaries included Ivan Pavlov, Vladimir Bekhterev, and John B. Watson, popularizers of stimulus-response theories of behavior, as well as Wertheimer, Köhler, Koffka, and Lewin, the founders of the Gestalt psychology movement. The reader might expect, then, that Vygotsky’s work will prove to be primarily of historical interest—perhaps as a glimpse of the way in which modern psychology’s founding fathers influenced Soviet psychology in postrevolutionary Russia. These essays are certainly of interest from the perspective of intellectual history, but they are not historical relics. Rather, we offer them as a contribution to quandaries and discussions in contemporary psychology.

为了理解本书中的观点如何能够跨越我们与维果茨基所处的时代和文化界限而保持其相关性，我们不断反思欧洲心理学的现状，而欧洲心理学正是维果茨基理论的最初背景。我们还发现研究革命后俄罗斯的心理学和社会状况也很有帮助，因为它们是维果茨基面临的直接问题的根源，也是他和他的同事寻求发展马克思主义的人类智力功能理论的灵感来源。

In order to understand how the ideas in this volume can retain their relevance across the reaches of time and culture that separate us from Vygotsky, we have repeatedly found ourselves reflecting upon the state of European psychology which provided the initial setting for Vygotsky’s theories. We have also found it helpful to examine the condition of psychology and society in postrevolutionary Russia, since they were the source of the immediate problems facing Vygotsky as well as a source of inspiration as he and his colleagues sought to develop a Marxist theory of human intellectual functioning.

十九世纪初

NINETEENTH-CENTURY BEGINNINGS

直到十九世纪后半叶，对人性的研究还是哲学的领域。约翰·洛克的思想后裔在英国发展了洛克对心灵的经验主义解释，强调观念的起源于环境产生的感觉。对于这些英国经验主义者来说，心理分析的主要问题是描述简单感觉结合产生复杂观念的联想规律。在欧洲大陆，伊曼纽尔·康德的追随者认为，空间和时间的观念以及数量、质量和关系的概念源于人类心灵，不能分解成更简单的元素。双方都坚持己见。这两种哲学传统都基于勒内·笛卡尔的著作所提出的假设，即对人的科学研究只能适用于人的肉体。哲学的任务是研究人的灵魂。

Until the latter half of the nineteenth century the study of man’s nature was the province of philosophy. The intellectual descendants of John Locke in England had developed his empiricist explanation of mind, which emphasized the origin of ideas from environmentally produced sensations. The major problem of psychological analysis for these British empiricists was to describe the laws of association by which simple sensations combine to produce complex ideas. On the continent the followers of Immanuel Kant argued that ideas of space and time and concepts of quantity, quality, and relation originate in the human mind and cannot be decomposed into simpler elements. Neither side budged from its armchair. Both of these philosophical traditions were operating under the assumption, dating from the work of René Descartes, that the scientific study of man could apply only to his physical body. To philosophy was assigned the study of his soul.

虽然这两种方法之间的冲突一直延续到今天，但是在 19 世纪 60 年代，三本几乎同时出版的书彻底改变了这一讨论的气氛。其中最著名的是达尔文的《物种起源》 ，该书主张人类与其他动物具有本质上的连续性。这一论断的直接后果就是许多学者试图建立不连续性，以将人类成年人与其低等亲属（在个体发生和系统发育上）区分开来。第二本书是古斯塔夫·费希纳的《心理物理学》 ，该书对可指定的物理事件的变化与可言语化的“心理”反应之间的关系进行了详细的、数学上复杂的描述。费希纳声称他对人类思维内容做出了客观的、定量的描述。第三本书是一本薄薄的书，名为《大脑的反射 》，作者是莫斯科医生 I.M.谢切诺夫。谢切诺夫曾师从欧洲一些顶尖的生理学家，他利用从活体中分离神经肌肉制剂的技术，对简单的感觉运动反射有了深入的了解。谢切诺夫确信，他在青蛙分离组织中观察到的过程与完整生物体（包括人类）中枢神经系统中发生的过程在原理上是相同的。如果腿部肌肉的反应可以用抑制和兴奋的过程来解释，那么同样的规律是否也适用于人类大脑皮层的运作？尽管谢切诺夫缺乏这些推测的直接证据，但他的想法为将动物的自然科学研究与迄今为止的哲学研究联系起来提供了生理基础。 人类研究。沙皇的审查官似乎理解谢切诺夫论文的革命性和唯物主义含义；他尽可能长时间地禁止出版这本书。这本书出版时，上面有献给查尔斯·达尔文的题词。

While the conflict between these two approaches reaches down to the present day, in the 1860s the terms of this discussion were changed irrevocably by the almost simultaneous publication of three books. Most famous was Darwin’s Origin of Species , which argued the essential continuity of man and other animals. One immediate consequence of this assertion was an effort by many scholars to establish discontinuities that set human adults off from their lower relatives (both ontogenetically and phylogenetically). The second book was Gustav Fechner’s Die Psychophysik , which provided a detailed, mathematically sophisticated description of the relation between changes in specifiable physical events and verbalizable “psychic” responses. Fechner claimed no less than an objective, quantitative description of the contents of the human mind. The third book was a slim volume entitled Reflexes of the Brain , written by a Moscow physician, I. M. Sechenov. Sechenov, who had studied with some of Europe’s leading physiologists, had advanced understanding of simple sensory-motor reflexes by using techniques that isolated nerve-muscle preparations from the living organism. Sechenov was convinced that the processes he observed in the isolated tissue of frogs were the same in principle as those that take place in the central nervous systems of intact organisms, including humans. If responses of leg muscles could be accounted for by processes of inhibition and excitation, might not the same laws apply to the operations of the human cerebral cortex? Although he lacked direct evidence for these speculations, Sechenov’s ideas suggested the physiological basis for linking the natural scientific study of animals with the heretofore philosophical study of humans. The tsar’s censor seemed to understand the revolutionary, materialist implications of Sechenov’s thesis; he banned publication of the book for as long as he could. When the book appeared, it bore a dedication to Charles Darwin.

达尔文、费希纳和谢切诺夫的这些著作可以视为十九世纪末心理学思想的重要组成部分。达尔文将动物和人类联系在一个受自然法则支配的概念系统中；费希纳提供了一个自然法则的例子，描述了物理事件和人类心理功能之间的关系；谢切诺夫从青蛙的肌肉抽搐中推断出了一种生理理论，解释了这种心理过程在正常个体中是如何运作的。这些作者都不认为自己是心理学家（他们的同时代人也不认为他们是心理学家）。但他们提出了十九世纪下半叶年轻的心理学所关注的核心问题：动物和人类行为之间的关系是什么？环境和心理事件之间的关系是什么？生理和心理过程之间的关系是什么？各种心理学流派都针对这些问题中的一个或另一个，在理论有限的视角内提供了部分答案。

These books by Darwin, Fechner, and Sechenov can be viewed as essential constituents of psychological thought at the end of the nineteenth century. Darwin linked animals and humans in a single conceptual system regulated by natural laws; Fechner provided an example of what a natural law describing the relationship between physical events and human mental functioning might look like; Sechenov, extrapolating from muscle twitches in frogs, proposed a physiological theory of how such mental processes worked within the normally functioning individual. None of these authors considered themselves (or were considered by their contemporaries) to be psychologists. But they provided the central questions with which the young science of psychology became concerned in the second half of the century: What are the relationships between animal and human behavior? Environmental and mental events? Physiological and psychological processes? Various schools of psychology attacked one or another of these questions, providing partial answers within theoretically limited perspectives.

第一个这样的学派是由威廉·冯特于 1880 年创立的。冯特的任务是描述人类意识的内容及其与外部刺激的关系。他的方法包括将各种意识状态分析为它们的组成元素，他将这些元素定义为简单的感觉。基于先验理由，他排除了诸如“意识感觉”或“关系知觉”之类的感觉作为意识元素，认为这些现象“只不过是”错误观察方法（内省）的副产品。事实上，冯特提出了一个明确的观点，即复杂的心理功能，或者当时所称的“高级心理过程”（例如自愿记忆和演绎推理），原则上不能 由实验心理学家研究。他认为，它们只能通过对民间故事、习俗和语言等文化产品的历史研究来研究。

The first such school was established by Wilhelm Wundt in 1880. Wundt took as his task the description of the contents of human consciousness and their relation to external stimulation. His method consisted of analyzing various states of consciousness into their constituent elements, which he defined as simple sensations. On a priori grounds, he ruled out such sensations as “feelings of awareness” or “perception of relations” as elements of consciousness, considering these phenomena to be “nothing more than” the by-product of faulty methods of observation (introspection). Indeed, Wundt propounded the explicit view that complex mental functions, or as they were then known, “higher psychological processes” (voluntary remembering and deductive reasoning, for example), could not in principle be studied by experimental psychologists. They could only be investigated, he maintained, by historical studies of cultural products such as folktales, customs, and language.

第一次世界大战开始时，人类意识过程的内省研究受到了来自两个方面的攻击。在美国和俄罗斯，心理学家对围绕感觉的正确内省描述的争议以及这种立场导致的研究的无用性感到不满， 他们放弃了意识研究，转而研究行为。利用巴甫洛夫对条件反射的研究所揭示的潜力， 反射理论（建立在谢切诺夫理论的基础上）和达尔文关于人与动物连续性的论断，为科学研究开辟了许多动物和人类行为领域。然而，在一个重要方面，他们与内省的对手意见一致：他们的基本策略是确定人类活动的简单构成要素（用刺激-反应关系代替感觉），然后指定这些要素结合起来产生更复杂现象的规则。这种策略导致人们把注意力集中在动物和人类共同的过程上，并再次忽视了更高级的过程——思维、语言和意志行为。对意识内容描述的第二条攻击路线来自一群心理学家，他们反对冯特和行为主义者一致同意的一点：将心理过程分析为基本成分是恰当的。这一运动后来被称为格式塔心理学，它表明许多智力现象（例如科勒对类人猿的研究）和知觉现象（例如韦特海默对闪烁光的视运动的研究）无法用冯特提出的意识基本要素或简单的刺激-反应行为理论来解释。格式塔心理学家原则上拒绝用简单过程来解释复杂过程的可能性。

By the beginning of World War I introspective studies of human conscious processes came under attack from two directions. In the United States and Russia psychologists discontented with the controversies surrounding the correct introspective descriptions of sensations, and with the sterility of the research this position had produced, renounced the study of consciousness in favor of the study of behavior. Exploiting the potential suggested by Pavlov’s study of conditioned reflexes (which built upon Sechenov) and Darwin’s assertion of the continuity of man and beast, they opened up many areas of animal and human behavior to scientific study. In one important respect, however, they agreed with their introspective antagonists: their basic strategy was to identify the simple building blocks of human activity (substituting stimulus-response bonds for sensations) and then to specify the rules by which these elements combined to produce more complex phenomena. This strategy led to a concentration on processes shared by animals and humans and, again, to a neglect of higher processes—thought, language, and volitional behavior. The second line of attack on descriptions of the contents of consciousness came from a group of psychologists who objected to the one point upon which Wundt and the behaviorists agreed: the appropriateness of analyzing psychological processes into their basic constituents. This movement, which came to be known as Gestalt psychology, demonstrated that many intellectual phenomena (Köhler’s studies with anthropoid apes were an example) and perceptual phenomena (Wertheimer’s studies of apparent movement of flickering lights, for example) could not be accounted for in terms of either the basic elements of consciousness postulated by Wundt or simple stimulus-response theories of behavior. The Gestalt psychologists rejected, in principle, the possibility of accounting for complex processes in terms of simple ones.

简而言之，这就是维果茨基首次出现时欧洲心理学的状况。俄罗斯的情况也差不多。

Such, in great brevity, was the situation in European psychology when Vygotsky first appeared on the scene. The situation was not very different in Russia.

俄罗斯革命后的心理学

POSTREVOLUTIONARY PSYCHOLOGY IN RUSSIA

二十世纪初，俄罗斯的心理学与欧洲一样，被各种学派所左右，每个学派都只能对有限范围的现象提供部分解释。1923 年，在第一次全俄心理神经学大会上，KN 科尔尼洛夫发起了革命后心理学的第一次重大组织和思想转变。当时，莫斯科著名的心理学研究所的负责人是 GI 切尔帕诺夫，他是冯特内省心理学的追随者，也是行为主义的反对者。（他在 1917 年革命前夕出版了《人的心灵》一书的第六版 ，该书批判了唯物主义的心灵理论。）切尔帕诺夫认为马克思主义在心理学中的作用有限，他声称它可以帮助解释意识的社会组织，但不能解释个人意识的属性。在题为“当代心理学”的演讲中，切尔帕诺夫认为马克思主义在心理学中的作用有限，他声称它可以帮助解释意识的社会组织，但不能解释个人意识的属性。 “心理学与马克思主义”科尔尼洛夫批评切尔帕诺夫的心理学理论基于理想主义，并认为马克思主义在心理学中的作用有限。科尔尼洛夫将自己的方法称为反应学，试图将所有心理学分支纳入以行为反应为基本数据的马克思主义框架中。

In the early decades of the twentieth century psychology in Russia, as in Europe, was torn between contending schools, each of which offered partial explanations of a limited range of phenomena. In 1923 at the first all-Russian psychoneurological congress K. N. Kornilov initiated the first major organizational and intellectual shift in psychology following the revolution. At that time the prestigious Institute of Psychology in Moscow was headed by G. I. Chelpanov, an adherent of Wundt’s introspective psychology and a foe of behaviorism. (He had published the sixth edition of his book, The Mind of Man , a critique of materialist theories of the mind, in 1917, just before the revolution.) Chelpanov assigned a restricted role to Marxism in psychology, asserting it could help explain the social organization of consciousness but not the properties of individual consciousness. In a talk entitled “Contemporary Psychology and Marxism” Kornilov criticized Chelpanov both for the idealistic basis of his psychological theory and for the restricted role he assigned to Marxism in psychology. Kornilov, who called his own approach reactology, sought to subsume all branches of psychology within a Marxist framework that used behavioral reactions as the basic data.

科尔尼洛夫 1923 年对切尔帕诺夫的批评最终赢得了胜利。切尔帕诺夫被解除了心理学研究所所长的职务，科尔尼洛夫接替了他的位置，他立即召集了一批年轻的科学家，致力于制定和推广行为主义的马克思主义心理学理论。一年后，维果茨基在第二次心理神经学会议上发表了题为“意识作为行为心理学的对象”的演讲，引起了不小的轰动。无论从科尔尼洛夫的反应学方法中还能得出什么结论，它显然没有突出意识在人类活动中的作用，也没有赋予意识概念在心理科学中的作用。1

Kornilov’s critique of Chelpanov in 1923 won the day. Chelpanov was removed as director of the Institute of Psychology and was replaced by Kornilov, who immediately brought together a corps of young scientists dedicated to formulating and promoting a behavioral, Marxist theory of psychology. Vygotsky must have produced quite a sensation one year later at the second psychoneurological meeting when he gave a talk entitled “Consciousness as an Object of the Psychology of Behavior.” Whatever else one extracted from Kornilov’s reactological approach, it quite clearly did not feature the role of consciousness in human activity, nor did it accord the concept of consciousness a role in psychological science.1

维果茨基反对新建立的权威。但他并不主张回到切尔帕诺夫所倡导的立场。在他最初的演讲和随后的一系列出版物中，他明确表示，在他看来，现有的心理学流派都没有为建立人类心理过程的统一理论提供坚实的基础。借用德国同代人的一句话，他经常提到“心理学危机”，并设定了在全新理论基础上综合各种相互竞争的观点的任务。

Vygotsky was dissenting from newly established authority. He was not, however, promoting a return to the position advocated by Chelpanov. In his initial speech and a series of subsequent publications, he made it clear that in his view none of the existing schools of psychology provided a firm foundation for establishing a unified theory of human psychological processes. Borrowing a phrase from his German contemporaries, he often referred to the “crisis in psychology” and set himself the task of achieving a synthesis of contending views on a completely new theoretical basis.

对于维果茨基的格式塔同代人来说，危机的存在是因为既定的理论（主要是冯特和沃森的行为主义）在他们看来无法解释复杂的感知和解决问题的行为。对于维果茨基来说，危机要深远得多。他和格式塔心理学家一样对心理分析感到不满，因为心理分析首先将所有现象简化为一组心理“原子”。但他认为格式塔心理学家未能超越对复杂现象的描述而对其进行解释。即使人们接受格式塔对以前方法的批评，危机仍然存在，因为心理学仍然会分裂成两个不可调和的部分：一个“自然科学”分支可以解释基本的感觉和反射过程，另一个“心理科学”分支可以描述高级心理过程的突现特性。维果茨基寻求的是一种全面的方法，使用自然科学可以接受的术语来描述和 解释高级心理功能成为可能。对维果茨基来说，解释 意义重大。它包括识别特定功能背后的大脑机制；它包括详细阐述其发展历史，以建立看似相同行为的简单形式和复杂形式之间的关系；而且，重要的是，它包括对行为发展的社会背景的说明。维果茨基的目标非常雄心勃勃，也许不合理。他没有实现这些目标（他很清楚）。但他确实成功地为我们提供了对现代心理学的敏锐和有先见之明的分析。

For Vygotsky’s Gestalt contemporaries, a crisis existed because established theories (primarily Wundt’s and Watsonian behaviorism) could not, in their view, explain complex perceptual and problem-solving behaviors. For Vygotsky, the crisis went much deeper. He shared the Gestalt psychologists’ dissatisfaction with psychological analysis that began by reducing all phenomena to a set of psychological “atoms.” But he felt that the Gestalt psychologists failed to move beyond the description of complex phenomena to the explanation of them. Even if one were to accept the Gestalt criticisms of previous approaches, a crisis would still exist because psychology would remain split into two irreconcilable halves: a “natural science” branch that could explain elementary sensory and reflex processes, and a “mental science” half that could describe emergent properties of higher psychological processes. What Vygotsky sought was a comprehensive approach that would make possible description and explanation of higher psychological functions in terms acceptable to natural science. To Vygotsky, explanation meant a great deal. It included identification of the brain mechanisms underlying a particular function; it included a detailed explication of their developmental history to establish the relation between simple and complex forms of what appeared to be the same behavior; and, importantly, it included specification of the societal context in which the behavior developed. Vygotsky’s goals were extremely ambitious, perhaps unreasonably so. He did not achieve these goals (as he was well aware). But he did succeed in providing us with an astute and prescient analysis of modern psychology.

维果茨基的著作之所以具有持续的现实意义，主要原因是他在 1924 年和随后的十年中对以下观点进行了深刻的批判：要理解人类的高级心理功能，可以通过对动物心理学原理的不断增多和复杂化，特别是那些代表刺激-反应定律的机械组合的原理进行批判。同时，他对那些声称成人智力功能的特性仅仅源于成熟，或者以某种方式在儿童身上预先形成，只是在等待机会来表现的理论进行了严厉的批判。

A major reason for the continued relevance of Vygotsky’s work is that in 1924 and the following decade he constructed a penetrating critique of the notion that an understanding of the higher psychological functions in humans can be found by a multiplication and complication of principles derived from animal psychology, in particular those principles that represent the mechanical combination of stimulus-response laws. At the same time he provided a devastating critique of theories which claim that the properties of adult intellectual functions arise from maturation alone, or are in any way preformed in the child and simply waiting for an opportunity to manifest themselves.

维果茨基强调语言和思维的社会起源，追随了有影响力的法国社会学家的脚步，但据我们所知，他是第一位提出文化成为每个人天性一部分的机制的现代心理学家。他坚持认为心理功能是大脑活动的产物，成为将实验认知心理学与神经学和生理学相结合的早期倡导者。最后，他声称所有这些都应该用马克思主义的人类社会历史理论来理解，为统一的行为科学奠定了基础。

In stressing the social origins of language and thinking, Vygotsky was following the lead of influential French sociologists, but to our knowledge he was the first modern psychologist to suggest the mechanisms by which culture becomes a part of each person’s nature. Insisting that psychological functions are a product of the brain’s activity, he became an early advocate of combining experimental cognitive psychology with neurology and physiology. Finally, by claiming that all of these should be understood in terms of a Marxist theory of the history of human society, he laid the foundation for a unified behavioral science.

马克思主义理论框架

MARXIST THEORETICAL FRAMEWORK

与苏联学者急于让自己的理论符合政治局对马克思主义的最新解读的刻板印象相反，维果茨基从职业生涯的早期就明确地将马克思主义思想视为宝贵的科学资源。“辩证唯物主义和历史唯物主义在心理学上的应用”是对维果茨基高级心理过程社会文化理论的一个准确总结。

Contrary to the stereotype of Soviet scholars scurrying to make their theories conform to the Politburo’s most recent interpretation of Marxism, Vygotsky clearly viewed Marxist thought as a valuable scientific resource from very early in his career. “A psychologically relevant application of dialectical and historical materialism” would be one accurate summary of Vygotsky’s sociocultural theory of higher mental processes.

维果茨基在辩证唯物主义的方法和原理中看到了解决同时代人面临的关键科学悖论的办法。这种方法的一个核心原则是，所有现象都应作为过程来研究 运动和变化。就心理学的主题而言，科学家的任务是重建行为和意识的起源和发展过程。不仅每个现象都有其历史，而且这种历史的特点是质的变化（形式、结构和基本特征的变化）和量的变化。维果茨基运用这种推理来解释基本心理过程向复杂过程的转变。通过追踪发展过程中发生的行为质变，可以弥合自然科学对基本过程的研究与对文化行为形式的思辨性反思之间的分歧。因此，当维果茨基说他的方法“发展性”时，这并不意味着这与儿童发展理论相混淆。在维果茨基看来，发展方法是心理科学的核心方法。

Vygotsky saw in the methods and principles of dialectical materialism a solution to key scientific paradoxes facing his contemporaries. A central tenet of this method is that all phenomena be studied as processes in motion and in change. In terms of the subject matter of psychology, the scientist’s task is to reconstruct the origin and course of development of behavior and consciousness. Not only does every phenomenon have its history, but this history is characterized by changes both qualitative (changes in form and structure and basic characteristics) and quantitative. Vygotsky applied this line of reasoning to explain the transformation of elementary psychological processes into complex ones. The schism between natural scientific studies of elementary processes and speculative reflection on cultural forms of behavior might be bridged by tracing the qualitative changes in behavior occuring in the course of development. Thus, when Vygotsky speaks of his approach as “developmental,” this is not to be confused with a theory of child development. The developmental method, in Vygotsky’s view, is the central method of psychological science.

马克思的社会理论（即历史唯物主义）也在维果茨基的思想中发挥了根本性作用。马克思认为，社会和物质生活的历史变化导致“人性”（意识和行为）的变化。尽管这一普遍命题得到了其他人的呼应，但维果茨基是第一个尝试将其与具体的心理学问题联系起来的人。在这一努力中，他创造性地阐述了恩格斯关于人类劳动和工具使用的概念，认为它们是人类改变自然并进而改造自己的手段。在下面的第 1 章 至第 4 章中 ，维果茨基以一种在恩格斯那里找到直接前因的方式运用了工具的概念：“手的专业化——这意味着工具， 而工具意味着特定的人类活动，即人类对自然的改造反应”；2 “动物只是利用 外部自然，仅仅通过它的存在就给它带来变化；人类通过改变，使它服务于自己的目的，掌握它 。”这是人类和其他动物的最终的、本质的区别”（第291页）。维果茨基巧妙地将这种人与环境互动中的中介概念扩展到符号和工具的使用。与工具系统一样，符号系统（语言、文字、数字系统）也是社会在人类历史进程中创造的，并随着社会形式和文化发展水平的变化而变化。维果茨基认为，文化产生的符号系统的内化会带来行为的转变，并形成个体发展早期和晚期形式之间的桥梁。因此，对维果茨基来说，在马克思和恩格斯的传统中，个体发展变化的机制根植于社会和文化。

Marx’s theory of society (known as historical materialism) also played a fundamental role in Vygotsky’s thinking. According to Marx, historical changes in society and material life produce changes in “human nature” (consciousness and behavior). Although this general proposition had been echoed by others, Vygotsky was the first to attempt to relate it to concrete psychological questions. In this effort he creatively elaborated on Engels’ concept of human labor and tool use as the means by which man changes nature and, in so doing, transforms himself. In chapters 1 through 4 below, Vygotsky exploits the concept of a tool in a fashion that finds its direct antecedents in Engels: “The specialization of the hand—this implies the tool , and the tool implies specific human activity, the transforming reaction of man on nature”;2 “the animal merely uses external nature, and brings about changes in it simply by his presence; man, by his changes, makes it serve his ends, masters it . This is the final, essential distinction between man and other animals” (p. 291). Vygotsky brilliantly extended this concept of mediation in human-environment interaction to the use of signs as well as tools. Like tool systems, sign systems (language, writing, number systems) are created by societies over the course of human history and change with the form of society and the level of its cultural development. Vygotsky believed that the internalization of culturally produced sign systems brings about behavioral transformations and forms the bridge between early and later forms of individual development. Thus for Vygotsky, in the tradition of Marx and Engels, the mechanism of individual developmental change is rooted in society and culture.

在后面的章节中（特别是第 5 章 ），维果茨基概括了他对高级心理功能起源的概念， 揭示了它们的根本中介性质和辩证唯物主义的历史变革观之间的密切关系。

In later chapters (especially chapter 5 ) Vygotsky generalizes his conception of the origin of higher psychological functions in a way that reveals the close relationship between their fundamentally mediated nature and the dialectical, materialist conception of historical change.

某些苏联心理学家有时会过度引用马克思主义经典著作，因为他们想从相互竞争的思想流派的混乱中建立马克思主义心理学。然而，维果茨基在未发表的笔记中否定了将马克思主义与心理学联系起来的“引用方法”，并明确指出了他认为马克思主义的基本方法论原则可能有助于心理学理论建设的方式：

Citations of Marxist classics were sometimes used to excess by certain Soviet psychologists as they sought a means for building a Marxist psychology from the chaos of competing schools of thought. Yet in unpublished notes Vygotsky repudiated the “quotation method” of relating Marxism to psychology and made explicit the way in which he thought its basic methodological principles might contribute to theory-building in psychology:

我不想通过拼凑一大堆引文来发现心灵的本质。我想弄清楚科学应该如何建立，如何在学习了马克思的整个方法之后研究心灵 ……为了以普遍接受的科学方式创造这样一种可行的理论方法，必须发现特定现象领域的本质、它们变化的规律、它们的质和量特征以及它们的原因。必须制定与它们特别相关的范畴和概念——换句话说，创造自己的《资本论》 ……

I don’t want to discover the nature of mind by patching together a lot of quotations. I want to find out how science has to be built, to approach the study of the mind having learned the whole of Marx’s method . . . . In order to create such an enabling theory-method in the generally accepted scientific manner, it is necessary to discover the essence of the given area of phenomena, the laws according to which they change, their qualitative and quantitative characteristics, their causes. It is necessary to formulate the categories and concepts that are specifically relevant to them—in other words, to create one’s own Capital .

整部《资本论》 是按照以下方法写成的：马克思分析资本主义社会的一个活“细胞”——例如价值的性质。在这个细胞中，他发现了整个系统的结构及其所有经济制度。他说，对于外行人来说，这种分析可能看起来像是一团模糊的、微小的细节。事实上，可能存在微小的细节，但它们正是“微观解剖学”所必需的。任何人如果能发现什么是“心理”细胞——产生哪怕一个反应的机制——就会找到整个心理学的钥匙，[从未发表的笔记本中]

The whole of Capital is written according to the following method: Marx analyzes a single living “cell” of capitalist society—for example, the nature of value. Within this cell he discovers the structure of the entire system and all of its economic institutions. He says that to a layman this analysis may seem a murky tangle of tiny details. Indeed, there may be tiny details, but they are exactly those which are essential to “microanatomy.” Anyone who could discover what a “psychological” cell is—the mechanism producing even a single response—would thereby find the key to psychology as a whole, [from unpublished notebooks]

仔细阅读这份手稿，我们就能令人信服地证明维果茨基的真诚以及他所开发的框架的成果。

A careful reading of this manuscript provides convincing proof of both Vygotsky’s sincerity and the fruitfulness of the framework he developed.

智力和社会环境

THE INTELLECTUAL AND SOCIAL SETTING

在 20 世纪20年代的苏联，研究人性的发展和历史方法并非维果茨基所独有。在心理学领域，一位年长的同事 P.P. 布朗斯基已经采纳了这样的观点，即要理解复杂的心理功能，就需要进行发展分析。3 维 果茨基从布朗斯基那里获得了这样的观点：“行为只能作为行为的历史来理解。”布朗斯基也是这种观点的早期倡导者，即人们的技术活动是理解其心理构成的关键，维果茨基对这一观点进行了深入的阐释。

Developmental and historical approaches to the study of human nature were not unique to Vygotsky in the Soviet Union in the 1920s. Within psychology, an older colleague, P. P. Blonsky, had already adopted the position that an understanding of complex mental functions requires developmental analysis.3 From Blonsky Vygotsky adopted the notion that “behavior can be understood only as the history of behavior.” Blonsky was also an early advocate of the view that the technological activities of people were a key to understanding their psychological makeup, a view that Vygotsky exploited in great detail.

维果茨基和当时的许多其他苏联理论家也深受西欧社会学家和人类学家的影响，如图恩瓦尔德和列维-布吕尔4 ， 他们对从原始人智力活动的人类学证据中重建的心理过程历史很感兴趣。本书中引用的资料很少，无法反映维果茨基对从历史角度理解心理过程发展的兴趣程度。他的这方面工作在1930 年与 AR 卢里亚共同出版的《行为史研究》一书中得到了特别关注。 这成为卢里亚在 1931 年和 1932 年两次前往中亚探险的动力，其成果在维果茨基去世后很久才发表。5

Vygotsky and many other Soviet theorists of the day were also heavily influenced by the work of western European sociologists and anthropologists, like Thurnwald and Levy-Bruhl,4 who were interested in the history of mental processes as reconstructed from anthropological evidence of the intellectual activity of primitive peoples. The scant references in this book are a pale reflection of the extent of Vygotsky’s interest in the development of mental processes understood historically. This aspect of his work received special attention in a publication titled Studies in the History of Behavior published jointly with A. R. Luria in 1930. It served as the impetus for Luria’s two expeditions to Central Asia in, 1931 and 1932, the results of which were published long after Vygotsky’s death.5

这种对历史的重视在苏联语言学中也很流行，他们的兴趣集中在语言的起源及其对思想发展的影响问题上。语言学的讨论涉及的概念与维果茨基的概念相似，也与当时在美国颇具影响力的萨丕尔和沃尔夫的作品相似。

This historical emphasis was also popular in Soviet linguistics, where interest centered on the problem of the origin of language and its influence on the development of thought. Discussions in linguistics dealt with concepts similar to Vygotsky’s and also similar to the work of Sapir and Whorf, who were then becoming influential in the United States.

虽然了解 20 世纪 30 年代的学术问题有助于理解维果茨基对人类认知的研究方法，但了解当时苏联的社会政治条件也是必不可少的。维果茨基所处的社会重视科学，并对科学能够解决苏联人民迫切的经济和社会问题寄予厚望。心理学理论的研究离不开政府对科学家的实际要求，维果茨基广泛的研究清楚地表明，他关心的是创造一种与教育和医疗实践相关的心理学。对维果茨基来说，在应用背景下进行理论工作的需要并不矛盾。他的职业生涯始于文学教师，他的许多早期文章都涉及教育实践问题，尤其是对智力和身体残疾者的教育。他是莫斯科缺陷学研究所的创始人，并在整个工作生涯中一直与该研究所保持着联系。维果茨基在先天性失明、失语症和严重智力障碍等医学问题中看到了理解所有人的心理过程和制定治疗和补救计划的机会。因此，这与他的一般理论观点一致，即他的工作应该在一个寻求消除文盲和建立教育计划以最大限度地发挥每个儿童潜力的社会中进行。

While an acquaintance with academic issues of the 1930s is helpful to understanding Vygotsky’s approach to human cognition, a consideration of sociopolitical conditions during this time in the Soviet Union is essential as well. Vygotsky worked within a society that put a premium on science and had high hopes for the ability of science to solve the pressing economic and social problems of the Soviet people. Psychological theory could not be pursued apart from the practical demands made on scientists by the government, and the broad spectrum of Vygotsky’s work clearly shows his concern with producing a psychology that would have relevance for education and medical practice. For Vygotsky, the need to carry on theoretical work in an applied context posed no contradiction whatsoever. He had begun his career as a teacher of literature, and many of his early articles had dealt with problems of educational practice, especially education of the mentally and physically handicapped. He had been a founder of the Institute of Defectology in Moscow, with which he was associated throughout his working life. In such medical problems as congenital blindness, aphasia, and severe mental retardation Vygotsky saw opportunities both for understanding the mental processes of all people and for establishing programs of treatment and remediation. Thus, it was consistent with his general theoretical view that his work should be carried out in a society that sought the elimination of illiteracy and the founding of educational programs to maximize the potential of individual children.

维果茨基参与了关于表述的辩论 马克思主义心理学的兴起使他在 20 世纪 20 年代末和 30 年代初卷入了激烈的争论。在这些讨论中，意识形态、心理学和政策错综复杂地交织在一起，因为不同的团体争夺代表心理学的权利。随着科尔尼洛夫于 1930 年被赶出心理研究所，维果茨基和他的学生一度占据了优势，但他从未被公认为官方领袖。

Vygotsky’s participation in the debates surrounding the formulation of a Marxist psychology embroiled him in fierce disputes in the late 1920s and early 1930s. In these discussions ideology, psychology, and policy were intricately intertwined, as different groups vied for the right to represent psychology. With Kornilov’s ouster from the Institute of Psychology in 1930, Vygotsky and his students were for a brief time in the ascendancy, but he was never recognized as the official leader.

在他去世前的几年里，维果茨基就教育问题发表了大量演讲和文章，经常使用“教育学”一词，大致翻译为“教育心理学”。总的来说，他鄙视强调智力测试的教育学，这种测试模仿了当时在西欧和美国越来越流行的智商测试。他雄心勃勃地希望按照本书第 6 章所建议的思路改革教育学 ，但他的野心远远超出了他的能力范围。维果茨基被错误地指控为提倡大规模心理测试，并被批评为“大俄罗斯沙文主义者”，因为他认为无文盲人群（例如生活在中亚非工业化地区的人群）尚未发展出与现代文明相关的智力能力。他去世两年后，共产党中央委员会颁布法令，停止苏联的所有心理测试。与此同时，所有主要的心理学期刊都停刊了近二十年。思想的发酵和实验时期就此结束。

In the years just prior to his death Vygotsky lectured and wrote extensively on problems of education, often using the term “pedology,” which roughly translates as “educational psychology.” In general he was scornful of pedology that emphasized tests of intellectual ability patterned after the IQ tests then gaining prominence in western Europe and the United States. It was his ambition to reform pedology along the lines suggested in chapter 6 in this volume, but his ambition far exceeded his grasp. Vygotsky was mistakenly accused of advocating mass psychological testing and criticized as a “Great Russian chauvinist” for suggesting that nonliterate peoples (such as those living in nonindustrialized sections of central Asia) had not yet developed the intellectual capacities associated with modern civilization. Two years following his death the Central Committee of the Communist Party issued a decree halting all psychological testing in the Soviet Union. At the same time all leading psychological journals ceased publication for almost twenty years. A period of intellectual ferment and experimentation was at an end.

但维果茨基的思想并没有随他而去。在他去世前，他和他的学生在哈尔科夫建立了一个实验室，由 AN 列昂季耶夫（现任莫斯科大学心理学系主任）领导，后来由 AV 扎波罗热茨（现任学前教育研究所所长）领导。卢里亚在 20 世纪 30 年代后期完成了医学培训，并继续在发展心理学和神经心理学领域开展他举世闻名的开创性工作。维果茨基的许多前学生在苏联教育科学院缺陷学研究所和心理学研究所以及莫斯科大学等大学的心理学系担任领导职务。

But by no means did Vygotsky’s ideas die with him. Even before his death he and his students established a laboratory in Kharkov headed by A. N. Leontiev (currently Dean of the Psychology Faculty at Moscow University) and later by A. V. Zaporozhets (now Director of the Institute of Preschool Education). Luria completed his medical training in the latter half of the 1930s and went on to carry out his world-famous pioneering work in developmental and neuropsychology. Many of Vygotsky’s former students hold leading positions in the Institute of Defectology and the Institute of Psychology within the Soviet Academy of Pedagogical Sciences, as well as university departments of psychology such as that at Moscow University.

查阅任何一本苏联心理学研究汇编就会发现，维果茨基一直影响着与认知过程及其发展和消解相关的各种基础和应用领域的研究。他的思想一直受到质疑，甚至他的学生也持质疑态度，但他的思想仍然是苏联心理学思想中活跃的一部分。

As inspection of any compendium of Soviet psychological research will show, Vygotsky continued and continues to influence research in a wide variety of basic and applied areas related to cognitive processes, their development and dissolution. His ideas have not gone unchallenged, even by his students, but they remain a living part of Soviet psychological thought.

维果茨基对实验方法的运用

VYGOTSKY’S USE OF THE EXPERIMENTAL METHOD

维果茨基在文中引用的实验室实验有时会让读者感到不安。他几乎没有提供原始数据，总结也非常笼统。记录观察结果是否反映“真实”效果的统计检验在哪里？这些研究证明了什么？它们是否真的支持了维果茨基的一般理论？还是尽管他声明过，但他只是以推测的方式进行心理学研究，而没有对他的核心命题进行实证检验？那些对大多数美国实验室的实验心理学方法论深有体会的人可能倾向于在维果茨基的研究中不使用“实验”一词，认为它们不过是一些有趣的演示或试点研究。从很多方面来看，它们确实如此。

Vygotsky’s references in the text to experiments conducted in his laboratory sometimes leave readers with a sense of unease. He presents almost no raw data and summaries are quite general. Where are the statistical tests that record whether or not observations reflect “real” effects? What do these studies prove? Do they in fact lend any support to Vygotsky’s general theories, or is he, in spite of his disclaimers, conducting psychology in a speculative manner without subjecting his central propositions to empirical test? Those steeped in the methodology of experimental psychology as practiced in most American laboratories may be inclined to withhold the term “experiment” from Vygotsky’s studies and consider them to be little more than interesting demonstrations or pilot studies. And so, in many respects, they were.

我们发现，牢记本书所依据手稿的性质很有用。它们不是一系列研究报告，从中可以推断出一般命题。相反，在这些著作中，维果茨基关心的是提出他的理论和方法的基本原则。他利用了非常有限的实证研究来说明和支持这些原则。对具体研究的描述是示意性的，研究结果通常以一般结论而不是原始数据的形式给出。其中一些研究已由他的学生更详细地发表，其中一些研究有英文版。6然而 ，大多数研究都是由学生作为试点调查进行的，从未准备发表。维果茨基的实验室只存在了十年，他随时可能死于肺结核。他的理论的含义如此之多，如此多样，而时间又如此短暂，以至于所有的精力都集中在开辟新的研究路线上，而不是最大限度地追求任何特定的路线。这项任务留给了维果茨基的学生和他们的继任者，他们以不同的方式采纳了他的观点，将其融入新的研究领域。7然而 ，这些论文中的实验风格不仅仅是对当时紧迫条件的回应。维果茨基的实验概念与美国心理学不同，理解这种差异对于理解维果茨基对当代认知心理学的贡献非常重要。

We have found it useful to keep in mind the nature of the manuscripts that are the basis of this book. They do not constitute a report of a series of research studies from which general propositions are extrapolated. Rather, in these writings Vygotsky was concerned with presenting the basic principles of his theory and method. He drew upon the very limited pool of empirical work available to him in order to illustrate and support these principles. The description of specific studies is schematic and findings are often given as general conclusions rather than as raw data. Some of the studies referred to have been published in greater detail by his students and a few are available in English.6 Most studies, however, were conducted by students as pilot investigations and were never prepared for publication. Vygotsky’s laboratory existed for only a decade and his death from tuberculosis was expected at any time. The implications of his theory were so many and varied, and time was so short, that all energy was concentrated on opening up new lines of investigation rather than pursuing any particular line to the fullest. That task remained for Vygotsky’s students and their successors, who adopted his views in varying ways, incorporating them into new lines of research.7 However, the style of experimentation in these essays represents more than a response to the urgent conditions in which they were conducted. Vygotsky’s concept of the experiment differed from that of American psychology, and understanding this difference is important for an appreciation of Vygotsky’s contribution to contemporary cognitive psychology.

正如每个入门实验课程的学生都知道的那样，传统实验的目的是确定 控制行为的条件。方法论遵循这一目标：实验假设预测刺激材料或任务的某些方面，这些方面将决定反应的特定方面；实验者寻求对材料、任务和反应的最大控制，以测试预测。反应的量化为跨实验比较和推断因果关系提供了基础。简而言之，实验旨在在最大程度提高其可解释性的条件下产生一定的性能。

As every student of an introductory experimental course knows, the purpose of an experiment as conventionally presented is to determine the conditions controlling behavior. Methodology follows from this objective: the experimental hypothesis predicts aspects of the stimulus materials or task that will determine particular aspects of the response; the experimenter seeks maximum control over materials, task, and response in order to test the prediction. Quantification of responses provides the basis for comparison across experiments and for drawing inferences about cause-and-effect relationships. The experiment, in short, is designed to produce a certain performance under conditions that maximize its interpretability.

对于维果茨基来说，实验的对象则完全不同。他的基本方法的原理（本卷第 5 章介绍 ）并非源自对既定实验实践的纯粹方法论批判；而是源自他关于高级心理过程性质的理论以及心理学的科学解释任务。如果高级心理过程在学习和发展过程中出现并发生变化，心理学只有通过确定其起源并绘制其历史才能完全理解它们。乍一看，这样的任务似乎排除了实验方法，需要长期研究个人行为。但维果茨基相信（并巧妙地证明）实验可以发挥重要作用，使通常隐藏在习惯行为表面之下的过程可见。他写道，在一个构思正确的实验中，研究人员可以创建“将给定功能的实际发展过程缩减”的过程。他将这种研究方法称为“实验遗传学”方法，他与海因茨·沃纳（Heinz Werner）共享了这个术语，海因茨·沃纳是一位杰出的同时代人，其发展和比较心理学方法为维果茨基所熟知。

For Vygotsky, the object of experimentation is quite different. The principles of his basic approach (presented in chapter 5 of this volume) do not stem from a purely methodological critique of established experimental practices; they flow from his theory of the nature of higher psychological processes and the task of scientific explanation in psychology. If higher psychological processes arise and undergo changes in the course of learning and development, psychology will only fully understand them by determining their origin and mapping their history. At first sight it would appear that such a task precludes the experimental method and requires study of individual behavior over long periods of time. But Vygotsky believed (and ingeniously demonstrated) that the experiment could serve an important role by making visible processes that are ordinarily hidden beneath the surface of habitual behavior. He wrote that in a properly conceived experiment the investigator could create processes that “telescope the actual course of development of a given function.” He called this method of investigation the “experimental-genetic” method, a term he shared with Heinz Werner, an outstanding contemporary whose developmental, comparative approach to psychology was well-known to Vygotsky.

为了成为研究“过程发展过程”的有效手段，实验必须为受试者提供最大机会，让他们参与各种可观察的活动，而不仅仅是严格控制。维果茨基为此目的有效使用的一种技巧是将障碍或困难引入任务中，以扰乱常规的解决问题方法。例如，在研究儿童的交流和自我中心言语功能时，维果茨基设置了一个任务情境，要求儿童与其他不讲同一种语言的人（讲外国语的儿童或聋哑儿童）进行合作活动。另一种方法是提供解决问题的替代途径，包括各种材料（维果茨基称之为“外部辅助工具”），可以以不同的方式使用以满足任务的要求。通过仔细观察所做的使用， 维果茨基试图通过研究不同年龄、不同任务难度的儿童使用这些外部辅助工具，重建儿童在成长过程中通常出现的一系列智力变化。第三种方法是给孩子布置一项超出其知识和能力的任务，以发现新技能的初步发展。这一方法在写作研究中得到了很好的说明（第 7 章 ），在这项研究中，幼儿被提供铅笔和纸，并被要求对事件进行表述，从而向研究者揭示了孩子对图形符号本质的最早理解。

To serve as an effective means of studying “the course of development of process,” the experiment must provide maximum opportunity for the subject to engage in a variety of activities that can be observed, not just rigidly controlled. One technique Vygotsky effectively used for this purpose was to introduce obstacles or difficulties into the task that disrupted routine methods of problem solving. For example, in studying children’s communication and the function of egocentric speech Vygotsky set up a task situation that required children to engage in cooperative activity with others who did not share their language (foreign-speaking or deaf children). Another method was to provide alternative routes to problem solving, including a variety of materials (Vygotsky called them “external aids") that could be used in different ways to satisfy the demands of the task. By careful observation of the uses made of these external aids by children at different ages under different conditions of task difficulty, Vygotsky sought to reconstruct the series of changes in intellectual operations that normally unfold during the course of the child’s biographical development. A third technique was to set a task before the child that exceeded his knowledge and abilities, in order to discover the rudimentary beginnings of new skills. This procedure is well illustrated in studies on writing (chapter 7 ), in which young toddlers were provided with pencil and paper and asked to make representations of events, thus disclosing to the investigator the child’s earliest understanding of the nature of graphic symbolism.

通过所有这些程序，实验提供的关键数据不是表现水平本身，而是实现表现的方法。传统实验工作（侧重于表现）与维果茨基工作（侧重于过程）之间的对比在美国研究人员最近对儿童记忆的研究中得到了当代体现。许多研究（包括我们自己的一些研究）向不同年龄段的儿童提供了要记住的单词列表，并分析了诸如回忆的单词数量和回忆顺序等表现指标。根据这些指标，研究人员试图推断幼儿是否以及在多大程度上参与组织活动作为一种记忆策略。另一方面，约翰·弗拉维尔和他的同事使用与维果茨基学生非常相似的程序，为孩子们提供要记忆的材料，并指示他们做任何他们想做的事情来帮助他们记忆。然后，他们观察了孩子们对物品进行分类的尝试、他们所做的分组类型，以及儿童在记忆中倾向于使用组织策略的其他指标。和维果茨基一样，核心问题是：孩子们在做什么？他们如何满足任务要求？

With all these procedures the critical data furnished by the experiment is not performance level as such but the methods by which the performance is achieved. The contrast between conventional experimental work (focusing on performance) and Vygotsky’s work (focusing on process) has its contemporary expression in recent studies on children’s memory by American investigators. Many studies (including a number of our own) have presented children of various ages with lists of words to be remembered and have analyzed such performance measures as number of words recalled and the order of recall. From these indicators the investigators have sought to make inferences about whether or not, and to what extent, young children engage in organizing activities as a memory strategy. On the other hand, John Flavell and his colleagues, using procedures very much like those of Vygotsky’s students, provided children the materials to be remembered, and instructed them to do whatever they wanted to help them remember. They then observed children’s attempts at classifying the items, the kinds of grouping they made, and other indices of children’s tendency to use organizational strategies in remembering. As with Vygotsky, the central question is: What are the children doing? How are they trying to satisfy task demands?

就此而言，我们想澄清一下维果茨基理论方法和实验方法的一个基本概念，我们认为这个概念被广泛误解了。在文中的几个地方，维果茨基在提到行为结构时使用了一个我们翻译为“中介”的术语。有时，这个术语会伴随着一个图形，描绘刺激、反应和它们之间的“中介环节”（例如，SXR）。同样的术语和几乎同样的图表在 20 世纪 30 年代末被引入美国学习理论，并在 20 世纪 50 年代变得非常流行，因为人们试图将学习的刺激-反应理论扩展到复杂的人类行为，尤其是语言。重要的是要记住，维果茨基 维果茨基不是 刺激反应学习理论家，也不打算在这种背景下思考他的中介行为理论。他想通过这个概念传达的是，在人类行为的高级形式中，个体会主动改变刺激情况，作为对其作出反应的过程的一部分。正是这种活动的整个结构产生了维果茨基试图用“中介”一词来表示的行为。

In this connection we would like to clarify a basic concept of Vygotsky’s theoretical approach and experimental method that we believe has been widely misinterpreted. In several places in the text Vygotsky, in referring to the structure of behavior, uses a term that we have translated as “mediated.” Occasionally this term is accompanied by a figure depicting a stimulus, a response, and a “mediating link” between them (for example, S-X-R). The same term, and virtually the same diagram, were introduced into American learning theory in the late 1930s and became very popular in the 1950s as attempts were made to extend stimulus-response theories of learning to complex human behavior, especially language. It is important to keep in mind that Vygotsky was not a stimulus-response learning theorist and did not intend his idea of mediated behavior to be thought of in this context. What he did intend to convey by this notion was that in higher forms of human behavior, the individual actively modifies the stimulus situation as a part of the process of responding to it. It was the entire structure of this activity which produced the behavior that Vygotsky attempted to denote by the term “mediating."

维果茨基的理论方法和实验方法有几个含义。其一是实验结果在本质上既是定性的又是定量的。基于仔细观察的详细描述将构成实验结果的重要组成部分。对某些人来说，这些结果可能只是轶事；维果茨基坚持认为，如果客观地、科学地进行，这些观察就具有经过验证的事实的地位。

Several implications follow from Vygotsky’s theoretical approach and method of experimentation. One is that experimental results will be qualitative as well as quantitative in nature. Detailed descriptions, based on careful observation, will constitute an important part of experimental findings. To some, such findings may seem merely anecdotal; Vygotsky maintained that if carried out objectively and with scientific rigor, such observations have the status of validated fact.

这种新的实验方法的另一个结果是打破了传统上在“实验室”和“现场”之间建立的一些障碍。实验干预和观察在游戏、学校和临床环境中的执行效果可能与在心理学家的实验室中一样好甚至更好。本书中报道的敏感观察和富有想象力的干预证明了这种可能性。

Another consequence of this new approach to experimentation is to break down some of the barriers that are traditionally erected between “laboratory” and “field.” Experimental interventions and observations may often be as well or better executed in play, school, and clinical settings than in the psychologist’s laboratory. The sensitive observations and imaginative interventions reported in this book attest to this possibility.

最后，与传统方法相比，旨在追溯心理功能发展历史的实验方法更适合与社会科学中涉及历史的其他方法（包括文化史、社会史以及儿童史）搭配使用。对维果茨基来说，人类学和社会学研究是观察和实验的合作伙伴，共同致力于解释人类意识和智力的发展。

Finally, an experimental method that seeks to trace the history of the development of psychological functions sits more comfortably than the classical method alongside other methods in the social sciences concerned with history—including the history of culture and society as well as the history of the child. To Vygotsky, anthropological and sociological studies were partners with observation and experiment in the grand enterprise of accounting for the progress of human consciousness and intellect.



LS 维果茨基传记

Biographical Note on

L. S. Vygotsky

列夫·谢苗诺维奇·维果茨基 1896 年 11 月 5 日出生于白俄罗斯明斯克东北部的奥尔沙镇。1913 年，他以金牌成绩从戈梅利中学毕业。1917 年，他从莫斯科大学文学专业毕业后，开始从事文学研究。

Lev Semyonovitch Vygotsky was born November 5, 1896, in the town of Orsha, northeast of Minsk in Byelorussia. In 1913 he completed gymnasium in Gomel with a gold medal. In 1917, after graduating from Moscow University with a specialization in literature, he began his literary research.

1917 年至 1923 年，维果茨基在戈梅利的一所学校教授文学和心理学，同时还担任成人教育中心戏剧部的主任，并就文学和科学问题发表过许多演讲和讲座。在此期间，维果茨基创办了文学杂志《Verask》 。他在这里发表了自己的第一篇文学研究论文，后来重新出版为《艺术心理学》 。他还在师范学院建立了一个心理学实验室，在那里开设了一门心理学课程，课程内容后来发表在《教育心理学》上。

From 1917 to 1923 Vygotsky taught literature and psychology in a school in Gomel, where he also directed the theater section of the adult education center and gave many speeches and lectures on problems of literature and science. During this period Vygotsky founded the literary journal Verask . Here he published his first literary research, later reissued as The Psychology of Art . He also founded a psychological laboratory in the Teacher Training Institute, where he gave a course on psychology, the contents of which were later published in Pedagogical Psychology

1924 年，维果茨基移居莫斯科，先在心理学研究所工作，随后又在自己创办的缺陷学研究所工作。同时，他还在 Narcompros（人民教育委员会）领导一个身体缺陷和智力迟钝儿童教育系，并在克鲁普斯卡娅共产主义教育学院、莫斯科第二大学（后来的莫斯科国立师范学院）和列宁格勒赫尔岑教育学院教授课程。1925 年至 1934 年间，维果茨基身边聚集了一大批在心理学、缺陷学和精神异常领域工作的年轻科学家。对医学的兴趣使维果茨基同时接受了医学培训，先是在莫斯科的医学院，后来在哈尔科夫， 他在乌克兰心理神经学院开设了一门心理学课程。去世前不久，维果茨基被邀请担任全苏实验医学研究所心理学系主任。1934 年 6 月 11 日，他因肺结核去世。

In 1924 Vygotsky moved to Moscow and began to work first at the Institute of Psychology and then in the Institute of Defectology, which he founded. At the same time he directed a department for the education of physically defective and mentally retarded children in Narcompros (Peoples Committee on Education), and taught courses in the Krupskaya Academy of Communist Education, the Second Moscow State University (later the Moscow State Pedagogical Institute), and the Hertzen Pedagogical Institute in Leningrad. Between 1925 and 1934 Vygotsky gathered around him a large group of young scientists working in the areas of psychology, defectology, and mental abnormality. An interest in medicine led Vygotsky simultaneously to undertake medical training, first in the medical institute in Moscow and later in Kharkov, where he gave a psychology course in the Ukrainian Psychoneurological Academy. Not long before his death Vygotsky was invited to head the department of psychology in the All-Union Institute of Experimental Medicine. He died of tuberculosis June 11, 1934.

基于“增大化现实”技术

A. R. Luria

第一部分 / 社会中的心智

Part One / Mind in Society

基础理论和数据

Basic Theory and Data

1

1

儿童发展中的工具和符号

Tool and Symbol in Child Development

本书的主要目的是描述人类行为的独特方面，并对这些特征在人类历史进程中的形成方式以及它们在个人一生中的发展方式提出假设。

The primary purpose of this book is to characterize the uniquely human aspects of behavior, and to offer hypotheses about the way these traits have been formed in the course of human history and the way they develop over an individual’s lifetime.

这一分析将涉及三个基本问题：（1）人类与自然环境和社会环境之间的关系是什么？（2）哪些新的活动形式促成了劳动成为人类与自然联系的基本手段，这些活动形式会产生哪些心理影响？（3）工具的使用与语言的发展之间的关系性质是什么？研究动物和人类心理的学者尚未对这些问题进行全面研究。

This analysis will be concerned with three fundamental issues: (1) What is the relation between human beings and their environment, both physical and social? (2) What new forms of activity were responsible for establishing labor as the fundamental means of relating humans to nature and what are the psychological consequences of these forms of activity? (3) What is the nature of the relationship between the use of tools and the development of speech? None of these questions has been fully treated by scholars concerned with understanding animal and human psychology.

卡尔·斯图姆夫是二十世纪初著名的德国心理学家，他的研究建立在与我在这里所采用的完全不同的前提之上。1他 将儿童研究与植物学研究进行了比较，并强调了发育的植物学特征，他认为植物学特征与整个有机体的成熟有关。

Karl Stumpf, a prominent German psychologist in the early years of the twentieth century, based his studies on a set of premises completely different from those I will employ here.1 He compared the study of children to the study of botany, and stressed the botanical character of development, which he associated with maturation of the whole organism.

事实上，成熟本身是人类最复杂、最独特的行为形式发展过程中的次要因素。这些行为的发展特点是，一种行为形式向另一种行为形式进行复杂的定性转变（或者，用黑格尔的话来说，是量变到质变）。成熟作为一个被动过程的概念不足以描述这些复杂的现象。然而，正如 A. Gesell 恰当地指出的那样 指出，在我们的发展方法中，我们继续使用植物学类比来描述儿童发展（例如，我们说儿童的早期教育发生在“幼儿园”）。2最近 ，一些心理学家建议必须抛弃这种植物学模型。

The fact is that maturation per se is a secondary factor in the development of the most complex, unique forms of human behavior. The development of these behaviors is characterized by complicated, qualitative transformations of one form of behavior into another (or, as Hegel would phrase it, a transformation of quantity into quality). The conception of maturation as a passive process cannot adequately describe these complex phenomena. Nevertheless, as A. Gesell has aptly pointed out, in our approaches to development we continue to use the botanical analogy in our description of child development (for example, we say that the early education of children takes place in a “kinder-garten").2 Recently several psychologists have suggested that this botanical model must be abandoned.

为了回应这种批评，现代心理学通过采用动物模型作为理解儿童发展的新方法的基础，登上了科学的阶梯。儿童心理学曾经被植物学所束缚，现在却被动物学所吸引。这些新模型所依据的观察结果几乎完全来自动物界，而有关儿童的问题的答案则在对动物进行的实验中寻找。动物实验的结果和用于获得这些结果的程序都从动物实验室进入了育儿室。

In response to this kind of criticism, modern psychology has ascended the ladder of science by adopting zoological models as the basis for a new general approach to understanding the development of children. Once the captive of botany, child psychology is now mesmerized by zoology. The observations on which these newer models draw come almost entirely from the animal kingdom, and answers to questions about children are sought in experiments carried out on animals. Both the results of experiments with animals and the procedures used to obtain these results are finding their way from the animal laboratory into the nursery.

儿童心理学与动物心理学的这种融合对人类行为生物学基础的研究做出了重大贡献。人们已经建立了儿童行为与动物行为之间的许多联系，特别是在基本心理过程的研究中。但现在出现了一个悖论。当植物模型流行时，心理学家强调高级心理功能的独特性以及通过实验手段研究它们的难度。但是，这种对高级智力过程（即人类独有的过程）的动物学方法，却导致心理学家将高级智力功能解释为动物相应过程的直接延续。这种理论化风格在儿童实践智力的分析中尤为明显，其中最重要的方面涉及儿童对工具的使用。

This convergence of child and animal psychology has contributed significantly to the study of the biological basis of human behavior. Many links between child and animal behavior, particularly in the study of elementary psychological processes, have been established. But a paradox has now emerged. When the botanical model was fashionable, psychologists emphasized the unique character of higher psychological functions and the difficulty of studying them by experimental means. But this zoological approach to the higher intellectual processes—those processes that are uniquely human—has led psychologists to interpret the higher intellectual functions as a direct continuation of corresponding processes in animals. This style of theorizing is particularly apparent in the analysis of practical intelligence in children, the most important aspect of which concerns the child’s use of tools.

动物和儿童的实用智力

PRACTICAL INTELLIGENCE IN ANIMALS AND CHILDREN

沃尔夫冈·科勒的研究在实践智力研究中具有特别重要的意义。3第一次世界大战 期间，他用猿猴进行了许多实验，并偶尔将他对黑猩猩行为的一些观察结果与儿童的某些特定反应进行比较。儿童的实践智力与猿猴的类似反应之间的这种直接类比成为了该领域实验工作的指导原则。

The work of Wolfgang Köhler is particularly significant in the study of practical intelligence.3 He conducted many experiments with apes during World War I, and occasionally compared some of his observations of chimpanzees’ behavior with particular kinds of responses in children. This direct analogy between practical intelligence in the child and similar response by apes became the guiding principle of experimental work in the field.

K. Buhler 的研究也试图建立儿童和猿类之间的相似性。4他 研究了幼儿抓握物体的方式， 他们在追求目标时绕路的能力，以及他们使用原始工具的方式。这些观察以及他让幼儿从棍子上取下环的实验，都说明了一种类似于科勒的方法。布勒将儿童的实践智力表现解释为与我们熟悉的黑猩猩的实践智力表现完全相同。事实上，儿童生命中有一个阶段被布勒称为“黑猩猩时代”（第 48 页）。他研究的一个 10 个月大的婴儿能够拉动绳子去拿附在绳子上的饼干。直到第二年中期，婴儿才出现通过抬起而不是试图向侧面拉来从柱子上取下环的能力。5 虽然这些实验被解读为支持儿童与猿类之间的类比，但它们也使布勒获得了重要的发现，这个发现将在后面的章节中阐述，那就是儿童实践智力的开端（他称之为“技术思维”），以及黑猩猩的行为，都与语言无关。

K. Buhler’s research also sought to establish similarities between child and ape.4 He studied the way in which young children grasp objects, their ability to make detours while pursuing a goal, and the manner in which they use primitive tools. These observations, as well as his experiment in which a young child is asked to remove a ring from a stick, illustrate an approach akin to Köhler’s. Buhler interpreted the manifestations of practical intelligence in children as being of exactly the same type as those we are familiar with in chimpanzees. Indeed, there is a phase in the life of the child that Buhler designated the “chimpanzee age” (p. 48). One ten-month-old infant whom he studied was able to pull a string to obtain a cookie that was attached to it. The ability to remove a ring from a post by lifting it rather than trying to pull it sideways did not appear until the middle of the second year.5 Although these experiments were interpreted as support for the analogy between the child and apes, they also led Buhler to the important discovery, which will be explicated in later sections, that the beginnings of practical intelligence in the child (he termed it “technical thinking"), as well as the actions of the chimpanzee, are independent of speech.

夏洛特·布勒对婴儿在生命第一年期间的详细观察进一步支持了这一结论。6她发现，实践智力的首次表现发生在六个月大的时候。然而 ，在儿童发展的历史中，此时不仅发展了工具的使用，还发展了系统性运动和感知、大脑和手——事实上，是儿童的整个有机体。因此，儿童的活动系统在每个特定阶段都由儿童的有机发展程度和他或她对工具使用的掌握程度决定 。

Charlotte Buhler’s detailed observations of infants during their first year of life gave further support to this conclusion.6 She found the first manifestations of practical intelligence took place at the very young age of six months. However, it is not only tool use that develops at this point in a child’s history but also systematic movement and perception, the brain and hands—in fact, the child’s entire organism. Consequently, the child’s system of activity is determined at each specific stage both by the child’s degree of organic development and by his or her degree of mastery in the use of tools .

K. Buhler 建立了一个重要的发展原则，即在智能语言的开始之前是技术思维，而技术思维构成了认知发展的初始阶段。他率先强调了儿童行为中类似黑猩猩的特征，后来许多人也效仿了这一观点。正是在推断这一观点时，动物模型和人类与动物行为之间的类比的危险得到了最清晰的表达。像 Buhler 那样专注于儿童发展中的前语言时期的研究，其缺陷并不大。然而，他从对幼儿的研究得出了一个值得怀疑的结论，他说：“黑猩猩的成就与语言完全无关，而对于人类来说，即使在以后的生活中，技术思维或工具思维与语言和概念的联系也远不如其他形式的思维紧密。” 7

K. Buhler established the developmentally important principle that the beginnings of intelligent speech are preceded by technical thinking, and technical thinking comprises the initial phase of cognitive development. His lead in emphasizing the chimpanzee-like features of children’s behavior has been followed by many others. It is in extrapolating this idea that the dangers of zoological models and analogies between human and animal behaviors find their clearest expression. The pitfalls are slight in research that focuses on the preverbal period in the child’s development, as Buhler’s did. However, he drew a questionable conclusion from his work with very young children when he stated, “The achievements of the chimpanzee are quite independent of language and in the case of man, even in later life, technical thinking, or thinking in terms of tools, is far less closely bound up with language and concepts than other forms of thinking.’7

Buhler 假设，实践智力和言语之间的关系是 10 个月大的婴儿的特征 孩子一生中智力活动都是完整的。这种假设智力活动独立于言语的分析与我们自己的研究结果相反，我们的研究结果揭示了言语和实践思维在发展过程中的融合。

Buhler proceeded from the assumption that the relationship between practical intelligence and speech that characterizes the ten-month-old child remains intact throughout her lifetime. This analysis postulating the independence of intelligent action from speech runs contrary to our own findings, which reveal the integration of speech and practical thinking in the course of development.

夏皮罗和格尔克根据模仿科勒对黑猩猩进行问题解决研究的实验，对儿童实践思维的发展进行了重要的分析。8他们 推测，儿童的实践思维在某些方面与成人思维相似，在其他方面则有所不同，并强调社会经验在人类发展中的主导作用。在他们看来，社会经验通过模仿发挥作用；当儿童模仿成人使用工具和物品的方式时，她就掌握了特定活动所涉及的原理。他们认为，重复的动作会像多重曝光照片一样堆积起来；共同特征变得清晰，差异变得模糊。结果是一个结晶的方案，一个明确的活动原则。随着经验的增加，儿童会获得更多她能理解的模型。这些模型代表了所有类似动作的精致累积设计；同时，它们也是未来可能采取的行动类型的粗略蓝图。

Shapiro and Gerke offer an important analysis of the development of practical thinking in children based upon experiments modeled after Köhler’s problem-solving studies with chimpanzees.8 They theorize that children’s practical thinking is similar to adult thought in certain respects and different in others, and emphasize the dominant role of social experience in human development. In their view, social experience exerts its effect through imitation; when the child imitates the way adults use tools and objects, she masters the very principle involved in a particular activity. They suggest that repeated actions pile up, one upon another, as in a multi-exposure photograph; the common traits become clear and the differences become blurred. The result is a crystalized scheme, a definite principle of activity. The child, as she becomes more experienced, acquires a greater number of models that she understands. These models represent, as it were, a refined cumulative design of all similar actions; at the same time, they are also a rough blueprint for possible types of action in the future.

然而，夏皮罗和格尔克的适应性概念过于机械地与重复概念联系在一起。对他们来说，社会经验只能为儿童提供运动图式；他们没有考虑到儿童智力运作内部结构的变化。在对儿童解决问题的描述中，作者不得不指出“言语在成长中的儿童的实践和适应性努力中发挥的特殊作用”。但他们对这一作用的描述很奇怪。他们说：“言语取代并补偿了真正的适应性；它不是通向过去经验的桥梁，而是通向通过实验者实现的纯粹社会适应。”这种分析没有考虑到言语对实践活动新结构组织的发展所做的贡献。

However, Shapiro and Gerke’s notion of adaptation is too firmly linked to a mechanical conception of repetition. For them, social experience serves only to furnish the child with motor schemas; they do not take into account the changes occurring in the internal structure of the child’s intellectual operations. In their descriptions of children’s problem solving, the authors are forced to note the “specific role fulfilled by speech” in the practical and adaptive efforts of the growing child. But their description of this role is a strange one. “Speech,” they say, “replaces and compensates for real adaptation; it does not serve as a bridge leading to past experience but to a purely social adaptation which is achieved via the experimenter.” This analysis does not allow for the contribution speech makes to the development of a new structural organization of practical activity.

纪尧姆和迈耶森对语言在人类独特行为形式形成中的作用给出了不同的结论。9他们 通过对猿类使用工具进行的极其有趣的实验得出结论，猿类完成一项任务的方法在原则上与失语症患者（即丧失语言能力的人）的方法相似，并且在某些基本点上是一致的。他们的发现支持了我的假设： 言语在组织高级心理功能中起着至关重要的作用。10

Guillaume and Meyerson offer a different conclusion regarding the role of speech in the inception of uniquely human forms of behavior.9 From their extremely interesting experiments on tool use among apes, they concluded that the methods used by apes to accomplish a given task are similar in principle and coincide on certain essential points to those used by people suffering from aphasia (that is, individuals who are deprived of speech). Their findings support my assumption that speech plays an essential role in the organization of higher psychological functions.10

这些实验实例使我们回到了回顾儿童发展心理学理论的起点。布勒的实验表明，幼儿在语言发展之前的实践活动与猿猴相同，而纪尧姆和迈尔森则认为猿猴的行为与被剥夺语言能力的人的行为相似。这两项工作都让我们关注了解儿童在刚开始说话时的实践活动的重要性。我自己的工作以及我的合作者的工作都针对同样的问题。但我们的前提与以前的研究人员不同。我们的主要关注点是描述和具体说明人类特有的实践智力形式的发展。

These experimental examples bring us full circle to the beginning of our review of psychological theories regarding child development. Buhler’s experiments indicate that the practical activity of the young child prior to speech development is identical to that of the ape, and Guillaume and Meyerson suggest that the ape’s behavior is akin to that observed in people who are deprived of speech. Both of these lines of work focus our attention on the importance of understanding the practical activity of children at the age when they are just beginning to speak. My own work as well as that of my collaborators is directed at these same problems. But our premises differ from those of previous investigators. Our primary concern is to describe and specify the development of those forms of practical intelligence that are specifically human.

言语与工具使用之间的关系

RELATION BETWEEN SPEECH AND TOOL USE

在科勒对猿类进行的经典实验中，他证明了试图在动物身上发展哪怕是最基本的手势和象征操作都是徒劳的。他得出结论，猿类使用工具的能力与象征活动无关。进一步尝试在猿类身上培养生产性语言的能力也产生了负面结果。这些实验再次表明，动物的目的性行为与任何语言或使用手势的活动无关。

In his classic experiments with apes Köhler demonstrated the futility of attempting to develop even the most elementary sign and symbolic operations in animals. He concluded that tool use among apes is independent of symbolic activity. Further attempts to cultivate productive speech in the ape have also produced negative results. These experiments showed once more that the purposive behavior of the animal is independent of any speech or sign-using activity.

在研究实践智力的自然史时，将工具使用与符号使用分开研究是很常见的，研究儿童符号过程发展的心理学家也遵循了同样的程序。因此，言语的起源和发展，以及所有其他使用符号的活动，都被视为与儿童实践活动的组织无关。心理学家更愿意将符号使用的发展作为纯粹智力的例子来研究，而不是作为儿童发展史的产物。他们经常将符号使用归因于儿童自发发现符号与其含义之间的关系。正如 W. Stern 所说，认识到语言符号有意义的事实是“儿童一生中最伟大的发现”。11许多 作者将这个幸福的“时刻”定在孩子一岁和两岁之间的交界处，认为它是孩子心理活动的产物。人们认为，对言语和其他形式符号使用的发展进行详细研究 是不必要的。相反，人们通常认为 儿童的心灵包含未来智力发展的所有阶段；它们以完整的形式存在，等待适当的时机出现。

The study of tool use in isolation from sign use is common in research work on the natural history of practical intellect, and psychologists who studied the development of symbolic processes in the child have followed the same procedure. Consequently, the origin and development of speech, as well as all other sign-using activity, were treated as independent of the organization of the child’s practical activity. Psychologists preferred to study the development of sign use as an example of pure intellect and not as the product of the child’s developmental history. They often attributed sign use to the child’s spontaneous discovery of the relation between signs and their meanings. As W. Stern stated, recognition of the fact that verbal signs have meaning constitutes “the greatest discovery in the child’s life.”11 A number of authors fix this happy “moment” at the juncture of the child’s first and second year, regarding it as the product of the child’s mental activity. Detailed examination of the development of speech and other forms of sign use was assumed to be unnecessary. Instead, it has routinely been assumed that the child’s mind contains all stages of future intellectual development; they exist in complete form, awaiting the proper moment to emerge.

人们不仅认为语言和实践智力有不同的起源，而且它们共同参与共同的操作被认为没有基本的心理学意义（如 Shapiro 和 Gerke 的研究）。即使语言和使用工具在同一个操作中紧密相连，它们仍然被研究为属于两个完全不同现象类别的独立过程。它们同时发生最多被认为是偶然的外部因素的结果。

Not only were speech and practical intelligence assumed to have different origins, but their joint participation in common operations was considered to be of no basic psychological importance (as in the work of Shapiro and Gerke). Even when speech and the use of tools were closely linked in one operation, they were still studied as separate processes belonging to two completely different classes of phenomena. At best, their simultaneous occurrence was considered a consequence of accidental, external factors.

研究实践智力的学生以及研究言语发展的人常常未能认识到这两种功能的交织。因此，儿童的适应行为和使用手势的活动被视为平行现象——这一观点导致了皮亚杰的“自我中心”言语概念。12他 没有赋予言语在组织儿童活动方面发挥重要作用，也没有强调言语的交流功能，尽管他不得不承认言语在实践中的重要性。

The students of practical intelligence as well as those who study speech development often fail to recognize the interweaving of these two functions. Consequently, the children’s adaptive behavior and sign-using activity are treated as parallel phenomena—a view that leads to Piaget’s concept of “egocentric” speech.12 He did not attribute an important role to speech in the organization of the child’s activities, nor did he stress its communicative functions, although he was obliged to admit its practical importance.

虽然实践智力和符号使用在幼儿身上可以独立运作，但成年人身上这些系统的辩证统一正是人类复杂行为的本质。我们的分析认为，符号活动具有特定的组织 功能，它渗透到工具使用过程中，并产生了全新的行为形式。

Although practical intelligence and sign use can operate independently of each other in young children, the dialectical unity of these systems in the human adult is the very essence of complex human behavior. Our analysis accords symbolic activity a specific organizing function that penetrates the process of tool use and produces fundamentally new forms of behavior.

社会互动与实践活动转型

SOCIAL INTERACTION AND THE TRANSFORMATION OF PRACTICAL ACTIVITY

根据上一节的讨论，并结合后面将要描述的实验工作，可以得出以下结论：在智力发展过程中，产生纯粹人类形式的实践和抽象智力的最重要时刻，发生在语言和实践活动这两个以前完全独立的发展路线汇合之时 。尽管儿童在语言发育前使用工具的方式与猿类相当，但一旦语言和符号的使用融入到任何行动中，行动就会发生转变，并沿着全新的路线组织起来。人类对工具的特殊使用由此得以实现，超越了高等动物对工具的有限使用。

Based on the discussion in the previous section, and illustrated by experimental work to be described later, the following conclusion may be made: the most significant moment in the course of intellectual development, which gives birth to the purely human forms of practical and abstract intelligence, occurs when speech and practical activity, two previously completely independent lines of development, converge . Although children’s use of tools during their preverbal period is comparable to that of apes, as soon as speech and the use of signs are incorporated into any action, the action becomes transformed and organized along entirely new lines. The specifically human use of tools is thus realized, going beyond the more limited use of tools possible among the higher animals.

在掌握自己的行为之前，儿童开始借助语言掌握周围的环境。这不仅会形成新的行为组织，还会与环境建立新的关系。这些独特的人类行为形式的形成随后会产生智力，并成为生产性工作的基础：人类使用工具的特定形式。

Prior to mastering his own behavior, the child begins to master his surroundings with the help of speech. This produces new relations with the environment in addition to the new organization of behavior itself. The creation of these uniquely human forms of behavior later produce the intellect and become the basis of productive work: the specifically human form of the use of tools.

对处于与科勒的猿猴相似的实验情境中的儿童的观察表明，儿童不仅会采取行动 以试图实现目标，还会说话 。通常，这种说话是自发产生的，并且在整个实验过程中几乎不会中断。每当情况变得更加复杂并且目标变得更加难以实现时，说话就会增加并且更加持久。试图阻止它的尝试（正如我的合作者 RE Levina 的实验所表明的那样）要么是徒劳的，要么会导致孩子“僵住”。

Observations of children in an experimental situation similar to that of Köhler’s apes show that the children not only act in attempting to achieve a goal but also speak . As a rule this speech arises spontaneously and continues almost without interruption throughout the experiment. It increases and is more persistent every time the situation becomes more complicated and the goal more difficult to attain. Attempts to block it (as the experiments of my collaborator R. E. Levina have shown) are either futile or lead the child to “freeze up.’

列维娜向四五岁的孩子提出了一些实际问题，比如从橱柜里拿一块糖果。糖果放在孩子够不着的地方，孩子无法直接拿到。随着孩子越来越投入地试图拿糖果，“自我中心”的言语开始成为她积极努力的一部分。起初，这种言语包括对情况的描述和分析，但逐渐呈现出“有计划”的特点，反映了解决问题的可能途径。最后，它被纳入解决方案的一部分。

Levina posed practical problems for four- and five-year-old children such as obtaining a piece of candy from a cupboard. The candy was placed out of reach so the child could not obtain it directly. As the child got more and more involved in trying to obtain the candy, “egocentric” speech began to manifest itself as part of her active striving. At first this speech consisted of a description and analysis of the situation, but it gradually took on a “planful” character, reflecting possible paths to solution of the problem. Finally, it was included as part of the solution.

例如，一个四岁半的女孩被要求用凳子和棍子作为工具从橱柜里拿糖果。列维娜的描述如下：（站在凳子上，静静地看着，摸着架子上的棍子。）“在凳子上。”（瞥了一眼实验者。另一只手拿着棍子。）“那真的是糖果吗？”（犹豫了一下。）“我可以从另一张凳子上拿，站着拿。”（拿第二张凳子。）“不，那不行。我可以用棍子。”（拿起棍子，敲糖果。）“它现在会动了。”（敲糖果。）“它动了，我不能用凳子拿，但是，但是棍子有用。” 13

For example, a four-and-a-half-year-old girl was asked to get candy from a cupboard with a stool and a stick as possible tools. Levina’s description reads as follows: (Stands on a stool, quietly looking, feeling along a shelf with stick.) “On the stool.” (Glances at experimenter. Puts stick in other hand.) “Is that really the candy?” (Hesitates.) “I can get it from that other stool, stand and get it.” (Gets second stool.) “No, that doesn’t get it. I could use the stick.” (Takes stick, knocks at the candy.) “It will move now.” (Knocks candy.) “It moved, I couldn’t get it with the stool, but the, but the stick worked.”13

在这种情况下，孩子们在做事时说话似乎既自然又必要；我们在研究中发现，言语不仅伴随着实践活动，而且在实践活动中发挥着特殊的作用。我们的实验证明了两个重要事实：

In such circumstances it seems both natural and necessary for children to speak while they act; in our research we have found that speech not only accompanies practical activity but also plays a specific role in carrying it out. Our experiments demonstrate two important facts:

（1）在实现目标的过程中，儿童的言语与行动同样重要。儿童不仅谈论他们正在做的事情；他们的言语和行动是同一个复杂心理功能的一部分 ，旨在解决手头的问题。

(1) A child’s speech is as important as the role of action in attaining the goal. Children not only speak about what they are doing; their speech and action are part of one and the same complex psychological function , directed toward the solution of the problem at hand.

（2）情况要求采取的行动越复杂， 解决方案越不直接，言语在整个操作中发挥的作用就越大。有时言语变得如此重要，以至于如果不允许幼儿使用言语，他们就无法完成既定的任务。

(2) The more complex the action demanded by the situation and the less direct its solution, the greater the importance played by speech in the operation as a whole. Sometimes speech becomes of such vital importance that, if not permitted to use it, young children cannot accomplish the given task.
