这些观察让我得出这样的结论：儿童不仅用眼睛和手，还用语言来解决实际任务 。这种感知、语言和行动的统一最终产生了视野的内化，构成了对人类独特行为形式起源的任何分析的核心主题。

These observations lead me to the conclusion that children solve practical tasks with the help of their speech, as well as their eyes and hands . This unity of perception, speech, and action, which ultimately produces internalization of the visual field, constitutes the central subject matter for any analysis of the origin of uniquely human forms of behavior.

为了阐明这两点中的第一点，我们必须问：在解决实际问题时，说话的孩子的行为与猿类的行为到底有什么区别？

To develop the first of these two points, we must ask: What is it that really distinguishes the actions of the speaking child from the actions of an ape when solving practical problems?

实验者首先注意到的是，儿童的操作自由度要大得多 ，他们对具体视觉情境结构的独立性要大得多。借助语言，儿童创造出的可能性比猿类通过行动所能实现的可能性要大得多。这种更大灵活性的一个重要表现是，儿童能够忽略行动者和目标之间的直接联系。相反，他会采取一些初步行动，使用我们所说的工具性或中介（间接）方法。在解决任务的过程中，儿童能够包括不在直接视野范围内的刺激。使用单词（此类刺激的一类）来制定具体计划，儿童可以实现更广泛的活动范围，不仅将 手边的物体用作工具，还可以搜索和准备可用于解决任务的刺激，并规划未来的行动 。

The first thing that strikes the experimenter is the incomparably greater freedom of children’s operations, their greater independence from the structure of the concrete, visual situation. Children, with the aid of speech, create greater possibilities than apes can accomplish through action. One important manifestation of this greater flexibility is that the child is able to ignore the direct line between actor and goal. Instead, he engages in a number of preliminary acts, using what we speak of as instrumental, or mediated (indirect), methods. In the process of solving a task the child is able to include stimuli that do not lie within the immediate visual field. Using words (one class of such stimuli) to create a specific plan, the child achieves a much broader range of activity, applying as tools not only those objects that lie near at hand, but searching for and preparing such stimuli as can be useful in the solution of the task, and planning future actions .

其次，会说话的孩子的实际操作比猿猴更少冲动和自发。猿猴通常会进行一系列不受控制的尝试来解决给定的问题。相比之下，会说话的孩子会将活动分为两个连续的部分。她通过言语计划如何解决问题，然后通过明显的活动执行准备好的解决方案。直接操纵被复杂的心理过程所取代，通过这个过程，内在动机和意图会随着时间的推移而刺激自身的发展和实现。这种新的心理结构在猿猴中是不存在的，即使是在初级形式中也是如此。

Second, the practical operations of a child who can speak become much less impulsive and spontaneous than those of the ape. The ape typically makes a series of uncontrolled attempts to solve the given problem. In contrast, the child who uses speech divides the activity into two consecutive parts. She plans how to solve the problem through speech and then carries out the prepared solution through overt activity. Direct manipulation is replaced by a complex psychological process through which inner motivation and intentions, postponed in time, stimulate their own development and realization. This new kind of psychological structure is absent in apes, even in rudimentary forms.

最后，至关重要的是，语言不仅有助于儿童有效地操纵物体，而且还能控制儿童自己的行为 。因此，借助语言，儿童与猿类不同，获得了成为自身行为主体和客体的能力。

Finally, it is decisively important that speech not only facilitates the child’s effective manipulation of objects but also controls the child’s own behavior . Thus, with the help of speech children, unlike apes, acquire the capacity to be both the subjects and objects of their own behavior.

对参与各种活动的儿童（如列维娜所举例说明的儿童）的自我中心言语的实验研究得出了我们的实验所证实的第二个非常重要的事实：用皮亚杰的方法测量，自我中心言语的相对量 随着儿童任务的难度而增加。14基于 这些实验，我和我的合作者提出了一个假设，即儿童的自我中心言语应该被视为外部言语和内部言语之间的过渡形式。从功能上讲，自我中心言语是内部言语的基础，而从外部形式上讲，它嵌入在交际言语中。

Experimental investigation of the egocentric speech of children engaged in various activities such as that illustrated by Levina produced the second fact of great importance demonstrated by our experiments: the relative amount of egocentric speech , as measured by Piaget’s methods, increases in relation to the difficulty of the child’s task.14 On the basis of these experiments my collaborators and I developed the hypothesis that children’s egocentric speech should be regarded as the transitional form between external and internal speech. Functionally, egocentric speech is the basis for inner speech, while in its external form it is embedded in communicative speech.

增加自我中心言语产生的一种方法是使任务复杂化，使儿童无法直接使用工具来解决任务。面对这样的挑战，儿童对语言的情感运用会增加，他们也会更加努力地寻求一种不那么自动化、更智能的解决方案。他们用言语寻找新的计划，他们的话语揭示了自我中心言语和社会化言语之间的密切联系。当实验者离开房间或未能回应儿童的求助时，这一点最为明显。一旦被剥夺了进行社会言语的机会，儿童就会立即转向自我中心言语。

One way to increase the production of egocentric speech is to complicate a task in such a way that the child cannot make direct use of tools for its solution. When faced with such a challenge, the children’s emotional use of language increases as well as their efforts to achieve a less automatic, more intelligent solution. They search verbally for a new plan, and their utterances reveal the close connection between egocentric and socialized speech. This is best seen when the experimenter leaves the room or fails to answer the children’s appeals for help. Upon being deprived of the opportunity to engage in social speech, children immediately switch over to egocentric speech.

虽然语言的这两种功能的相互关系在这种背景下显而易见，但重要的是要记住，自我中心言语通过许多过渡形式与儿童的社会言语相联系。这两种语言功能之间联系的第一个重要例证是当儿童发现自己无法独自解决问题时。然后他们转向成年人，用言语描述他们自己无法实施的方法。儿童使用语言作为解决问题工具的能力的最大变化发生在他们发展的较晚阶段，当时社会化言语（以前用于称呼成年人）转向内部 。儿童不是诉诸成年人，而是诉诸自己；因此，语言 除了人际使用外，还具有个人内部功能 。当儿童发展出一种以前用于与他人交往的行为来指导自己时，当他们根据社会行为形式组织自己的活动时，他们成功地将一种社会态度应用于自己。社会言语内化过程的历史 也是儿童实践智力社会化的历史。

While the interrelationship of these two functions of language is apparent in this setting, it is important to remember that egocentric speech is linked to children’s social speech by many transitional forms. The first significant illustration of the link between these two language functions occurs when children find that they are unable to solve a problem by themselves. They then turn to an adult, and verbally describe the method that they cannot carry out by themselves. The greatest change in children’s capacity to use language as a problem-solving tool takes place somewhat later in their development, when socialized speech (which has previously been used to address an adult) is turned inward . Instead of appealing to the adult, children appeal to themselves; language thus takes on an intrapersonal function in addition to its interpersonal use . When children develop a method of behavior for guiding themselves that had previously been used in relation to another person, when they organize their own activities according to a social form of behavior, they succeed in applying a social attitude to themselves. The history of the process of the internalization of social speech is also the history of the socialization of children’s practical intellect.

在儿童发展过程中，言语和行动之间的关系是动态的。结构关系甚至在实验过程中也会发生变化。关键的变化发生在以下情况下： 早期言语伴随着 孩子的行为，以中断和混乱的形式反映出解决问题的变化。在后期，言语越来越倾向于过程的起点，以至于它先于行动 。然后它充当了已经构思但尚未在行为中实现的计划的辅助工具。在儿童绘画时的言语中可以找到一个有趣的类比（参见第 8 章 ）。年幼的孩子只有在完成绘画之后才会为他们的画作命名；他们需要先看到这些画作才能决定它们是什么。随着孩子长大，他们可以提前决定要画什么。这种命名过程的位移标志着言语功能的变化。最初，言语跟随动作，由活动引起并受活动支配。然而，在后期，当言语移到活动的起点时，词语和动作之间就出现了一种新的关系。现在，言语指导、决定和支配行动过程；言语的计划功能 是在语言本来就具有的反映外部世界的功能的基础上产生的。15

The relation between speech and action is a dynamic one in the course of children’s development. The structural relation can shift even during an experiment. The crucial change occurs as follows: At an early stage speech accompanies the child’s actions and reflects the vicissitudes of problem solving in a disrupted and chaotic form. At a later stage speech moves more and more toward the starting point of the process, so that it comes to precede action. It functions then as an aid to a plan that has been conceived but not yet realized in behavior. An interesting analogy can be found in children’s speech while drawing (see also chapter 8 ). Young children name their drawings only after they have completed them; they need to see them before they can decide what they are. As children get older they can decide in advance what they are going to draw. This displacement of the naming process signifies a change in the function of speech. Initially speech follows actions, is provoked by and dominated by activity. At a later stage, however, when speech is moved to the starting point of an activity, a new relation between word and action emerges. Now speech guides, determines, and dominates the course of action; the planning function of speech comes into being in addition to the already existing function of language to reflect the external world.15

正如模具赋予物质形状一样，语言可以将活动塑造成结构。然而，当儿童学会以超越以往经验的方式使用语言来规划未来行动时，这种结构可能会改变或重塑。与斯特恩推广的“突然发现”概念相反，我们将语言、智力活动设想为一系列阶段，在这些阶段中，语言的情感和交流功能通过增加规划功能而得到扩展。因此，儿童获得了参与复杂操作的能力。

Just as a mold gives shape to a substance, words can shape an activity into a structure. However, that structure may be changed or reshaped when children learn to use language in ways that allow them to go beyond previous experiences when planning future action. In contrast to the notion of sudden discovery popularized by Stern, we envisage verbal, intellectual activity as a series of stages in which the emotional and communicative functions of speech are expanded by the addition of the planning function. As a result the child acquires the ability to engage in complex operations extending over time.

与科勒所说的“受自身视野奴役”的猿猴不同，儿童获得了对具体环境的独立性；他们不再在直接给定的和明显的空间中行动 。一旦儿童学会如何有效地使用语言的规划功能，他们的心理领域就会发生根本性的变化。对未来的看法现在是他们对待周围环境的一个组成部分。在后续章节中，我将更详细地描述其中一些核心心理功能的发展过程。

Unlike the ape, which Köhler tells us is “the slave of its own visual field,” children acquire an independence with respect to their concrete surroundings; they cease to act in the immediately given and evident space . Once children learn how to use the planning function of their language effectively, their psychological field changes radically. A view of the future is now an integral part of their approaches to their surroundings. In subsequent chapters, I will describe the developmental course of some of these central psychological functions in greater detail.

总结一下本节迄今为止所说的内容：人类特有的语言能力使儿童能够提供辅助工具来解决困难的任务，克服冲动行为，在执行问题之前计划解决方案，并控制自己的行为。符号和文字首先是儿童与他人进行社会接触的手段。语言的认知和交流功能随后成为人类行为的基础。 儿童活动的新形式和更高级的形式，使他们与动物区分开来。

To summarize what has been said thus far in this section: The specifically human capacity for language enables children to provide for auxiliary tools in the solution of difficult tasks, to overcome impulsive action, to plan a solution to a problem prior to its execution, and to master their own behavior. Signs and words serve children first and foremost as a means of social contact with other people. The cognitive and communicative functions of language then become the basis of a new and superior form of activity in children, distinguishing them from animals.

我所描述的变化并不是以单一、均匀的方式发生的。我们的研究表明，非常小的孩子解决问题时会使用独特的混合过程。与对物体和人的反应不同的成年人相比，幼儿在对物体和社会人做出反应时可能会将动作和言语融合在一起。这种活动的融合类似于许多发展心理学家所描述的感知融合。

The changes I have described do not occur in a one-dimensional, even fashion. Our research has shown that very small children solve problems using unique mixtures of processes. In contrast with adults, who react differently to objects and to people, young children are likely to fuse action and speech when responding to both objects and social beings. This fusion of activity is analagous to syncretism in perception, which has been described by many developmental psychologists.

我所说的不平衡在以下情况下表现得非常明显：当小孩子无法轻松解决眼前的任务时，他们会直接尝试获得期望的结果，同时依赖情绪化的言语。有时言语表达了孩子的愿望，而有时言语则代替了实际实现目标。孩子可能会尝试通过口头表达和 向实验者求助来解决任务。这种多种形式的活动混合起初令人困惑；但进一步的观察引起了我们对一系列行动的注意，这些行动阐明了孩子在这种情况下行为的含义。例如，在完成一系列有助于他成功解决特定问题的聪明且相互关联的行动后，孩子突然遇到困难，停止所有尝试并向实验者求助。任何阻碍孩子解决问题的障碍都可能打断他的活动。孩子向他人的口头求助是为了填补他的活动所揭示的空白。通过提出问题，孩子表明他实际上已经制定了解决眼前任务的计划，但无法执行所有必要的操作。

The unevenness I am speaking of is seen quite clearly in a situation where small children, when unable to solve the task before them easily, combine direct attempts to obtain the desired end with a reliance upon emotional speech. At times speech expresses the children’s desires, while at other times it serves as a substitute for actually achieving the goal. The child may attempt to solve the task through verbal formulations and by appeals to the experimenter for help. This mixture of diverse forms of activity was at first bewildering; but further observations drew our attention to a sequence of actions that clarify the meaning of the children’s behavior in such circumstances. For example, after completing a number of intelligent and interrelated actions that should help him solve a particular problem successfully, the child suddenly, upon meeting a difficulty, ceases all attempts and turns for help to the experimenter. Any obstacle to the child’s efforts at solving the problem may interrupt his activity. The child’s verbal appeal to another person is an effort to fill the hiatus his activity has revealed. By asking a question, the child indicates that he has, in fact, formulated a plan to solve the task before him, but is unable to perform all the necessary operations.

通过反复的这种经验，儿童在内心深处学会了计划自己的活动。同时，他们根据所面临的问题的要求寻求他人的帮助。儿童控制他人行为的能力成为儿童实践活动的必要组成部分。

Through repeated experiences of this type, children learn covertly (mentally) to plan their activities. At the same time they enlist the assistance of another person in accordance with the requirements of the problem posed for them. The child’s ability to control another person’s behavior becomes a necessary part of the child’s practical activity.

最初，这种与他人共同解决问题的行为并没有根据儿童及其助手所扮演的角色进行区分；这是一个普遍的、融合的整体。我们不止一次地观察到，在解决一项任务的过程中，儿童会感到困惑，因为他们开始将自己所做事情的逻辑与需要与他人合作解决的同一问题的逻辑融合在一起。有时，当儿童意识到直接努力解决问题毫无希望时，就会出现融合行动。正如列维娜作品中的例子一样，儿童关注的是他们关注的对象 同样，语言和棍棒也表现出儿童活动中言语和行动之间根本的、不可分割的联系；与成人中这些过程的分离相比，这种统一性变得尤为明显。

Initially this problem solving in conjunction with another person is not differentiated with respect to the roles played by the child and his helper; it is a general, syncretic whole. We have more than once observed that in the course of solving a task, children get confused because they begin to merge the logic of what they are doing with the logic of the same problem as it has to be solved with the cooperation of another person. Sometimes syncretic action manifests itself when children realize the hopelessness of their direct efforts to solve a problem. As in the example from Levina’s work, children address the objects of their attention equally with words and sticks, demonstrating the fundamental and inseparable tie between speech and action in the child’s activity; this unity becomes particularly clear when compared with the separation of these processes in adults.

总之，当儿童面临对他们来说稍微过于复杂的问题时，他们会表现出各种各样的复杂反应，包括直接尝试达到目标、使用工具、向进行实验的人讲话或只是伴随动作讲话，以及直接对关注对象本身进行口头诉求。

In summary, children confronted with a problem that is slightly too complicated for them exhibit a complex variety of responses including direct attempts at attaining the goal, the use of tools, speech directed toward the person conducting the experiment or speech that simply accompanies the action, and direct, verbal appeals to the object of attention itself.

如果动态地分析，这种言语和行动的结合在儿童发展史中具有非常特殊的作用；它也展示了其自身起源的逻辑。从儿童发展的最初几天起，他的活动就在社会行为体系中获得了自己的意义，并朝着明确的目的前进，通过儿童环境的棱镜折射出来。从物体到儿童，从儿童到物体的路径要经过另一个人。这种复杂的人类结构是深深植根于个人与社会历史之间联系的发展过程的产物。

If analyzed dynamically, this alloy of speech and action has a very specific function in the history of the child’s development; it also demonstrates the logic of its own genesis. From the very first days of the child’s development his activities acquire a meaning of their own in a system of social behavior and, being directed towards a definite purpose, are refracted through the prism of the child’s environment. The path from object to child and from child to object passes through another person. This complex human structure is the product of a developmental process deeply rooted in the links between individual and social history.

2

2

感知和注意力的发展

The Development of Perception and Attention

工具使用和语言之间的联系影响多种心理功能，特别是感知、感觉运动操作和注意力，这些功能都是动态行为系统的一部分。实验发展研究表明，功能之间的联系和关系构成了系统，这些系统在儿童发展过程中的变化与单个功能本身一样剧烈。我将依次考虑每个功能，研究语言如何在其形式及其与其他功能的关系上引入质的变化。

The linkage between tool use and speech affects several psychological functions, in particular perception, sensory-motor operations, and attention, each of which is part of a dynamic system of behavior. Experimental-developmental research indicates that the connections and relations among functions constitute systems that change as radically in the course of a child’s development as do the individual functions themselves. Considering each function in turn, I will examine how speech introduces qualitative changes in both its form and its relation to other functions.

Köhler 的研究强调了视觉场结构在组织猿类实际行为方面的重要性。解决问题的整个过程基本上由感知决定。在这方面，Köhler 有充分的理由相信这些动物受其感觉场的约束程度远高于成年人类。他们无法通过自愿努力来改变其感觉场。事实上，将所有自然形式的感知对感觉场结构的依赖视为普遍规律可能会很有用。

Köhler’s work emphasized the importance of the structure of the visual field in organizing the ape’s practical behavior. The entire process of problem solving is essentially determined by perception. In this respect Köhler had ample grounds for believing that these animals are bound by their sensory field to a much greater extent than adult humans. They are incapable of modifying their sensory field by means of voluntary effort. Indeed, it would probably be useful to view as a general law the dependence of all natural forms of perception on the structure of the sensory field.

然而，由于儿童的感知是人类的 ，因此其发展并不是动物感知形式的直接延续和进一步完善，甚至不是最接近人类的动物感知形式的延续和进一步完善。为阐明这一问题而进行的实验使我们发现了一些表征人类高级感知形式的基本规律。

However, a child’s perception, because it is human , does not develop as a direct continuation and further perfection of the forms of animal perception, not even of those animals that stand nearest to humankind. Experiments conducted to clarify this problem led us to discover some basic laws that characterize the higher human forms of perception.

第一组实验涉及儿童图像感知的发展阶段。类似的实验描述了幼儿感知的具体方面及其对高级感知的依赖 心理机制的研究早先由比奈进行，并由斯特恩详细分析。1两位 作者都发现，幼儿描述图片的方式在不同的发育阶段有所不同。两岁的孩子通常将描述范围限制在图片中的单个物体上。年龄较大的孩子会描述动作，并指出图片中单个物体之间的复杂关系。斯特恩从这些观察中推断，儿童感知单个物体的阶段先于他们除了物体之外还感知动作和关系的阶段，即他们感知整个图片的阶段。然而，许多心理学观察表明，儿童的感知过程最初是融合的，后来才变得更加分化。

The first set of experiments concerned developmental stages of picture perception in children. Similar experiments describing specific aspects of young children’s perception and its dependence on higher psychological mechanisms had been carried out earlier by Binet and analyzed in detail by Stern.1 Both authors found that the way small children describe pictures differs at successive developmental stages. A two-year-old usually limits his description to separate objects within the picture. Older children describe actions and indicate the complex relations among the separate objects within the picture. Stern inferred from these observations that a stage when children perceive separate objects precedes the stage when they perceive actions and relations in addition to objects, that is, when they perceive the picture as a whole. However, many psychological observations suggest that the child’s perceptual processes are initially fused and only later become more differentiated.

我们通过一个重复斯特恩对儿童描述图片的研究的实验解决了这两种观点之间的矛盾，在这个实验中，我们要求儿童在不使用语言的情况下交流图片的内容。我们建议用哑剧的方式进行描述 。根据斯特恩的图式，这个两岁的孩子仍然处于独立的“对象”发展阶段，她感知到了图片的动态特征，并通过哑剧轻松地再现了这些特征。斯特恩认为这是孩子感知技能的一个特点，但事实证明，这是她语言发展局限性的产物 ，或者换句话说，是她言语化感知的一个特点 。

We resolved the contradiction between these two positions through an experiment replicating Stern’s study of children’s descriptions of pictures, in which we asked children to communicate the contents of a picture without using speech. We suggested that the description be made in pantomime . The two-year-old child, who according to Stern’s schema is still at the separate “object” stage of development, perceived the dynamic features of the picture and reproduced them with ease through pantomime. What Stern regarded as a characteristic of the child’s perceptual skills proved to be a product of the limitations of her language development or, in other words, a feature of her verbalized perception .

一系列相关观察表明，标记是幼儿使用的语言的主要功能。标记使孩子能够选择一个特定的对象，从他所感知的整个情况中将其单独挑出。然而，与此同时，孩子用非常富有表现力的手势来修饰他的第一句话，这弥补了他通过语言进行有意义的交流的困难。通过语言，孩子们挑选出不同的元素，从而克服了感觉场的自然结构，形成了新的（人为引入的和动态的）结构中心。孩子开始不仅通过眼睛，而且通过语言来感知世界。结果，“自然”感知的即时性被复杂的中介过程所取代；因此，语言成为儿童认知发展的重要组成部分。

A series of related observations revealed that labeling is the primary function of speech used by young children. Labeling enables the child to choose a specific object, to single it out from the entire situation he is perceiving. Simultaneously, however, the child embellishes his first words with very expressive gestures, which compensate for his difficulties in communicating meaningfully through language. By means of words children single out separate elements, thereby overcoming the natural structure of the sensory field and forming new (artifically introduced and dynamic) structural centers. The child begins to perceive the world not only through his eyes but also through his speech. As a result, the immediacy of “natural” perception is supplanted by a complex mediated process; as such, speech becomes an essential part of the child’s cognitive development.

后来，与言语相关的智力机制获得了新的功能；儿童的言语感知不再局限于标记。在下一个发展阶段，言语获得了合成功能，这反过来有助于实现更复杂的认知感知形式。这些变化使人类感知成为 全新的特征，与高等动物的类似过程截然不同。

Later, the intellectual mechanisms related to speech acquire a new function; verbalized perception in the child is no longer limited to labeling. At this next stage of development, speech acquires a synthesizing function, which in turn is instrumental in achieving more complex forms of cognitive perception. These changes give human perception an entirely new character, quite distinct from the analogous processes in higher animals.

语言在感知中的作用引人注目，因为视觉感知和语言的本质中隐含着相反的趋势。视野中的独立元素被同时感知；从这个意义上说，视觉感知是不可分割的 。另一方面，语音需要顺序处理。每个元素都被单独标记，然后以句子结构连接起来，使语音本质上是分析性的 。

The role of language in perception is striking because of the opposing tendencies implicit in the nature of visual perception and language. The independent elements in a visual field are simultaneously perceived; in this sense, visual perception is integral . Speech, on the other hand, requires sequential processing. Each element is separately labeled and then connected in a sentence structure, making speech essentially analytical .

我们的研究表明，即使在发育的早期阶段，语言和感知也是相互联系的。在解决非语言任务时，即使问题在不发出声音的情况下得到解决，语言也会对结果产生影响。这些发现证实了 A. Potebnya 多年前提出的心理语言学论点，他主张人类思维和语言之间不可避免地相互依存。2

Our research has shown that even at very early stages of development, language and perception are linked. In the solution of nonverbal tasks, even if a problem is solved without a sound being uttered, language plays a role in the outcome. These findings substantiate the thesis of psychological linguistics as formulated many years ago by A. Potebnya, who argued for the inevitable interdependence between human thought and language.2

人类感知的一个特殊特征——它在很小的时候就出现了——是对真实物体的感知 。这是动物感知无法比拟的。我用这个术语的意思是，我不仅仅是通过颜色和形状来看待世界，而且还将其视为一个具有意义和含义的世界。我不仅仅看到带有两个指针的圆形黑色东西；我看到一个钟，并且我可以区分一只指针和另一只指针。一些脑损伤患者说，当他们看到钟时，他们看到的是带有两根细钢条的圆形白色东西，但他们不知道那是钟；这样的人已经失去了与物体的真实联系。这些观察结果表明，所有人类感知都由分类而非孤立的感知组成。

A special feature of human perception—which arises at a very young age—is the perception of real objects . This is something for which there is no analogy in animal perception. By this term I mean that I do not see the world simply in color and shape but also as a world with sense and meaning. I do not merely see something round and black with two hands; I see a clock and I can distinguish one hand from the other. Some brain-injured patients say, when they see a clock, that they are seeing something round and white with two thin steel strips, but they do not know it is a clock; such people have lost their real relationship with objects. These observations suggest that all human perception consists of categorized rather than isolated perceptions.

向全新行为形式的发展转变并不仅限于感知的变化。感知是动态行为系统的一部分；因此，感知过程的转变与其他智力活动转变之间的关系至关重要。我们对选择行为的研究证明了这一点，这些研究显示了幼儿感知与运动行为之间不断变化的关系。

The developmental transition to qualitatively new forms of behavior is not confined to changes in perception alone. Perception is part of a dynamic system of behavior; hence, the relation between transformations of perceptual processes and transformations in other intellectual activities is of primary importance. This point is illustrated by our studies on choice behavior, which show the changing relation between perception and motor action in young children.

儿童选择行为的研究

STUDIES OF CHOICE BEHAVIOR IN CHILDREN

我们要求四五岁的孩子按下键盘上的五个键之一，同时识别分配给每个键的一系列图片刺激中的每一个。因为这项任务超出了孩子们的能力 对儿童来说，这会带来严重的困难，也需要付出更大的努力来解决问题。也许最引人注目的结果是，儿童的整个选择过程都是外部的 ，集中在运动领域，从而使实验者能够在儿童的动作中观察到选择过程本身的本质。儿童在进行选择所需的任何动作时都会进行选择。

We requested four- and five-year-old children to press one of five keys on a keyboard as they identified each one of a series of picture stimuli assigned to each key. Because this task exceeds the capabilities of the children, it causes serious difficulties and more intensive efforts to solve the problem. Perhaps the most remarkable result is that the entire process of selection by the child is external , and concentrated in the motor sphere, thus allowing the experimenter to observe the very nature of the choice process itself in the child’s movements. The child does her selecting while carrying out whatever movements the choice requires.

儿童决策的结构与成人的过程完全不同。成人在内心做出初步决定，然后以执行计划的单一动作的形式进行选择。儿童的选择类似于他自己动作中稍有延迟的选择 。感知的波动直接反映在运动的结构中。儿童的动作充满了分散的摸索，这些摸索相互中断和接续。只需看一眼追踪儿童动作的图表，就足以让人相信这个过程的基本运动性质。

The structure of the child’s decision does not in the least resemble the adult process. Adults make a preliminary decision internally and subsequently carry out the choice in the form of a single movement that executes the plan. The child’s choice resembles a somewhat delayed selection among his own movements . Vascillations in perception are directly reflected in the structure of movement. The child’s movements are replete with diffuse gropings that interrupt and succeed one another. A mere glance at the chart tracing the child’s movements is sufficient to convince one of the basic motor nature of the process.

儿童和成人的选择过程的主要区别在于，对于儿童来说，一系列试探性动作构成了选择过程。儿童不会选择刺激（ 必要的键）作为后续动作的起点，而是选择动作， 并使用指令作为指南来检查结果。因此，孩子不是通过直接的视觉感知过程来解决选择问题，而是通过运动来解决选择问题，在两个刺激之间犹豫不决，手指在一个键上悬停并移动到另一个键上，走到一半又回来。当孩子将注意力转移到新位置时，从而在动态感知结构中创建一个新的焦点，她的手会与眼睛同步，顺从地朝着这个新的中心移动。简而言之，运动与感知是不可分割的：这两个过程几乎完全重合。

The main difference between the choice processes in the child and in the adult is that for the child the series of tentative movements constitute the selection process. The child does not choose the stimulus (the necessary key) as the starting point for the consequent movement but rather selects the movement , using the instruction as a guide to check the results. Thus, the child resolves her choice not through a direct process of visual perception but through movement, hesitating between two stimuli, her fingers hovering above and moving from one key to another, going half-way and then coming back. When the child transfers her attention to a new location, thereby creating a new focus in the dynamic structure of perception, her hand obediently moves toward this new center, in unison with the eye. In short, movement is not separated from perception: the processes coincide almost exactly.

在高等动物的行为中，视觉感知以类似的方式构成了更复杂整体的一部分。猿类并不是被动地感知视觉情况；它通过由反射、情感、运动和智力因素组成的复杂行为结构来获取吸引它的物体。猿类的动作构成了其感知的直接动态延续。在人类儿童中，一旦在选择过程中运用了更复杂的心理功能，这种早期的、结构分散的反应就会发生根本性的变化。动物中存在的自然过程随后转化为更高级的心理操作。

In the behavior of the higher animals, visual perception forms part of a more complex whole in a similar way. The ape does not perceive the visual situation passively; a complex behavioral structure consisting of reflexive, affective, motor, and intellectual factors is directed toward acquiring the object that attracts it. The ape’s movements constitute an immediate dynamic continuation of its perception. In human children, this early, diffusely structured response undergoes a fundamental change as soon as a more complex psychological function is utilized in the choice process. The natural process present in animals is then transformed into a higher psychological operation.

在上述实验之后，我们尝试通过为每个键标记相应的 符号作为额外的刺激，可以指导和组织选择过程。当出现目标刺激时，要求孩子按下标有相应符号的键。早在五六岁时，孩子就可以轻松完成这项任务。这种新成分的加入从根本上改变了选择过程的结构。基本的“自然”操作被一种新的、更复杂的操作所取代。更简单的任务会引起更复杂的结构化反应。当孩子注意辅助符号以找到与给定刺激相对应的键时，他不再表现出直接来自感知的运动冲动。没有出现我们在早期不使用辅助工具的选择反应中观察到的空中不确定的摸索动作。

Subsequent to the experiment described above we attempted to simplify the task of selection by marking each key with a corresponding sign to serve as an additional stimulus that could direct and organize the choice process. The child was asked, upon the appearance of a target stimulus, to press the key marked with the corresponding sign. As early as age five or six the child is able to fulfill this task easily. The addition of this new ingredient radically changes the structure of the choice process. The elementary, “natural” operation is replaced by a new and more complicated one. The simpler task evokes a more complexly structured response. When the child attends to the auxiliary sign in order to find the key corresponding to the given stimulus, he no longer exhibits those motor impulses that arise directly from perception. There are no uncertain groping movements in the air such as we observed in the earlier choice reaction when auxiliary aids were not used.

辅助符号的使用打破了感觉场和运动系统的融合，从而使新的行为成为可能。在选择反应的初始时刻和最终时刻之间建立了“功能障碍”；直接的移动冲动被初步回路分流。以前冲动解决问题的孩子现在通过在刺激和相应的辅助符号之间建立内部联系来解决问题。以前选择的运动现在只用于完成准备好的操作。符号系统重组了整个心理过程，使孩子能够掌握自己的运动。它在全新的基础上重建了选择过程 。运动脱离了直接感知，并受到选择反应中包含的符号功能的控制。这一发展代表了与行为自然史的根本性突破，开启了从动物原始行为到人类高级智力活动的过渡。

The use of auxiliary signs breaks up the fusion of the sensory field and the motor system and thus makes new kinds of behavior possible. A “functional barrier” is created between the initial and final moments of the choice response; the direct impulse to move is shunted by preliminary circuits. The child who formerly solved the problem impulsively now solves it through an internally established connection between the stimulus and the corresponding auxiliary sign. The movement that previously had been the choice now serves only to fulfill the prepared operation. The system of signs restructures the whole psychological process and enables the child to master her movement. It reconstructs the choice process on a totally new basis . Movement detaches itself from direct perception and comes under the control of sign functions included in the choice response. This development represents a fundamental break with the natural history of behavior and initiates the transition from the primitive behavior of animals to the higher intellectual activities of humans.

注意力 应被列为使用工具的心理结构的主要功能之首。从科勒开始，学者们就注意到，能否集中注意力是任何实际操作成败的关键决定因素。然而，儿童与动物的实践智力的区别在于，儿童能够重建自己的感知，从而摆脱既定的场域结构。借助词语的指示功能，儿童开始掌握自己的注意力，在感知情境中创建新的结构中心。正如 K. Koffka 所言，儿童能够自己确定感知场的“重心”；她的行为不仅仅受个别元素的显著性调节 孩子评估这些元素的相对重要性，从背景中挑选出新的“人物”，从而扩大控制其活动的可能性。3

Attention should be given first place among the major functions in the psychological structure underlying the use of tools. Beginning with Köhler, scholars have noted that the ability or inability to direct one’s attention is an essential determinant of the success or failure of any practical operation. However, the difference between the practical intelligence of children and animals is that children are capable of reconstructing their perception and thus freeing themselves from the given structure of the field. With the help of the indicative function of words, the child begins to master his attention, creating new structural centers in the perceived situation. As K. Koffka so aptly put it, the child is able to determine for herself the “center of gravity” of her perceptual field; her behavior is not regulated solely by the salience of individual elements within it. The child evaluates the relative importance of these elements, singling out new “figures” from the background and thus widening the possibilities for controlling her activities.3

除了重新组织视觉空间场之外，儿童在语言的帮助下还创建了一个时间场，对他来说，这个时间场和视觉场一样可感知、一样真实。会说话的儿童有能力以动态的方式引导自己的注意力。他可以从过去的活动的角度来看待眼前情况的变化，也可以从未来的角度来采取行动。

In addition to reorganizing the visual-spatial field, the child, with the help of speech, creates a time field that is just as perceptible and real to him as the visual one. The speaking child has the ability to direct his attention in a dynamic way. He can view changes in his immediate situation from the point of view of past activities, and he can act in the present from the viewpoint of the future.

对于猿猴来说，除非目标和达到目标所需的物体同时在视野中，否则这项任务是无法解决的。对于孩子来说，通过用言语控制注意力并由此重新组织感知领域，可以轻松克服这一差距。猿猴会立即感知到一根棍子，但当视野发生变化并且目标进入视野后，它就会停止关注它。猿猴必须看到自己的棍子才能注意到它；孩子可能会注意它才能看到。

For the ape, the task is unsolvable unless the goal and the object needed to reach it are both simultaneously in view. For the child, this gap is easily overcome by verbally controlling her attention and thereby reorganizing her perceptual field. The ape will perceive a stick one moment, but cease to pay attention to it after its visual field has changed and the goal comes into view. The ape must see his stick in order to pay attention to it; the child may pay attention in order to see.

因此，儿童的注意力领域不仅包含一个，而是包含一系列潜在的感知领域，这些感知领域随着时间的推移形成了连续的动态结构。从视觉领域的同步结构到动态注意力领域的连续结构的过渡是通过重建作为所需操作一部分的独立活动来实现的。当这种情况发生时，我们可以说注意力领域已经脱离了感知领域，并随着时间的推移而展开，成为一系列动态心理活动的一个组成部分。

Thus, the child’s field of attention embraces not one but a whole series of potential perceptual fields that form successive, dynamic structures over time. The transition from the simultaneous structure of the visual field to the successive structure of the dynamic field of attention is achieved through the reconstruction of the separate activities that are a part of the required operations. When this occurs, we can say that the field of attention has detached itself from the perceptual field and unfolded itself in time, as one component of a dynamic series of psychological activities.

在一个注意力领域中结合过去和现在视野的元素（例如，工具和目标）的可能性反过来又导致对另一项重要功能——记忆的基本重建 。（见第 3 章 。）通过对过去的情况和活动​​的口头表述，儿童摆脱了直接回忆的限制；他成功地将过去和现在综合起来以达到自己的目的。记忆中发生的变化类似于儿童感知领域中发生的变化，重心发生了转移，图形和背景关系也发生了改变。儿童的记忆不仅使过去的片段更容易获得，而且还产生了一种将过去经验的元素与现在结合起来的新方法 。

The possibility of combining elements of the past and present visual fields (for instance, tool and goal) in one field of attention leads in turn to a basic reconstruction of another vital function, memory . (See chapter 3 .) Through verbal formulations of past situations and activities, the child frees himself from the limitations of direct recall; he succeeds in synthesizing the past and present to suit his purposes. The changes that occur in memory are similar to those that occur in the child’s perceptual field where centers of gravity are shifted and figure and ground relationship are altered. The child’s memory not only makes fragments of the past more available, but also results in a new method of uniting the elements of past experience with the present .

借助语言，行动的时间场既向前延伸，也向后延伸。正在进行的活动中包含的未来活动由符号表示。与记忆和注意力的情况一样，在时间感知中加入符号不会导致时间操作的简单延长；相反，它创造了 形成一个包含过去、现在和未来有效元素的单一系统的条件。儿童中正在形成的这个心理系统现在包含两个新功能：意图和有目的行动的象征性表征 。

Created with the help of speech, the time field for action extends both forward and backward. Future activity that can be included in an ongoing activity is represented by signs. As in the case of memory and attention, the inclusion of signs in temporal perception does not lead to a simple lengthening of the operation in time; rather, it creates the conditions for the development of a single system that includes effective elements of the past, present, and future. This emerging psychological system in the child now encompasses two new functions: intentions and symbolic representations of purposeful action .

儿童行为结构的这种变化与儿童的需求和动机的基本改变有关。当林德纳将聋哑儿童解决任务的方法与科勒的猿猴所使用的方法进行比较时，他指出，引导猿猴的动机和引导儿童实现目标的动机并不相同。4动物 身上占主导地位的“本能”冲动在儿童身上变成了次要的。新的动机，植根于社会并且很强烈，为孩子指明了方向。K. 列文将这些动机描述为Quasi-Beduerfnisse （准需求），并认为将它们纳入任何给定任务都会导致儿童整个情感和自愿系统的重组。5他 认为，随着这些准需求的发展，儿童的情感主心骨从关注结果转向 关注解决方案的性质 。本质上，在猿猴实验中，“任务” （Aufgabe） 只存在于实验者的眼中；对于动物而言，只有诱饵和阻碍它前进的障碍。然而，孩子努力解决给定的问题，因此目的完全不同。由于他能够形成准需求，所以孩子能够将操作分解成单独的部分，每个部分都成为一个独立的问题，他借助语言为自己制定。

This change in the structure of the child’s behavior is related to basic alterations in the child’s needs and motivations. When Lindner compared the methods by which deaf children solved tasks to the methods used by Köhler’s ape, he noted that the motives guiding the ape and those guiding the child to achieve mastery of a goal were not the same.4 The “instinctive” urges predominating in the animal become secondary in the child. New motives, socially rooted and intense, provide the child with direction. K. Lewin described these motives as Quasi-Beduerfnisse (quasi-needs) and argued that their inclusion in any given task leads to the reorganization of the child’s whole affective and voluntary system.5 He believed that with the development of these quasi-needs, the child’s emotional thrust is shifted from a preoccupation with the outcome to the nature of the solution . In essence, the “task” (Aufgabe) in experiments with apes exists only in the eyes of the experimenter; as far as the animal is concerned there exists only the bait and the obstacles standing in his way. The child, however, strives to solve the given problem and thus has an entirely different purpose. Because he is able to form quasi-needs, the child is capable of breaking the operation into its separate parts, each of which becomes an independent problem that he formulates for himself with the help of speech.

在对有目的的活动心理学的出色分析中，列文对自愿活动给出了明确的定义，认为它是行为的历史文化发展产物，也是人类心理学的一个独特特征。他断言，人类在最无意义的意图方面表现出非凡的自由，这一事实本身就令人震惊。这种自由在儿童身上少得可怜，在非文盲人类身上可能也是如此。有理由相信，自愿活动，而不是高度发达的智力，才是人类与最接近的动物的区别所在。

In his excellent analysis of the psychology of purposeful activity, Lewin gives a clear-cut definition of voluntary activity as a product of the historical-cultural development of behavior and as a unique feature of human psychology. The fact that man displays extraordinary freedom with respect to even the most senseless intention is astounding in itself, he asserts. This freedom is incomparably less characteristic of children and probably of nonliterate humans, too. There is reason to believe that voluntary activity, more than highly developed intellect, distinguishes humans from the animals which stand closest to them.

3

3

掌握记忆和思考

Mastery of Memory and Thinking

我和我的同事们根据对语言在重新组织感知和建立心理功能之间新关系方面所起的作用的了解，对儿童使用符号的其他形式及其所有具体表现形式（绘画、写作、阅读、使用数字系统等）进行了广泛的研究。我们还考虑了与实践智力无关的其他操作是否会表现出我们在分析实践智力时发现的相同发展规律。

In the light of what my collaborators and I had learned about the functions of speech in reorganizing perception and creating new relations among psychological functions, we undertook a broad study of other forms of sign-using activity in children in all its concrete manifestations (drawing pictures, writing, reading, using number systems, and so on). We also considered whether other operations not related to practical intellect would show the same laws of development we had discovered when analyzing practical intellect.

我和我的同事进行了一系列实验来处理这些问题，现在，根据我们从这些实验中获得的数据，我们能够以示意图的形式描述表征儿童手势操作结构和发展的基本规律。这些将通过对记忆的讨论来呈现，这对于研究手势对基本心理功能的影响非常合适，因为它清楚地揭示了手势的社会起源及其在个人发展中的关键作用。

Several series of experiments carried out by my colleagues and myself dealt with these problems, and now, based on the data we obtained from them, we are able to describe in schematic form the basic laws that characterize the structure and development of the child’s sign operations. These will be presented through a discussion of memory, which is exceptionally appropriate for study of the changes that signs introduce into basic psychological functions because it clearly reveals the social origin of signs as well as their crucial role in the individual’s development.

间接记忆的社会起源

SOCIAL ORIGINS OF INDIRECT (MEDIATED) MEMORY

对人类记忆的比较研究表明，即使在社会发展的最初阶段，也存在两种截然不同的记忆类型。一种在无文字人群的行为中占主导地位，其特点是对材料的非中介印象，以保留实际经验作为记忆痕迹的基础。我们称之为自然记忆 ，它清楚地说明了 ER Jaensch 的“意象记忆”研究就是一个典型例子。1这种 记忆与知觉十分接近，因为它是外界刺激对人的直接影响，从结构上看，整个过程具有即时性。

A comparative investigation of human memory reveals that, even at the earliest stages of social development, there are two, principally different, types of memory. One, dominating in the behavior of nonliterate peoples, is characterized by the nonmediated impression of materials, by the retention of actual experiences as the basis of mnemonic (memory) traces. We call this natural memory , and it is clearly illustrated in E. R. Jaensch’s studies of eidetic imagery.1 This kind of memory is very close to perception, because it arises out of the direct influence of external stimuli upon human beings. From the point of view of structure, the entire process is characterized by a quality of immediacy.

然而，自然记忆并不是唯一的记忆类型，即使是在不识字的男性和女性中也是如此。相反，属于完全不同发展路线的其他类型的记忆与自然记忆共存。刻有凹槽的木棍和绳结的使用、2 书写的开始和简单的记忆辅助工具都表明，即使在历史发展的早期阶段，人类也超越了自然赋予他们的心理功能的限制，并开始对其行为进行新的文化组织。比较分析表明，即使是最高等的动物物种也缺乏这种活动；我们相信这些符号操作是社会 发展特定条件的产物。

Natural memory is not the only kind, however, even in the case of nonliterate men and women. On the contrary, other types of memory belonging to a completely different developmental line coexist with natural memory. The use of notched sticks and knots,2 the beginnings of writing and simple memory aids all demonstrate that even at early stages of historical development humans went beyond the limits of the psychological functions given to them by nature and proceeded to a new culturally-elaborated organization of their behavior. Comparative analysis shows that such activity is absent in even the highest species of animals; we believe that these sign operations are the product of specific conditions of social development.

即使是打结或在木棍上做记号等相对简单的操作也会改变记忆过程的心理结构。它们将记忆运作扩展到人类神经系统的生物维度之外，并允许其吸收人工或自我产生的刺激，我们称之为符号 。这种融合是人类独有的，标志着一种全新的行为形式。它与基本功能之间的本质区别在于每个功能刺激-反应关系的结构。基本功能的主要特征是它们完全直接由环境刺激决定。对于更高级的功能，主要特征是自我产生的刺激，即创造和使用人工刺激，这些刺激成为行为的直接原因。

Even such comparatively simple operations as tying a knot or marking a stick as a reminder change the psychological structure of the memory process. They extend the operation of memory beyond the biological dimensions of the human nervous system and permit it to incorporate artificial, or self-generated, stimuli, which we call signs . This merger, unique to human beings, signifies an entirely new form of behavior. The essential difference between it and the elementary functions is to be found in the structure of the stimulus-response relations of each. The central characteristic of elementary functions is that they are totally and directly determined by stimulation from the environment. For higher functions, the central feature is self-generated stimulation, that is, the creation and use of artificial stimuli which become the immediate causes of behavior.

标识运营结构

STRUCTURE OF SIGN OPERATIONS

每种基本行为形式都要求 对有机体所面临的任务做出直接反应（可以用简单的 S R 公式来表达）。但符号操作的结构要求刺激和反应之间存在中间环节。这个中间环节是二阶刺激（符号），它被引入操作，在操作中发挥特殊功能；它在 S 和 R 之间建立了一种新的关系。术语“被引入”表示个体必须积极参与建立这种联系。这种符号还具有反向作用的重要特征（即它作用于个体，而不是环境）。

Every elementary form of behavior presupposes a direct reaction to the task set before the organism (which can be expressed by the simple S R formula). But the structure of sign operations re quires an intermediate link between the stimulus and the response. This intermediate link is a second order stimulus (sign) that is drawn into the operation where it fulfills a special function; it creates a new relation between S and R. The term “drawn into” indicates that an individual must be actively engaged in establishing such a link. This sign also possesses the important characteristic of reverse action (that is, it operates on the individual, not the environment).

因此，简单的刺激-反应过程被复杂的、中介的行为所取代，我们将其描述为：

Consequently, the simple stimulus-response process is replaced by a complex, mediated act, which we pictures as:

图 1

Figure 1

在这个新的过程中，直接的反应冲动受到抑制，而加入了一种通过间接方式促进操作完成的辅助刺激。

In this new process the direct impulse to react is inhibited, and an auxiliary stimulus that facilitates the completion of the operation by indirect means is incorporated.

仔细的研究表明，这种组织形式是所有高级心理过程的基础，尽管其形式比上述形式复杂得多。该公式中的中间环节不仅仅是一种改进先前存在的操作的方法，也不是 S—R 链中简单的附加环节。由于这种辅助刺激具有逆向作用的特殊功能，它将心理操作转移到更高级、质量更高的新形式，并允许人类借助外在刺激从外部控制其行为 。符号的使用使人类形成了一种特定的行为结构，这种结构摆脱了生物发展，并创造了一种基于文化的心理过程的新形式。

Careful studies demonstrate that this type of organization is basic to all higher psychological processes, although in much more sophisticated forms than that shown above. The intermediate link in this formula is not simply a method of improving the previously existing operation, nor is it a mere additional link in an S—R chain. Because this auxiliary stimulus possesses the specific function of reverse action, it transfers the psychological operation to higher and qualitatively new forms and permits humans, by the aid of extrinsic stimuli, to control their behavior from the outside . The use of signs leads humans to a specific structure of behavior that breaks away from biological development and creates new forms of a culturally-based psychological process.

儿童早期标志手术

EARLY SIGN OPERATIONS IN CHILDREN

以下实验由 AN Leontiev 在我们的实验室中进行，特别清楚地证明了手势在自愿注意和记忆中的作用。3

The following experiments, conducted under A. N. Leontiev in our laboratories, demonstrate with particular clarity the role of signs in voluntary attention and memory.3

孩子们被要求玩一个游戏，在这个游戏中，他们要回答一组问题，但不能在答案中使用某些单词。通常，每个孩子要完成三到四个任务，这些任务对答案的限制和孩子可以使用的潜在刺激辅助类型各不相同。在每个任务中，孩子会被问到十八个问题，其中七个与颜色有关（例如，“...是什么颜色？”）。要求孩子用一个单词迅速回答每个问题。第一个任务 就是以这种方式进行的。对于第二个任务 ，我们开始引入额外的规则，孩子必须遵守这些规则才能成功。例如，有两个颜色名称是孩子必须知道的，但第二个任务则不同。 禁止使用，并且颜色名称不能重复使用。第三个任务 与第二个任务有相同的规则，但孩子得到了九张彩色卡片作为玩游戏的辅助工具（“这些卡片可以帮助你获胜”）。第四个任务 与第三个任务类似，用于孩子无法使用颜色卡或仅在第三个任务后期才开始使用颜色卡的情况。在每项任务之前和之后，我们都会问孩子一些问题，以确定她是否记得并理解了指示。

Children were asked to play a game in which they were to answer a set of questions without using certain words in their answers. As a rule each child was presented three or four tasks differing in the constraints placed upon answers and the kinds of potential stimulus aids the child could use. In each task the child was asked eighteen questions, seven of which had to do with color (for example, “What color is . . . ?”). The child was asked to answer each question promptly using a single word. The initial task was conducted in exactly this fashion. With the second task , we began to introduce additional rules that the child had to follow in order to succeed. For example, there were two color names the child was forbidden to use, and no color name could be used twice. The third task had the same rules as the second, but the child was given nine colored cards as aids to playing the game (“these cards can help you to win”). The fourth task was like the third and was used in cases where the child either failed to use the color cards or began to do so only late in the third task. Before and after each task we asked the child questions to determine if she remembered and understood the instructions.

一项典型任务的一组问题如下（在本例中绿色和黄色是禁忌颜色）：（1）你有玩伴吗？（2）你的衬衫是什么颜色的？（3）你坐过火车吗？（4）火车车厢是什么颜色的？（5）你想长高吗？（6）你去过剧院吗？（7）你喜欢在房间里玩吗？（8）地板是什么颜色的？（9）墙壁呢？（10）你会写字吗？（11）你见过丁香花吗？（12）丁香花是什么颜色的？（13）你喜欢甜的东西吗？（14）你去过乡下吗？（15）树叶可以是什么颜色的？（16）你会游泳吗？（17）你最喜欢的颜色是什么？（18）人们用铅笔做什么？

A set of questions for a typical task is the following (in this case green and yellow are the forbidden colors): (1) Have you a playmate? (2) What color is your shirt? (3) Did you ever go in a train? (4) What color are the railway-carriages? (5) Do you want to be big? (6) Were you ever at the theater? (7) Do you like to play in the room? (8) What color is the floor? (9) And the walls? (10) Can you write? (11) Have you seen lilac? (12) What color is lilac? (13) Do you like sweet things? (14) Were you ever in the country? (15) What colors can leaves be? (16) Can you swim? (17) What is your favorite color? (18) What does one do with a pencil?

对于第三和第四个任务，提供了以下颜色卡作为辅助：黑色、白色、红色、蓝色、黄色、绿色、淡紫色、棕色和灰色。

For the third and fourth tasks the following color cards were provided as aids: black, white, red, blue, yellow, green, lilac, brown, and gray.

表 1总结了 30 名年龄从 5 岁到 27 岁的受试者的结果 ，其中包含任务 2 和任务 3 的平均错误数以及两个任务之间的差异。首先查看任务 2 的数据，我们发现从 5 岁到 13 岁，错误数略有下降，而成年后则急剧下降。对于任务 3，5-6 岁和 8-9 岁组之间的下降最为显著。对于学龄前儿童和成年人来说，任务 2 和任务 3 之间的差异很小。对于学龄儿童来说，差异最大。

The results for thirty subjects ranging in age from five to twenty-seven years are summarized in table 1 , which contains the average number of errors on tasks 2 and 3 and the difference between the two tasks. Looking first at the data from task 2, we see a slight decrease in errors from ages five to thirteen and a sharp drop in adulthood. For task 3 the sharpest drop occurs between the five-to-six and eight-to-nine-year-old groups. The difference between tasks 2 and 3 is small for both the preschool children and the adults. The difference is largest for the school-age children.

表 1.禁色任务的错误。

Table 1. Errors on forbidden colors task.

通过查看代表不同年龄段儿童的转录本，可以最容易地揭示产生总结数字的过程。 组。学龄前儿童（五至六岁）通常无法发现如何使用辅助色卡，并且在完成这两项任务时遇到了很大困难。即使我们试图向他们解释色卡如何帮助他们，这个年龄段的孩子也无法使用这些外部刺激来组织自己的行为。

The processes that give rise to the summary figures are most readily revealed by looking at transcripts representative of children in the different groups. The preschool children (age five to six years) were generally unable to discover how to use the auxiliary color cards and had a great deal of trouble with both tasks. Even when we tried to explain to them how the color cards could help them, children at this age were incapable of using these external stimuli in order to organize their own behavior.

以下记录来自一名五岁男孩的讲述：

The following transcript is from a five-year-old boy:

任务4.禁忌颜色：蓝色和红色（带卡片） 。

Task 4. Forbidden colors: blue and red (with cards) .

2. 房子是什么颜色的？ 红色[不看禁色]。
3. 阳光灿烂吗？ 是的。
4. 天空是什么颜色的？ 白色 [没有看牌；但回答后，寻找白色牌]。在这儿！[捡起它并握在手中。]
8. 西红柿有哪些颜色？ 红色。[看了一眼卡片。]
9. 练习本是什么颜色的？ 白色——像这样！[指着白色的书？卡片]。
12 球是什么颜色的？ 白色[看牌]。
13 你住在城里吗？ 不。
… …
你認為你獲勝了嗎？ 不知道——是的。
如果你想获胜，你必须不做什么？ 一定不能说红色或者蓝色。
还有什么？ 不能说同样的话两次。

这份记录表明，“辅助工具”实际上阻碍了这个孩子。当他的注意力集中在白色卡片上时，他反复使用“白色”作为回应。对他来说，辅助工具只是情境的一个偶然特征。不过，毫无疑问，学龄前儿童有时会表现出使用外部符号的前兆。从这个角度来看，某些情况特别有趣。例如，在我们建议一个孩子使用卡片来完成他的任务（“拿起卡片，它们会帮助你获胜”）之后，他寻找禁忌的颜色，并把所有这些卡片放在他看不见的地方，好像试图阻止自己说出它们的名字。

This transcript suggests that the “aids” actually hindered this child. His repeated use of “white” as a response occurred when his attention was fixed on the white card. The aids are only an accidental feature of the situation for him. Still, there is no doubt that preschool children sometimes demonstrate precursors of the use of external signs. From this point of view certain cases are of special interest. For example, after we suggested to a child that he use the cards to carry out his task (“take the cards, they will help you to win”), he searched for the forbidden colors and put all such cards out of his sight, as if trying to prevent himself from naming them.

尽管使用卡片的方法看起来多种多样，但使用卡片的方法可以归结为两种基本类型。首先，孩子可以把禁用的颜色放在看不见的地方，展示其余的颜色，当他回答问题时，把已经命名的颜色放在一边。这是效率较低但 这是最早使用的方法。在这种情况下，卡片仅用于记录所命名的颜色。最初，孩子们在回答有关颜色的问题之前通常不会翻看卡片，只有在说出颜色后，他们才会在卡片中搜索、翻转、移动或收起所命名的卡片。这无疑是借助外部手段进行记忆的最简单的行为。直到后来，实验条件才赋予卡片新的第二种功能。在命名颜色之前，孩子会借助卡片进行选择。孩子是看尚未使用的卡片，还是关注已经命名的颜色，这都无关紧要。无论哪种情况，卡片都会介入这一过程，并充当调节其活动的一种手段。初步隐藏禁用颜色是第一种使用卡片的方法的一个显著特征，但这还不会导致用更复杂的操作完全取代不太成熟的操作；它只是朝着这个方向迈出了一步。其发生的部分原因是掌握记忆的这种操作更为简单，部分原因是儿童经常表现出对各种潜在解决问题的辅助手段的“神奇”态度。

In spite of their apparent variety, methods for using the cards can be reduced to two basic types. First the child may put forbidden colors out of sight, display the remainder, and, as he answers the questions, place the colors already named to one side. This is the less effective but the earliest method used. The card in this case serves only to register the named color. Initially, children often do not turn to the cards before they answer the question about color, and only after it is named do they search among the cards, turn over, move, or put away the one named. This is undoubtedly the simplest act of memorization with the help of external means. It is only later that the conditions of the experiment bestow a new, second function on the cards. Before naming a color the child makes a selection with the help of the cards. It makes no difference whether the child looks at the cards so far unused or whether she attends to the colors she has already named. In either case the cards are interposed in the process and serve as a means of regulating her activity. The preliminary hiding of forbidden colors, which is a distinguishing characteristic of the first method for using the cards, does not yet lead to the complete substitution of a less mature operation by a more complex one; it represents merely a step in that direction. Its occurrence is explained partly by the greater simplicity of this operation in mastering memory and partly by a “magical” attitude toward various potential problem-solving aids that children frequently display.

以下来自一名十三岁女学生的例子可以说明这些观点：

The following examples from a thirteen-year-old schoolgirl illustrate these points:

任务2. 禁忌颜色：绿色和黄色（无卡片） 。

Task 2. Forbidden colors: green and yellow (without cards) .

1. 你有玩伴吗？ 是的。
2. 你的衬衣是什么颜色的？ 灰色的。
3. 你坐过火车吗？ 是的。
4. 火车车厢是什么颜色的？ 灰色。[注意到她重复了两次相同的颜色，笑了。]
5. 你想成为大女孩吗？ 是的。
6. 您曾经去过剧院吗？ 是的。
7. 你喜欢在房间里玩吗？ 是的。
8. 地板是什么颜色的？ 格雷：（犹豫了一下。）又——我又说了一遍。
9. 还有墙壁？ 白色的。
10. 你会写字吗？ 是的。
11.你见过丁香花吗？ 是的。
12. 丁香色是什么颜色？ 淡紫色。
13. 你喜欢甜食吗？ 是的。
14. 您曾经去过该国吗？ 是的。

任务 2. 禁忌颜色：绿色和黄色（无卡片） —续 。

Task 2. Forbidden colors: green and yellow (without cards) —cont .

15. 树叶是什么颜色的？ 绿色——不，不应该说绿色——有时是棕色、红色。
16. 你会游泳吗？ 是的。
17. 你最喜欢的颜色是什么？ 黄色！我不能 [把手举到头后面。]
18. 你用铅笔做什么？ 写。
您觉得怎样，赢了还是输了？ 丢失的。
你不该说什么？ 绿色和黄色。
还有什么？ 不该重覆。

任务3.禁忌颜色：蓝色和红色（带卡片） 。

Task 3. Forbidden colors: blue and red (with cards) .

受试者将禁忌的颜色放在一边，将剩余的颜色在她面前排成一排。

The subject puts forbidden colors to one side and spreads out the remainder in a row before her.

1. 你经常在街上散步吗？ 是的。
2. 房子是什么颜色的？ 加里。[回答完之后，看了看卡片，然后翻开了灰色的那张。]
3. 阳光灿烂吗？ 明亮地。
4. 天空是什么颜色的？ 白色。[先看牌然后将其翻过来。]
5. 你喜欢糖果吗？ 是的。
6. 你见过玫瑰吗？ 是的。
7. 你喜欢蔬菜吗？ 是的。
8. 西红柿是什么颜色的？ 绿色。[翻开卡片。]
9. 还有练习册吗？ 黄色。[翻开卡片。]
10. 你有玩具吗？ 不。
11. 你打球吗？ 是的。
12. 球是什么颜色的？ 加里。[没有看卡片；回答后，看了一眼并发现错误。]
13. 你住在城里吗？ 是的。
14. 你看了示威游行吗？ 是的。
15. 旗帜是什么颜色的？ 黑色。[先看牌，然后翻一张。]
16. 你有什么书吗？ 是的。
17. 它们的封面是什么颜色的？ 淡紫色[翻牌]。
18. 什么时候天黑？ 晚上。

我们的结果表明，在记录和表 1中 ，中介记忆的发展有三个基本阶段。在第一阶段（学龄前），儿童无法通过组织特殊刺激来控制自己的行为。彩色卡片可能有助于儿童完成任务，但不会显著提高这一操作的有效性。虽然它们起到了刺激的作用，但它们并没有获得工具功能。发展的第二阶段的特点是两个主要任务的指标存在明显差异。引入卡片作为辅助外部刺激系统可大大提高儿童活动的有效性。在这个阶段，外部符号占主导地位。辅助刺激是一种从外部起作用的心理工具。在第三阶段（成年人之间），他们在两项任务中的表现之间的差异缩小，他们的系数变得更接近相等，但现在是在一个新的更高的基础上。这并不意味着成年人的行为再次变得直接和自然。在这个更高的发展阶段，行为仍然是中介的。但现在我们看到，在第三项任务中，辅助刺激从原始的外部形式中解放出来。发生的就是我们所说的内化；学童需要的外部符号已经转化为成人作为记忆手段产生的内部符号。这一系列适用于不同年龄段的人的任务显示了中介行为的外部形式是如何发展的。

Our results as reflected in the transcripts and table 1 indicate three basic stages in the development of mediated remembering. At the first stage (preschool age) the child is not capable of mastering his behavior by organizing special stimuli. The colored cards that might help the child in his task do not increase to any considerable extent the effectiveness of this operation. Although they act as stimuli, they do not acquire an instrumental function. The second stage of development is characterized by a sharp difference in the indices in both of the main tasks. The introduction of cards as a system of auxiliary, external stimuli raises the effectiveness of the child’s activity considerably. At this stage the external sign predominates. The auxiliary stimulus is a psychological instrument acting from the outside. At the third stage (among adults) the difference between their performance in the two tasks decreases and their coefficients become more nearly equal, but now on a new and higher basis. This does not mean that the behavior of adults again becomes direct and natural. At this higher stage of development behavior remains mediated. But now we see that in the third task the auxiliary stimuli are emancipated from primary external forms. What takes place is what we have called internalization; the external sign that school children require has been transformed into an internal sign produced by the adult as a means of remembering. This series of tasks applied to people of different ages shows how the external forms of mediated behavior develop.

符号运算的自然历史

THE NATURAL HISTORY OF SIGN OPERATIONS

尽管心理操作的间接（或中介）方面是高级心理过程的一个基本特征，但正如我在语言起源问题上指出的那样，相信间接操作是纯逻辑的结果将是一个极大的错误。它们不是孩子以突然的洞察力或闪电般的猜测（所谓的“啊哈”反应）的形式发明或发现的。孩子不会突然和不可逆转地推断出符号与使用符号的方法之间的关系。她也不会直观地形成一种抽象的态度，可以说，这种态度源自“孩子自己内心深处”。这种形而上学的观点认为，固有的心理图式先于任何经验而存在，这不可避免地导致了对高级心理功能的先验概念。

Although the indirect (or mediated) aspect of psychological operations is an essential feature of higher mental processes, it would be a great mistake, as I pointed out with respect to the beginnings of speech, to believe that indirect operations appear as the result of a pure logic. They are not invented or discovered by the child in the form of a sudden insight or lightning-quick guess (the so-called “aha” reaction). The child does not suddenly and irrevocably deduce the relation between the sign and the method for using it. Nor does she intuitively develop an abstract attitude derived, so to speak, from “the depths of the child’s own mind.” This metaphysical view, according to which inherent psychological schemata exist prior to any experience, leads inevitably to an a priori conception of higher psychological functions.

我们的研究得出了截然不同的结论。我们发现，符号运算是复杂而漫长的过程的结果，这个过程受心理进化的所有基本规律的支配。这 这意味着儿童使用符号的活动不是成人简单地发明或传下来的， 而是从某种原本不是符号操作的东西中产生的，只有经过一系列质的 转变后才成为符号操作。这些转变中的每一个都为下一阶段提供了条件，而本身又受前一阶段的制约；因此，转变就像一个过程的各个阶段一样相互联系，具有历史性。在这方面，高级心理功能也不例外，它们也遵循基本过程的一般规律，没有例外，并且在儿童心理发展的一般过程中作为同一辩证过程的结果出现，而不是从外部或内部引入的东西。

Our research has led us to quite different conclusions. We have found that sign operations appear as a result of a complex and prolonged process subject to all the basic laws of psychological evolution. This means that sign-using activity in children is neither simply invented nor passed down by adults; rather it arises from something that is originally not a sign operation and becomes one only after a series of qualitative transformations. Each of these transformations provides the conditions for the next stage and is itself conditioned by the preceding one; thus, transformations are linked like stages of a single process, and are historical in nature. In this respect, the higher psychological functions are no exception to the general rule that applies to elementary processes; they, too, are subject to the fundamental law of development which knows no exceptions, and appear in the general course of the child’s psychological development as the outcome of the same dialectical process, not as something introduced from without or from within.

如果我们将高级心理功能的历史作为心理发展的一个因素，我们就必须得出一个新的发展概念。在 一般的发展过程中，可以区分出两条起源不同、性质不同的发展路线：一方面是源自生物的基本过程，另一方面是源自社会文化的高级心理功能。儿童行为的历史源于这两条路线的交织 。如果不研究高级心理功能的史前史、生物学根源和有机性质，就不可能了解高级心理功能的发展史。两种基本的文化行为形式的发展根源出现在婴儿期：使用工具 和人类语言 。仅凭这一点就将婴儿期置于文化发展史前史的中心。

If we include this history of higher psychological functions as a factor in psychological development, we must arrive at a new concept of development itself. Within a general process of development, two qualitatively different lines of development, differing in origin, can be distinguished: the elementary processes, which are of biological origin, on the one hand, and the higher psychological functions, of sociocultural origin, on the other. The history of child behavior is born from the interweaving of these two lines . The history of the development of the higher psychological functions is impossible without a study of their prehistory, their biological roots, and their organic disposition. The developmental roots of two fundamental, cultural forms of behavior arise during infancy: the use of tools and human speech . This alone places infancy at the center of the prehistory of cultural development.

复杂手势操作的潜力在个人发展的最初阶段就已存在。然而，观察表明，在初始水平（基本行为）和更高水平（中介行为形式）之间，存在许多过渡心理系统 。在行为历史中，这些过渡系统介于生物给定和文化习得之间。我们将这一过程称为手势的自然历史 。

The potential for complex sign operations is embedded in the earliest stages of individual development. However, observations show that between the initial level (elementary behavior) and the higher levels (mediated forms of behavior) many transitional psychological systems occur. In the history of behavior these transitional systems lie between the biologically given and the culturally acquired. We refer to this process as the natural history of the sign .

另一个旨在研究中介记忆的实验范式提供了观察手势自然历史的机会。NG Morozova 向孩子们展示了要记住的单词和可以用作媒介的辅助图片。4她 发现，在学龄前阶段，有目的地使用辅助图片（手势）作为记忆手段的想法对孩子来说仍然很陌生。即使孩子确实求助于辅助图片来记住一个给定的单词，他也不一定能轻松地执行反向操作。在这个阶段，学习者通常不会回忆起主要刺激 当被展示辅助刺激时。相反，该符号唤起一个新的联想或融合系列，由以下方案表示：

Another experimental paradigm designed to study mediated memorizing provides the opportunity to observe this natural history of the sign. N. G. Morozova presented children with words to remember and auxiliary pictures that could be used as mediators.4 She found that during the preschool years the idea of purposefully using the auxiliary picture (sign) as a means of memorizing is still foreign to the child. Even if the child did turn to the auxiliary picture in order to memorize a given word, it was not necessarily easy for him to execute the reverse operation. At this stage the learner does not usually recall the primary stimulus when being shown the auxiliary stimulus. Rather, the sign evokes a new associative or syncretic series represented by the following scheme:

图 2

Figure 2

该操作尚未发展到更高级的水平，即使用文化上精心设计的特征进行形式调解。与图 2相比 ，调解记忆的通常方案可以用以下方式表示：

The operation has not yet progressed to the more advanced level which is mediated in form using culturally elaborated features. In contrast with figure 2 , the usual scheme for mediated memorizing can be represented by the following:

图 3

Figure 3

在图2所示的过程中 ，Y可能 引发一系列新的联想，主体可能从这些联想中 到达起点A。然而，这个序列仍然缺乏其目的性和工具性。在第二种方案中，单词的辅助符号X具有反向作用的性质，因此主体可以可靠地检索A。

During the process represented by figure 2 , Y may lead to a whole series of new associations, among which the subject may arrive at the starting point A. However, this sequence is still devoid of its purposeful and instrumental character. In the second scheme, the word’s auxiliary sign, X, possesses the quality of reverse action, so that the subject can reliably retrieve A.

下列取自我学生作品的例子可以说明从图 2中的方案到图 3 中的方案的步骤。LV Zankov 证明，年龄较小的儿童，特别是 4 至 6 岁之间的儿童，必须依靠“提示”符号和要记住的单词之间有意义的、现成的联系。5 如果以无意义的图形作为记忆辅助手段，儿童通常会拒绝使用它们；他们不会尝试在图片提示和他们应该记住的单词之间建立联系。相反，他们会尝试将这些图形变成要记住的单词的直接副本。

The steps leading from the scheme in figure 2 to the scheme in figure 3 can be illustrated by the following examples taken from the work of my students. L. V. Zankov demonstrated that younger children, particularly between the ages of four and six, must rely on meaningful, ready-made links between the “reminder” sign and the word to be remembered.5 If meaningless figures were presented as memory aids, the children would often refuse to make use of them; they would make no attempt to make up connections between the picture cue and the word they were supposed to remember. Rather, they would attempt to turn these figures into direct copies of the to-be-remembered word.

例如，图形 是用来提醒“桶”这个词的，它被孩子们倒过来，只有当图形 真的开始像一个桶时，它才提醒他们这个词。同样， 只有当图形倒过来时，它才成为“长凳”这个词的符号（ ）。在所有这些 在一些情况下，儿童通过改变符号的含义将图形与单词刺激联系起来，而不是使用实验者提供的中介链接。引入这些无意义的图形鼓励儿童进行积极的记忆活动，而不是依赖已经形成的链接，但这也导致他们将符号刺激视为要记住的对象的直接表示。当这被证明是不可能的时，孩子拒绝记忆。

For example, the figure , presented as a reminder of the word “bucket,” was turned upside down by the children and served to remind them of the word only when the figure really began to resemble a bucket. Similarly, the figure became the sign of the word “bench” only when turned upside down ( ). In all these cases, children linked the figures to the word stimuli by changing the meaning of the sign instead of using the mediating link offered by the experimenter. The introduction of these meaningless figures encouraged the children to engage in active mnemonic activity instead of relying on already formed links, but it also led them to treat the sign stimulus as the direct representation of the object to be remembered. When this proved impossible, the child refused to memorize.

尤瑟维奇未发表的一项针对幼儿的研究中也发现了类似的现象。辅助刺激是一些与所呈现的单词没有直接关系的图片，很少被用作符号。孩子看着图片，试图从中找出她必须记住的物体。例如，当被要求借助一幅画着斧头的图片记住“太阳”这个词时，一个孩子非常轻松地做到了；她指着图画中的一个小黄点说：“太阳就在那里。”这个孩子用寻找刺激的直接表征（类似于图像记忆）取代了可能复杂的工具性记忆。孩子在辅助符号中寻找类似图像记忆的表征。在赞科夫和尤瑟维奇的例子中，孩子都是通过直接表征而不是中介符号化的过程来重现所需的单词 。

A similar phenomenon is apparent in U. C. Yussevich’s unpublished study with small children. The auxiliary stimuli, which were pictures that bore no direct relation to the word presented, were rarely used as signs. The child looked at the picture and tried to see in it the object she had to remember. For example, when asked to remember the word “sun” with the help of a picture showing an axe, one child did it very easily; she pointed to a small yellow spot in the drawing and said, “There it is, the sun.” This child replaced potentially complex instrumental memorization by a search for a direct representation of the stimulus (akin to an eidetic image). The child sought an eidetic-like representation in the auxiliary sign. In both the Zankov and Yussevich examples, the child reproduced the required word through a process of direct representation rather than mediated symbolization .

描述符号操作在此发展阶段的作用的规律与描述儿童在完全发展的符号操作中如何将单词与符号联系起来的规律完全不同。刚刚描述的实验中的儿童说明了基本过程和完全工具性过程之间的发展阶段，完全中介操作随后将从该阶段发展。

The laws describing the role of sign operations at this stage of development are completely different from the laws describing how the child links up a word with a sign in fully developed sign operations. Children in the experiments just described illustrate a stage of development between the elementary and the completely instrumental process from which fully mediated operations will later develop.

Leontiev 关于记忆中符号操作发展的研究提供了支持上述理论观点以及记忆中符号操作发展后期阶段的例子。6他 为不同年龄和不同智力水平的儿童提供了一组 20 个单词供他们回忆。材料以三种方式呈现。首先，每隔大约三秒钟就简单地说出这些单词，并让儿童回忆它们。在第二个任务中，给孩子一组 20 张图片，并让他们使用它们来帮助回忆单词。这些图片不是单词的复制品，而是与单词相关的。在第三个系列中，使用了 20 张与要记住的单词没有明显关系的图片。这项研究的基本问题是，儿童在多大程度上可以将他们的记忆转化为一种使用图片作为辅助记忆工具的中介活动，以及他们的成功如何取决于这两个可能被中介的系列所代表的不同难度。

Leontiev’s work on the development of sign operations in memory provides examples supporting the theoretical points discussed above as well as later stages in the development of sign operations in memory.6 He gave a set of twenty words for recall to children of different ages and levels of mental ability. The materials were presented in three ways. First, the words were simply spoken at intervals of about three seconds and the child was told to recall them. In a second task the child was given a set of twenty pictures and told to use them to help recall the words. The pictures were not replicas of the words but were associated with them. In the third series twenty pictures bearing no obvious relation to the to-be-remembered words were used. The basic questions in this research were to what extent can children convert their remembering into a mediated activity using pictures as auxiliary memory aids and how does their success depend upon the different degrees of difficulty represented by the two, potentially mediated, series.

正如我们所料，结果因组而异 儿童的记忆能力和回忆任务的难度。正常儿童（10 至 12 岁）在有图片作为记忆辅助时回忆起的单词数量是没有图片时的两倍。他们能够同样好地利用这两组图片。同龄的轻度智障儿童从图片的存在中获益甚微，甚至根本没有获益；而对于重度智障儿童，辅助刺激实际上会干扰表现。

As we might expect, the results differed depending upon the group of children and the difficulty of the recall task. Normal children (ten to twelve years of age) recalled twice as many words when the pictures were available as memory aids as they did without them. They were able to make use of both picture series equally well. Mildly retarded children of the same age benefited little, if at all, from the presence of the pictures; and for severely retarded children, the auxiliary stimuli actually interfered with performance.

本研究的原始记录清楚地显示了中等水平的功能，其中儿童注意辅助图片刺激，甚至将其与要回忆的单词联系起来，但无法将刺激整合到他的记忆系统中。因此，一个孩子选择了一张洋葱图片来回忆单词“晚餐”。当被问及为什么选择这张图片时，她给出了非常令人满意的答案：“因为我吃了一个洋葱。”然而，她在实验过程中无法回忆起“晚餐”这个词。这个例子表明，形成基本联想的能力不足以确保联想关系能够实现产生回忆所必需的工具 功能。这种证据使我们得出结论，中介心理功能（在这种情况下是中介记忆）的发展代表了一条特殊的发展路线，并不完全与基本过程的发展一致。

The original transcripts from this study clearly show intermediate levels of functioning in which the child attends to the auxiliary picture stimulus and even associates it with the word to be recalled but cannot integrate the stimulus into his system of remembering. Thus, one child selected a picture of an onion to recall the word “dinner.” When asked why she chose the picture, she gave the perfectly satisfactory answer, “Because I eat an onion.” However, she was unable to recall the word “dinner” during the experiment. This example shows that the ability to form elementary associations is not sufficient to ensure that the associative relation will fulfill the instrumental function necessary to produce recall. This kind of evidence leads us to conclude that the development of mediated psychological functions (in this case, mediated memory) represents a special line of development that does not wholly coincide with the development of elementary processes.

我还应该指出，添加图片作为记忆辅助工具并没有帮助成年人回忆。“失败”的原因与记忆辅助工具对严重智障儿童不起作用的原因完全相反。对于成年人来说，中介记忆的过程已经发展得非常充分，即使没有特殊的外部辅助工具，它也会进行。

I should mention also that the addition of pictures as memory aids did not facilitate recall of adults. The reason for the “failure” is directly opposite to the reasons underlying the failure of memory aids to affect the severely retarded children. In the case of adults, the process of mediated memorizing is so fully developed that it occurs even in the absence of special external aids.

记忆与思考

MEMORY AND THINKING

随着儿童年龄的增长，记忆活动并不仅仅发生了变化；这些活动在心理功能系统中的作用也发生了变化。非中介记忆发生在心理操作的背景下，这些心理操作可能与伴随中介记忆的心理操作完全没有共同之处；因此，实验结果可能表明某些心理功能被其他功能所取代。换句话说，随着发展水平的变化，与其说是单一功能（例如，我们可以称之为记忆）的结构发生了变化，不如说是记忆所依赖的功能的特征发生了变化；改变的是将记忆与其他功能联系起来的功能间 关系。

Remembering activities do not simply change as the child grows older; the role of these activities in the system of psychological functions also changes. Nonmediated memory takes place in the context of psychological operations that may have nothing at all in common with the psychological operations that accompany mediated remembering; consequently, experimental results may make it appear that some psychological functions are replaced by others. In other words, with a change in developmental level there occurs a change not so much in the structure of a single function (which, for example, we may call memory) as in the character of those functions with the aid of which remembering takes place; what changes is the interfunctional relations that connect memory with other functions.

年龄较大的儿童的记忆不仅与年龄较小的儿童的记忆不同，而且在年龄较大的儿童的认知活动中也发挥着不同的作用。幼儿时期的记忆是所有其他心理功能的基础之一。我们的分析表明，幼儿的思维在许多方面都由记忆决定，与成熟儿童的思维肯定不同。对于幼儿来说，思考意味着记忆；在幼儿期之后，我们再也没有看到这两种心理功能之间有如此密切的联系。

The memory of older children is not only different from the memory of younger children; it also plays a different role in the older child’s cognitive activity. Memory in early childhood is one of the central psychological functions upon which all the other functions are built. Our analyses suggest that thinking in the very young child is in many respects determined by his memory, and is certainly not the same thing as the thinking of the more mature child. For the very young child, to think means to remember; at no time after very early childhood do we see such a close connection between these two psychological functions.

我举三个例子。第一个例子是儿童基于回忆而定义概念。如果你问一个孩子什么是蜗牛，他会说蜗牛很小，会滑行，会伸出脚；如果你问他什么是祖母，他可能会回答：“她有柔软的膝盖。”在这两种情况下，孩子都清楚地总结了这个话题给他留下的印象和他所回忆的印象。孩子在定义这些概念时，思维行为的内容与其说是由概念本身的逻辑结构决定的，不如说是由孩子的具体回忆决定的。它具有融合性，反映了孩子的思维首先依赖于记忆的事实。

I will give three examples. The first is the definition of concepts in children, which are based on their recollections. If you ask a child to tell you what a snail is, he will say that it is little, it slithers, and it sticks out its foot; if you ask him to tell you what a grandmother is, he is likely to reply, “She has a soft lap.” In both cases the child gives a very clear summary of the impressions which the topic has made upon him and which he recollects. The content of the thinking act in the child when defining such concepts is determined not so much by the logical structure of the concept itself as by the child’s concrete recollections. It is syncretic in character and reflects the fact that the child’s thinking depends first of all on his memory.

另一个例子是幼儿视觉概念的发展。当要求儿童将通过一组刺激学到的关系转移到另一组类似的刺激上时，对儿童思维的调查表明，他们的转移只不过是对孤立实例的记忆。他们对世界的一般表述是基于对具体实例的回忆，还不具备抽象的特征。7

Another example is the development of visual concepts in very young children. Investigations of children’s thinking when they are required to transpose a relation learned with one set of stimuli to a similar set have shown that their transfer is nothing more than remembering with respect to isolated instances. Their general representations of the world are based on the recall of concrete instances and do not yet possess the character of an abstraction.7

最后一个例子涉及词义分析。该领域的研究表明，幼儿和成人的词语联系有着根本的不同。儿童的概念与一系列例子有关，其构建方式与我们表示姓氏的方式相似。给他们命名词语，与其说是为了表示熟悉的概念，不如说是为了命名熟悉的家族或通过视觉纽带联系在一起的整组视觉事物。这样，儿童的经验和儿童经验的“直接”影响就被记录在他的记忆中，并直接决定了幼儿思维的整个结构。

The last example concerns the analysis of word meaning. Investigations in this area show that the connections underlying words are fundamentally different in the young child and in the adult. Children’s concepts relate to a series of examples and are constructed in a manner similar to the way we represent family names. To name words for them is not so much to indicate familiar concepts as to name familiar families or whole groups of visual things connected by visual ties. In this way the experience of the child and the “unmediated” influence of the child’s experience are documented in his memory and directly determine the entire structure of the young child’s thought.

所有这些事实表明，从心理发展的角度来看，记忆而不是抽象思维才是决定性的 这是认知发展早期阶段的特征。然而，在发展过程中，尤其是在青春期，会发生转变。对这个年龄段记忆的研究表明，在童年末期，涉及记忆的相互关系会逆转方向。对于幼儿来说，思考意味着回忆；但对于青少年来说，回忆意味着思考 。她的记忆是如此“逻辑化”，以至于记忆被简化为建立和寻找逻辑关系；识别在于发现任务指示必须找到的元素。

All these facts suggest that, from the point of view of psychological development, memory rather than abstract thought is the definitive characteristic of the early stages of cognitive development. However, in the course of development a transformation occurs, especially in adolescence. Investigations of memory at this age have shown that toward the end of childhood the interfunctional relations involving memory reverse their direction. For the young child, to think means to recall; but for the adolescent, to recall means to think . Her memory is so “logicalized” that remembering is reduced to establishing and finding logical relations; recognizing consists in discovering that element which the task indicates has to be found.

这种逻辑化表明了认知功能之间的关系在发展过程中是如何变化的。在过渡时期，所有的想法和概念，所有心理结构，都不再按照家庭类型来组织，而是以抽象概念的形式组织起来。

This logicalization is indicative of how relations among cognitive functions change in the course of development. At the transitional age all ideas and concepts, all mental structures, cease to be organized according to family types and become organized as abstract concepts.

毫无疑问，在概念思维中记住一件事与在复合体思维中记住一件事是完全不同的任务，尽管这两个过程是相互兼容的。8因此 ，研究儿童记忆的发展不仅要考虑记忆本身发生的变化，还要考虑记忆与其他功能之间的关系。

There can be no doubt that to remember an item when thinking in concepts is a completely different task from thinking in complexes, although the processes are compatible with each other.8 Therefore, the development of children’s memory must be studied not only with respect to changes happening within memory itself, but also with respect to the relation between memory and other functions.

当一个人在手帕上打结以作提醒时，她实际上是在通过强迫外部物体提醒她某事来构建记忆过程；她将记忆转变为外部活动。仅凭这一事实就足以证明高级行为形式的根本特征。在基本形式中，人们记住了某事；在高级形式中，人类记住了某事。在第一种情况下，由于同时发生两种刺激影响有机体，形成了临时联系；在第二种情况下，人类通过人为的刺激组合亲自创建了临时联系。

When a human being ties a knot in her handkerchief as a reminder, she is, in essence, constructing the process of memorizing by forcing an external object to remind her of something; she transforms remembering into an external activity. This fact alone is enough to demonstrate the fundamental characteristic of the higher forms of behavior. In the elementary form something is remembered; in the higher form humans remember something. In the first case a temporary link is formed owing to the simultaneous occurrence of two stimuli that affect the organism; in the second case humans personally create a temporary link through an artificial combination of stimuli.

人类记忆的本质在于人类借助符号主动记忆。可以说，人类行为的基本特征是人类亲自影响他们与环境的关系，并通过环境亲自改变他们的行为，使其受其控制。有人指出，文明的本质在于有目的地建造纪念碑，以免忘记。无论是结还是纪念碑，我们都看到了人类记忆与动物记忆最基本、最典型的特征。

The very essence of human memory consists in the fact that human beings actively remember with the help of signs. It may be said that the basic characteristic of human behavior in general is that humans personally influence their relations with the environment and through that environment personally change their behavior, subjugating it to their control. It has been remarked that the very essence of civilization consists of purposely building monuments so as not to forget. In both the knot and the monument we have manifestations of the most fundamental and characteristic feature distinguishing human from animal memory.

4

4

高级心理功能的内化

Internalization of Higher Psychological Functions

巴甫洛夫在比较非条件反射和条件反射的调节原理时，用电话通话来举例。一种可能是电话通过一条特殊的线路直接连接两个点。这对应于非条件反射。另一种可能是电话通过一个特殊的中央站，借助临时的、无限可变的连接进行中继。这对应于条件反射。大脑皮层作为关闭条件反射回路的器官，起着这种中央站的作用。

When comparing the principles regulating unconditioned and conditioned reflexes, Pavlov uses the example of a telephone call. One possibility is for the call to connect two points directly via a special line. This corresponds to an unconditioned reflex. The other possibility is for the phone call to be relayed through a special, central station with the help of temporary and limitlessly variable connections. This corresponds to a conditioned reflex. The cerebral cortex, as the organ that closes the conditioned reflex circuit, plays the role of such a central station.

我们对符号生成（信号化）过程的分析的基本信息可以用同一隐喻的更一般化形式来表达。我们以打结作为提醒或抽签作为决策手段为例。毫无疑问，在这两种情况下，都会形成暂时的条件连接，即巴甫洛夫的第二种连接。但如果我们想掌握这里发生的事情的本质，我们就不得不考虑电话机制的功能，以及插入并连接线路的接线员的功能。在我们的例子中，连接是由打结的人建立的。这一特征将高级行为形式与低级行为形式区分开来。

The fundamental message of our analysis of the processes that underlie the creation of signs (signalization) may be expressed by a more generalized form of the same metaphor. Let us take the case of tying a knot as a reminder or drawing lots as a means of decision making. There is no doubt that in both cases a temporary conditioned connection is formed, that is, a connection of Pavlov’s second type. But if we wish to grasp the essentials of what is happening here, we are forced to take into consideration not only the function of the telephone mechanism but also of the operator who plugged in and thus connected the line. In our example, the connection was established by the person who tied the knot. This feature distinguishes the higher forms of behavior from the lower.

发明和使用符号作为解决特定心理问题（记忆、比较、报告、选择等）的辅助手段，类似于发明和使用工具，这在心理学的一个方面是相似的。符号作为一种心理活动的工具，其作用类似于工具在劳动中的作用。但这种类比，像任何其他类比一样，并不意味着这些类似的工具是同一的。 概念。我们不应该期望在我们称之为符号的适应手段中发现与工具的很多 相似之处。更重要的是，除了两种活动所具有的相似和共同特征外，我们还看到了非常本质的区别。

The invention and use of signs as auxiliary means of solving a given psychological problem (to remember, compare something, report, choose, and so on) is analogous to the invention and use of tools in one psychological respect. The sign acts as an instrument of psychological activity in a manner analogous to the role of a tool in labor. But this analogy, like any other, does not imply the identity of these similar concepts. We should not expect to find many similarities with tools in those means of adaptation we call signs. What’s more, in addition to the similar and common feature shared by the two kinds of activity, we see very essential differences.

在这里，我们希望尽可能精确。一些心理学家依靠该术语的比喻意义，在指代物体作为完成某项活动的手段的间接功能时使用“工具”一词。诸如“舌头是思维的工具”或“记忆助手”之类的表达通常没有任何明确的内容，而且几乎无法表达出它们的真实含义：简单的隐喻和更丰富多彩的方式来表达某些物体或操作在心理活动中起辅助作用的事实。

Here we want to be as precise as possible. Leaning for support on the term’s figurative meaning, some psychologists have used the word “tool” when referring to the indirect function of an object as the means for accomplishing some activity. Expressions such as “the tongue is the tool of thought” or “aides de memoire” are usually bereft of any definite content and hardly mean more than what they really are: simple metaphors and more colorful ways of expressing the fact that certain objects or operations play an auxiliary role in psychological activity.

另一方面，人们曾多次试图赋予这些表达以字面意义，将符号等同于工具。通过消除它们之间的根本区别，这种方法失去了每种活动的具体特征，只给我们留下了一种普遍的心理决定形式。实用主义代表之一杜威就采取了这种立场。他将舌头定义为工具中的工具，将亚里士多德对人类手的定义转化为言语。
