On the other hand, there have been many attempts to invest such expressions with a literal meaning, to equate the sign with the tool. By erasing the fundamental distinction between them, this approach loses the specific characteristics of each type of activity and leaves us with one general psychological form of determination. This is the position adopted by Dewey, one of pragmatism’s representatives. He defines the tongue as the tool of tools, transposing Aristotle’s definition of the human hand to speech.

我希望大家清楚，我提出的符号与工具之间的类比不同于刚才讨论的任何一种方法。通常从“工具”一词的比喻用法中理解的不确定、模糊的含义丝毫不会减轻研究人员的任务。他的任务是揭示行为与其辅助手段之间存在的真正关系，而不是比喻关系。我们应该将思想或记忆设想为类似于外部活动吗？“活动手段”是否只是扮演着支持依赖它们的心理过程的不确定角色？这种支持的性质是什么？一般来说，成为思想或记忆的“手段”意味着什么？喜欢使用这些模糊表达方式的心理学家并没有为我们提供这些问题的答案。

I wish it to be clear that the analogy between sign and tool that I propose is different from either of the approaches just discussed. The uncertain, indistinct meaning that is usually read into the figurative use of the word “tool” in no way eases the researcher’s task. His task is to uncover the real relationship, not the figurative one, that exists between behavior and its auxiliary means. Should we conceive of thought or memory as being analogous to external activity? Do the “means of activity” simply play the indefinite role of supporting the psychological process that leans on them? What is the nature of this support? What in general does it mean to be a “means” of thought or of memory? Psychologists who so enjoy using these fuzzy expressions furnish us with no answer to these questions.

但是，那些把这些表达按字面意思来对待的心理学家的立场却变得更加模糊。具有心理学方面但实际上不属于心理学的概念——例如“技术”——毫无根据地被心理学化了。只有忽略每种活动形式的本质以及它们的历史作用和性质之间的差异，才有可能将心理现象和非心理现象等同起来。工具作为掌握自然的劳动手段，语言作为社会交往手段，两者之间的区别 融入到人工制品或人工改编品的一般概念中。

But the position of those psychologists who treat such expressions literally turns out to be even fuzzier. Concepts that have a psychological aspect but do not actually belong to psychology—such as “technique’—are psychologized without any grounds whatsoever. Equating psychological and nonpsychological phenomena is possible only if one ignores the essence of each form of activity, as well as the differences between their historic roles and nature. Distinctions between tools as a means of labor of mastering nature, and language as a means of social intercourse become dissolved in the general concept of artifacts or artificial adaptations.

我们力求了解手势在所有独特性中的行为作用。这一目标促使我们进行实证研究，研究工具和手势的使用在儿童的文化发展中如何相互联系但又相互独立。我们采用了三个条件作为这项工作的起点。第一个条件涉及两种活动类型的相似性和共同点，第二个条件阐明了它们的基本区别，第三个条件试图证明两者之间存在的真正心理联系，或者至少暗示它的存在。

We seek to understand the behavioral role of the sign in all its uniqueness. This goal has motivated our empirical studies of how both tool and sign use are mutually linked and yet separate in the child’s cultural development. We have adopted three conditions as a starting point for this work. The first pertains to the analogy and common points of the two types of activity, the second clarifies their basic differences, and the third attempts to demonstrate the real psychological link existing between the one and the other, or at least to hint at its existence.

正如我们已经指出的，符号和工具之间的基本相似性取决于它们各自所特有的中介功能。因此，从心理学的角度来看，它们可以归入同一类别。我们可以使用图 4中的图式来表达符号和工具使用之间的逻辑关系 ，该图式显示了每个概念都归入了更一般的间接（中介）活动概念。

As we have already noted, the basic analogy between sign and tool rests on the mediating function that characterizes each of them. They may, therefore, from the psychological perspective, be subsumed under the same category. We can express the logical relationship between the use of signs and of tools using the schema in figure 4 , which shows each concept subsumed under the more general concept of indirect (mediated) activity.

图 4

Figure 4

黑格尔非常公正地赋予了这一概念最广泛的一般含义，他认为这一概念是人类理性的一个特征：“理性，”他写道，“既狡猾又强大。它的狡猾主要在于它的中介活动，这种中介活动通过使物体按照其本性相互作用和反作用，从而在没有任何直接干预的情况下实现理性的意图。” 1 马克思在谈到工作工具时引用了这一定义，以表明人类“利用物体的机械、物理和化学特性，使它们作为力量影响其他物体，以实现其个人目标。” 2

That concept, quite justly, was invested with the broadest general meaning by Hegel, who saw in it a characteristic feature of human reason: “Reason,” he wrote, “is just as cunning as she is powerful. Her cunning consists principally in her mediating activity which, by causing objects to act and react on each other in accordance with their own nature, in this way, without any direct interference in the process, carries out reasons’ intentions.’1 Marx cites that definition when speaking of working tools, to show that man “uses the mechanical, physical, and chemical properties of objects so as to make them act as forces that affect other objects in order to fulfill his personal goals.’2

这种分析为将符号的使用归入中介活动类别提供了坚实的基础，因为符号使用的本质在于人类通过符号影响行为。在这两种情况下，间接（中介）功能都占据了主导地位。我不会进一步定义这些共同包含的概念之间的关系，或它们与更一般的中介活动概念的关系。我只会 值得注意的是，在任何情况下，它们都不能被视为就其执行的功能而言是同构的，也不能被视为完全 穷尽了中介活动的概念。可以列举许多其他中介活动；认知活动不仅限于使用工具或符号。

This analysis provides a sound basis for assigning the use of signs to the category of mediated activity, for the essence of sign use consists in man’s affecting behavior through signs. In both cases the indirect (mediated) function comes to the forefront. I shall not define further the relation of these jointly subsumed concepts to each other, or their relation to the more generic concept of mediated activity. I should only like to note that neither can, under any circumstance, be considered isomorphic with respect to the functions they perform, nor can they be seen as fully exhausting the concept of mediated activity. A host of other mediated activities might be named; cognitive activity is not limited to the use of tools or signs.

在两个概念关系的纯逻辑层面上，我们的图式将两种适应手段表现为不同的中介活动路线。这种分歧是我们第二点的基础。符号和工具之间的最本质区别，以及这两条路线真正分歧的基础，是它们引导人类行为的不同方式。工具的功能是充当人类对活动对象影响的传导者；它是外向 的；它必须导致对象的变化。它是人类外部活动旨在掌握和战胜自然的一种手段。另一方面，符号不会改变心理操作对象的任何内容。它是旨在掌握自己的内部活动手段；符号是内向 的。这些活动彼此如此不同，以至于它们使用的手段的性质在两种情况下不可能相同。

On the purely logical plane of the relation between the two concepts, our schema represents the two means of adaptation as diverging lines of mediated activity. This divergence is the basis for our second point. A most essential difference between sign and tool, and the basis for the real divergence of the two lines, is the different ways that they orient human behavior. The tool’s function is to serve as the conductor of human influence on the object of activity; it is externally oriented; it must lead to changes in objects. It is a means by which human external activity is aimed at mastering, and triumphing over, nature. The sign, on the other hand, changes nothing in the object of a psychological operation. It is a means of internal activity aimed at mastering oneself; the sign is internally oriented. These activities are so different from each other that the nature of the means they use cannot be the same in both cases.

最后，第三点涉及这些活动之间的真正联系，因此也涉及它们在种系发生和个体发生中发展的真正联系。掌握自然和掌握行为是相互联系的，正如人类对自然的改变会改变人类自身的本性一样。在种系发生中，我们可以通过零碎但令人信服的文献证据重建这种联系，而在个体发生中，我们可以通过实验来追踪这种联系。

Finally, the third point pertains to the real tie between these activities and, hence, to the real tie of their development in phylo- and ontogenesis. The mastering of nature and the mastering of behavior are mutually linked, just as man’s alteration of nature alters man’s own nature. In phylogenesis we can reconstruct this link through fragmentary but convincing documentary evidence, while in ontogenesis we can trace it experimentally.

有一件事已经确定了。正如工具的首次使用驳斥了发展仅仅代表儿童有机预定活动系统的展开这一观点一样，符号的首次使用也表明，不可能存在一个针对每种心理功能的单一有机预定内部活动系统。人工手段的使用，向中介活动的过渡，从根本上改变了所有心理操作，正如工具的使用无限地扩大了新心理功能可以运作的活动范围一样。在这种情况下，我们可以使用高级 心理功能或高级行为这一术语 来指代心理活动中工具和符号的结合。

One thing is already certain. Just as the first use of tools refutes the notion that development represents the mere unfolding of the child’s organically predetermined system of activity, so the first use of signs demonstrates that there cannot be a single organically predetermined internal system of activity that exists for each psychological function. The use of artificial means, the transition to mediated activity, fundamentally changes all psychological operations just as the use of tools limitlessly broadens the range of activities within which the new psychological functions may operate. In this context, we can use the term higher psychological function, or higher behavior as referring to the combination of tool and sign in psychological activity.

到目前为止，已经描述了符号操作使用的几个阶段。在最初阶段，对外部符号的依赖对于儿童的努力至关重要。但随着发展，这些操作会发生根本性的变化：整个中介活动的操作（例如， 当儿童开始记忆时，其内在过程开始发生。矛盾的是，儿童后期的行为似乎与早期记忆相同，后者的特点是直接的过程。幼儿不依赖外部手段，而是采用“自然”、“视觉感知”的方法。仅从外表来判断，似乎大一点的孩子只是开始记忆得更多更好，她以某种方式完善和发展了她以前的记忆方法。在最高水平上，她似乎已经放弃了对任何符号的依赖。然而，这种表象只是假象。正如经常发生的那样，发展在这里不是以圆圈的形式进行，而是以螺旋的形式进行，在每次新的旋转中都经过同一个点，同时向更高的水平迈进。

Several phases in the use of sign operations have been described thus far. In the initial phase reliance upon external signs is crucial to the child’s effort. But through development these operations undergo radical changes: the entire operation of mediated activity (for example, memorizing) begins to take place as a purely internal process. Paradoxically, late stages of the child’s behavior appear to be the same as early stages of memorizing, which were characterized by a direct process. The very young child does not rely upon external means; rather he uses a “natural,” “eidetic” approach. Judging only from external appearances, it seems that the older child has simply begun to memorize more and better; that she has somehow perfected and developed her old methods of memorizing. At the highest levels she appears to have abandoned any reliance upon signs. However, this appearance is only illusory. Development, as often happens, proceeds here not in a circle but in a spiral, passing through the same point at each new revolution while advancing to a higher level.

我们将外部操作的内部重建称为内化 。指向动作的发展就是这一过程的一个很好的例子。最初，这个手势只不过是一次不成功的抓握尝试，一个指向某个物体的动作，表示即将进行的活动。孩子试图抓住一个超出他触及范围的物体；他的手伸向那个物体，保持悬空。他的手指做出抓握动作。在这个初始阶段，指向动作由孩子的动作表示，这个动作似乎指向一个物体——仅此而已。

We call the internal reconstruction of an external operation internalization . A good example of this process may be found in the development of pointing. Initially, this gesture is nothing more than an unsuccessful attempt to grasp something, a movement aimed at a certain object which designates forthcoming activity. The child attempts to grasp an object placed beyond his reach; his hands, stretched toward that object, remain poised in the air. His fingers make grasping movements. At this initial stage pointing is represented by the child’s movement, which seems to be pointing to an object—that and nothing more.

当母亲来帮助孩子并意识到他的动作表示某种东西时，情况发生了根本性的变化。指向成为他人的一种手势。孩子不成功的尝试引起的反应不是来自他所寻找的物体，而是来自另一个人 。因此，那个不成功的抓握动作的主要意义是由其他人确定的。直到后来，当孩子能够将他不成功的抓握动作与整个客观情况联系起来时，他才开始将这个动作理解为指向。在这个时刻，那个动作的功能发生了变化：它从一个面向对象的动作变成了一个针对另一个人的动作，一种建立关系的手段。抓握动作变成了指向的动作 。由于这种变化，动作本身在物理上被简化，结果就是我们可以称之为真正手势的指向形式。只有在它客观地体现了指向他人的所有功能并被他人理解为这样的手势之后，它才成为真正的手势。它的意义和功能首先由客观环境创造，然后由孩子周围的人创造。

When the mother comes to the child’s aid and realizes his movement indicates something, the situation changes fundamentally. Pointing becomes a gesture for others. The child’s unsuccessful attempt engenders a reaction not from the object he seeks but from another person . Consequently, the primary meaning of that unsuccessful grasping movement is established by others. Only later, when the child can link his unsuccessful grasping movement to the objective situation as a whole, does he begin to understand this movement as pointing. At this juncture there occurs a change in that movement’s function: from an object-oriented movement it becomes a movement aimed at another person, a means of establishing relations. The grasping movement changes to the act of pointing . As a result of this change, the movement itself is then physically simplified, and what results is the form of pointing that we may call a true gesture. It becomes a true gesture only after it objectively manifests all the functions of pointing for others and is understood by others as such a gesture. Its meaning and functions are created at first by an objective situation and then by people who surround the child.

正如上面对指向的描述所示，内化过程由一系列的转变组成：

As the above description of pointing illustrates, the process of internalization consists of a series of transformations:

（a）最初代表外部活动的操作是 重建并开始在内部发生 。符号使用活动的转变对于高级心理过程的发展特别重要，其历史和特征可以通过实践智力、自愿注意力和记忆力的发展来说明。

(a) An operation that initially represents an external activity is reconstructed and begins to occur internally . Of particular importance to the development of higher mental processes is the transformation of sign-using activity, the history and characteristics of which are illustrated by the development of practical intelligence, voluntary attention, and memory.

(b)人际过程转变为个人内部过程 。儿童文化发展中的每一项功能都会出现两次：首先是在社会层面，然后是在个人层面；首先是在 人与人之间（心理间） ，然后在 儿童内部（心理内） 。这同样适用于自愿注意、逻辑记忆和概念的形成。所有更高级的功能都源于人类个体之间的实际关系。

(b) An interpersonal process is transformed into an intrapersonal one . Every function in the child’s cultural development appears twice: first, on the social level, and later, on the individual level; first, between people (interpsychological) , and then inside the child (intrapsychological) . This applies equally to voluntary attention, to logical memory, and to the formation of concepts. All the higher functions originate as actual relations between human individuals.

（c）人际过程向人际过程的转变是一系列长期发展事件的结果 。转变的过程在最终转向内部之前，会作为外部活动形式持续存在并改变很长一段时间。对于许多功能而言，外部符号阶段会永远持续下去，也就是说，这是它们发展的最后阶段。其他功能会进一步发展并逐渐成为内部功能。然而，它们只有在长期发展后才会具有内部过程的特征。它们的向内转移与其活动规律的变化有关；它们被纳入一个具有自身规律的新系统。

(c) The transformation of an interpersonal process into an intrapersonal one is the result of a long series of developmental events . The process being transformed continues to exist and to change as an external form of activity for a long time before definitively turning inward. For many functions, the stage of external signs lasts forever, that is, it is their final stage of development. Other functions develop further and gradually become inner functions. However, they take on the character of inner processes only as a result of a prolonged development. Their transfer inward is linked with changes in the laws governing their activity; they are incorporated into a new system with its own laws.

文化行为形式的内化涉及基于符号操作的心理活动重建。动物身上出现的心理过程实际上不复存在；它们被纳入这种行为系统，并在文化上重建和发展，形成一个新的心理实体。外部符号的使用也被彻底重建。符号操作的发展变化类似于语言中发生的变化。外部或交流性言语以及自我中心言语的各个方面都“向内”成为内部言语的基础。

The internalization of cultural forms of behavior involves the reconstruction of psychological activity on the basis of sign operations. Psychological processes as they appear in animals actually cease to exist; they are incorporated into this system of behavior and are culturally reconstituted and developed to form a new psychological entity. The use of external signs is also radically reconstructed. The developmental changes in sign operations are akin to those that occur in language. Aspects of external or communicative speech as well as egocentric speech turn “inward” to become the basis of inner speech.

人类心理学的显著特征是将根植于社会和历史的活动内化，这是从动物心理学到人类心理学质的飞跃的基础。迄今为止，人们还未了解这一过程的大致轮廓。

The internalization of socially rooted and historically developed activities is the distinguishing feature of human psychology, the basis of the qualitative leap from animal to human psychology. As yet, the barest outline of this process is known.

5

5

方法问题

Problems of Method

一般而言，任何解决科学问题的全新方法都必然会导致新的研究和分析方法。发明适合问题提出方式的新方法需要的不仅仅是对以前接受的方法进行简单的修改。当代心理学实验在这方面也不例外；它的方法始终反映了人们看待和解决基本心理学问题的方式。因此，我们对有关心理过程的本质和发展的当前观点的批评必然会导致对研究方法的重新审视。

In general, any fundamentally new approach to a scientific problem inevitably leads to new methods of investigation and analysis. The invention of new methods that are adequate to the new ways in which problems are posed requires far more than a simple modification of previously accepted methods. Contemporary psychological experimentation is no exception in this respect; its methods have always reflected the ways in which fundamental psychological problems were viewed and solved. Therefore, our criticism of current views concerning the essential nature and development of psychological processes must inevitably result in a reexamination of methods of research.

尽管程序细节千差万别，但几乎所有的心理实验都依赖于我们所谓的刺激-反应框架 。这意味着，无论讨论的是哪种心理过程，心理学家都会试图让受试者面对某种旨在以特定方式影响他的刺激情境，然后心理学家检查和分析这种刺激情境引起的反应。毕竟，实验的本质是以人工（从而可控）的方式唤起所研究的现象，并研究随着刺激的各种变化而发生的反应变化。

Despite great diversity in procedural details, virtually all psychological experiments rely on what we shall term a stimulus-response framework . By this we mean that no matter what psychological process is under discussion, the psychologist seeks to confront the subject with some kind of stimulus situation designed to influence him in a particular way, and then the psychologist examines and analyzes the response(s) elicited by that stimulating situation. After all, the very essence of experimentation is to evoke the phenomenon under study in an artificial (and thereby controllable) way and to study the variations in response that occur in conjunction with various changes in the stimulus.

表面上看，各种心理学流派似乎不可能就这一方法论达成一致。例如，沃森、贝赫特列夫等人的客观心理学就是针对冯特和维尔茨堡学派的主观理论而构建的。但仔细研究一下心理学流派之间的差异，就会发现这些差异源于理论解释 心理学家希望将结果归因于各种刺激环境，而不是观察所采用的一般方法论的变化。

On the surface it may appear that various schools of psychology could not possibly agree on this methodology. The objective psychology of Watson, Bekhterev, and others, for example, was constructed in opposition to the subjective theories of Wundt and the Würzburg school. But closer examination of the differences between schools of psychology reveals that those differences arise out of the theoretical interpretation psychologists want to assign to the consequences of various stimulating environments and not out of variations in the general methodological approach within which observations are made.

依赖刺激-反应框架是那些理论和实验都基于对行为的刺激-反应解释的心理学流派的明显特征。例如，巴甫洛夫理论利用各种刺激引起的皮层兴奋的概念来解释大脑中如何形成连接，从而使有机体能够学会对迄今为止的中性刺激作出反应。完全相同的框架也适用于内省心理学，这一点可能不太明显，因为框架和理论似乎并不一致。然而，以冯特为例，我们发现刺激-反应框架提供了一个背景，实验者-理论家可以在其中获得对刺激所引发过程的描述。

Reliance on a stimulus-response framework is an obvious feature of those schools of psychology whose theories as well as experiments are based on stimulus-response interpretations of behavior. Pavlovian theory, for example, has utilized the notion of cortical excitation incited by various stimuli to explain how connections are formed in the brain that enable the organism to learn to respond to hitherto neutral stimuli. It may be less obvious that exactly the same framework applies to introspective psychology as well, since the framework and the theory do not seem to coincide. However, taking Wundt as an example, we find that the stimulus-response framework provided the context within which the experimenter-theorist could obtain descriptions of the processes presumed to have been elicited by the stimulus.

19 世纪 80 年代，内省心理学采用了刺激-反应框架，这对心理学来说是革命性的一步，因为它使心理学更接近自然科学的方法和精神，并为随后的客观心理学方法铺平了道路。但是，声称内省心理学和客观心理学共享一个共同的方法论框架并不意味着它们之间没有重要的区别。我之所以强调它们共同的方法论框架，是因为承认这一点有助于我们认识到内省心理学植根于自然科学的坚实土壤，而人们长期以来一直在反应性背景下理解心理过程。

The adoption of a stimulus-response framework by introspective psychology in the 1880s was a revolutionary step forward for psychology because it brought psychology closer to the method and spirit of the natural sciences and prepared the way for the objective psychological approaches that followed. But to claim that both introspective and objective psychology share a common methodological framework does not in any way imply that there are no important differences between them. I am emphasizing their common methodological framework because its recognition helps us to appreciate the fact that introspective psychology was rooted in the firm soil of natural sciences and that psychological processes have long been understood within a reactive context.

还必须认识到，实验方法最早是由心理物理学和心理生理学领域的内省心理学家制定的，他们研究最简单的心理现象，这些现象可以合理地解释为与外部因素直接且唯一相关。例如，冯特认为心理方法的本质是对刺激进行系统性改变，从而引起与之相关的心理过程的变化。他寻求以最客观的方式记录这些内部过程的外部表现，他认为这就是受试者的内省报告。

It is also important to realize that the experimental method was first formulated by introspective psychologists in that area of psychophysics and psychophysiology that dealt with the simplest psychological phenomena, phenomena that could plausibly be interpreted as directly and uniquely linked to external agents. Wundt, for example, saw the very essence of psychological method as the systematic alteration of the stimuli that generate a change in the psychological process linked to them. He sought the maximally objective way to record the external manifestations of these internal processes, which is what he believed the subject’s introspective reports to be.

同时，重要的是要记住，对于冯特来说，刺激和反应的作用仅仅是建立一个框架，在这个框架内，可以以可靠和受控的方式研究重要的事件、心理过程。这些事件的内省报告 这些过程仍然是关于其性质的最重要证据——后来的研究人员并不认同这一解释。

At the same time, it is important to keep in mind that for Wundt the stimulus and response functioned only to set up the framework within which the important events, psychological processes, could be studied in a reliable and controlled way. Introspective reports of these processes remained the paramount evidence concerning their nature—an interpretation not shared by later investigators.

我们对冯特所进行的心理实验的基本框架的描述暗示了其应用的局限性：这种实验被认为仅适用于研究心理生理学特征的基本过程。高级心理功能不允许以这种形式进行研究，因此就实验心理学而言，它仍然是一本封闭的书。如果我们回想一下本书前面章节中回顾的儿童认知发展研究的各种实验，我们就很容易理解为什么以前的研究人员专注于基本心理功能；这种局限性是实验方法的内在特征，因为它在心理学中被普遍接受。冯特理解并接受了这一事实，这就是他避开 高级心理功能的实验研究的原因。

Our description of the basic framework of psychological experimentation as practiced by Wundt implies limitations on its application: such experimentation was considered adequate only to the study of elementary processes of a psychophysiological character. The higher psychological functions did not allow study in this form and thus remained a closed book as far as experimental psychology was concerned. If we recall the kinds of experimentation on the cognitive development of children that characterized the research reviewed in earlier chapters of this book, we can easily understand why previous investigators concentrated on elementary psychological functions; this limitation is a built-in feature of the experimental method as it was generally accepted in psychology. Wundt understood and accepted this fact, which is why he eschewed experimental studies of higher psychological functions.

从上述内容可以看出，用于构建实验观察的刺激-反应框架不能 作为充分研究高级行为形式（特别是人类行为形式）的基础。它最多只能帮助我们记录较低、从属形式的存在，而这些形式并不能捕捉高级形式的本质。使用当前的方法，我们只能确定刺激复杂性的定量变化以及不同动物和人类在不同发展阶段的反应。

From the foregoing it should be clear that a stimulus-response framework for constructing experimental observations cannot serve as the basis for the adequate study of the higher, specifically human forms of behavior. At best it can only help us to record the existence of the lower, subordinated forms, which do not capture the essence of the higher forms. Using current methods, we can only determine quantitative variation in the complexity of stimuli and in the responses of different animals and humans at different stages of development.

基于对人类历史的辩证唯物主义分析，我认为人类行为与动物行为在性质上存在差异，就如同人类的适应性和历史发展与动物的适应性和发展存在差异一样。人类的心理发展是我们物种总体历史发展的一部分，必须如此理解。接受这一命题意味着我们必须找到一种新的心理实验方法。

It is my belief, based upon a dialectical materialist approach to the analysis of human history, that human behavior differs qualitatively from animal behavior to the same extent that the adaptability and historical development of humans differ from the adaptability and development of animals. The psychological development of humans is part of the general historical development of our species and must be so understood. Acceptance of this proposition means that we must find a new methodology for psychological experimentation.

我们的方法论的基石，我将在下文中尝试分析性地描述，它直接源于恩格斯对理解人类历史的自然主义和辩证法方法的对比。根据恩格斯的观点，历史分析中的自然主义表现为这样的假设：只有自然界影响人类，只有自然条件决定历史发展。辩证法虽然承认自然对人的影响，但断言人反过来又影响自然，并通过改变自然为自己的存在创造新的自然条件。1这一 立场 是我们研究和解释人类高级心理功能的方法的基石，也是我们所提倡的新实验和分析方法的基础。

The keystone of our method, which I will try to describe analytically in the following sections, follows directly from the contrast Engels drew between naturalistic and dialectical approaches to the understanding of human history. Naturalism in historical analysis, according to Engels, manifests itself in the assumption that only nature affects human beings and only natural conditions determine historical development. The dialectical approach, while admitting the influence of nature on man, asserts that man, in turn, affects nature and creates through his changes in nature new natural conditions for his existence.1 This position is the keystone of our approach to the study and interpretation of man’s higher psychological functions and serves as the basis for the new methods of experimentation and analysis that we advocate.

所有刺激-反应方法都存在恩格斯认为自然主义历史方法所具有的不足。两者都认为人类行为与自然之间的关系是单向反应的。然而，我和我的同事们认为，人类行为会产生恩格斯认为工具具有的“对自然的转化反应”。因此，我们必须寻找适合我们概念的方法。除了新方法，我们还需要一个新的分析框架。

All stimulus-response methods share the inadequacy that Engels ascribes to naturalistic approaches to history. Both see the relation between human behavior and nature as unidirectionally reactive. My collaborators and I, however, believe that human behavior comes to have that “transforming reaction on nature” which Engels attributed to tools. We must, then, seek methods adequate to our conception. In conjunction with new methods, we also need a new analytic framework.

我强调过，我们研究的基本目标是对更高级的行为形式进行分析，但当代心理学的情况是，如果我们的方法要推广到超出所介绍的具体例子，就必须讨论分析本身的问题。

I have emphasized that a basic goal of our research is to provide an analysis of the higher forms of behavior, but the situation in contemporary psychology is such that the problem of analysis itself must be discussed if our approach is to be generalized beyond the specific examples presented.

三个原则构成了我们分析高级心理功能的方法的基础。

Three principles form the basis of our approach to the analysis of higher psychological functions.

分析过程，而不是对象。 第一个原则让我们区分对象的分析和过程的分析。正如科夫卡所说，心理分析几乎总是将其分析的过程视为稳定、固定的对象。分析的任务是将这些形式分解成它们的组成部分。对象的心理分析应该与过程分析形成对比，过程分析需要动态显示构成过程历史的主要点。因此，发展心理学，而不是实验心理学，提供了我们所需要的新分析方法。和沃纳一样，我们提倡发展方法作为实验心理学的重要补充。2任何 心理过程，无论是思想的发展还是自愿行为，都是一个在眼前发生变化的过程。所讨论的发展可能仅限于几秒钟，甚至是几分之一秒（就像正常感知的情况一样）。它也可以（就像复杂的心理过程一样）持续很多天甚至几周。在某些条件下，可以追踪这种发展。沃纳的研究提供了一个将发展观点应用于实验研究的范例。利用这种方法，人们可以在实验室条件下激发发展。

Analyzing process, not objects. The first principle leads us to distinguish between the analysis of an object and of a process. As Koffka put it, psychological analysis has almost always treated the processes it analyzes as stable, fixed objects. The task of analysis consisted in breaking these forms down into their components. Psychological analysis of objects should be contrasted with the analysis of processes, which requires a dynamic display of the main points making up the processes’ history. Consequently, developmental psychology, not experimental psychology, provides the new approach to analysis that we need. Like Werner, we are advocating the developmental approach as an essential addition to experimental psychology.2 Any psychological process, whether the development of thought or voluntary behavior, is a process undergoing changes right before one’s eyes. The development in question can be limited to only a few seconds, or even fractions of seconds (as is the case in normal perception). It can also (as in the case of complex mental processes) last many days and even weeks. Under certain conditions it becomes possible to trace this development. Werner’s work furnishes one example of how a developmental viewpoint may be applied to experimental research. Using such an approach, one can, under laboratory conditions, provoke development.

我们的方法可以称为实验发展方法，因为它人工地激发或创造了一个心理发展过程。这种方法同样适用于 动态分析。如果我们用过程分析代替对象分析，那么研究的基本任务显然就变成了对过程发展各个阶段的重构：必须将过程倒退回到它的初始阶段。

Our method may be called experimental-developmental in the sense that it artificially provokes or creates a process of psychological development. This approach is equally appropriate to the basic aim of dynamic analysis. If we replace object analysis by process analysis, then the basic task of research obviously becomes a reconstruction of each stage in the development of the process: the process must be turned back to its initial stages.

解释与描述。 在联想心理学和内省心理学中，分析本质上是描述，而不是我们所理解的解释。单纯的描述并不能揭示现象背后的实际因果动态关系。

Explanation versus description. In associationistic and introspective psychology, analysis is essentially description and not explanation as we understand it. Mere description does not reveal the actual causal-dynamic relations that underlie phenomena.

K. Lewin 将基于外部特征（表现型）的现象学分析与他所谓的基因型分析进行了对比，在基因型分析中，现象的解释是基于其起源而不是其外观。3任何 生物学例子都可以阐明这两种观点之间的差异。从外观的角度来看，鲸鱼更接近鱼类而不是哺乳动物，但就其生物学性质而言，它更接近牛或鹿而不是梭子鱼或鲨鱼。按照 Lewin 的说法，我们可以将表现型（描述性）和基因型（解释性）观点之间的这种区别应用于心理学。我所说的问题的发展研究是指揭示其起源，即其因果动态基础。我所说的表现型是指直接从对象的当前特征和表现开始的分析。心理学中有很多例子，由于混淆了这些观点，人们犯了严重的错误。在我们对语言发展的研究中，我们强调了区分表型和基因型相似性的重要性。

K. Lewin contrasts phenomenological analysis, which is based on external features (phenotypes), with what he calls genotypic analysis, wherein a phenomenon is explained on the basis of its origin rather than its outer appearance.3 The difference between these two points of view can be elucidated by any biological example. A whale, from the point of view of its outer appearance, stands closer to the fish family than to the mammal, but in its biological nature it is closer to a cow or a deer than to a pike or a shark. Following Lewin, we can apply this distinction between the phenotypic (descriptive) and genotypic (explanatory) viewpoints to psychology. By a developmental study of a problem, I mean the disclosure of its genesis, its causal dynamic basis. By phenotypic I mean the analysis that begins directly with an object’s current features and manifestations. It is possible to furnish many examples from psychology where serious errors have been committed because these viewpoints have been confused. In our study of the development of speech, we have emphasized the importance of the distinction between phenotypic and genotypic similarities.

就其外部描述性方面而言，一岁半至两岁儿童的言语首次表现与成人言语相似。基于这种相似性，像斯特恩这样的严肃研究者得出结论，从本质上讲，十八个月大的儿童已经意识到符号与意义之间的关系。4换句话说 ，他把从发展角度来看毫无共同之处的现象归为一类。另一方面，从发展角度来看，自我中心言语——其外部表现与内部言语有着本质区别——必须与内部言语归为一类。

In their external, descriptive aspects, the first manifestation of speech in the one-and-a-half to two-year-old child are similar to adult speech. On the basis of this similarity, such serious researchers as Stern come to the conclusion that in essence the eighteen-month-old child is already conscious of the relation between sign and meaning.4 In other words, he classes together phenomena that have absolutely nothing in common from the developmental point of view. On the other hand, egocentric speech—which in its outer manifestations differs from internal speech in essential ways—must be classed together with internal speech from the developmental point of view.

我们对幼儿言语的研究使我们得出了 Lewin 提出的基本原则：两个在表现型上相同或相似的过程在其因果动态方面可能截然不同，反之亦然；两个在因果动态性质上非常接近的过程在表现型上可能非常不同。

Our research on young children’s speech brings us to the basic principle formulated by Lewin: two phenotypically identical or similar processes may be radically different from each other in their causal-dynamic aspects and vice versa; two processes that are very close in their causal-dynamic nature may be very different phenotypically.

我曾说过，表现型方法根据过程的外部相似性对其进行分类。马克思对表现型方法进行了最普遍的评论，他说：“如果事物的本质与其外部表现形式相一致，那么任何科学都是多余的。”这是一个非常合理的观察。5如果 每个事物在表现型和基因型上都是等同的（即，如果其构造和运行的真正原理由其外部表现来表达），那么日常经验就足以取代科学分析。我们看到的一切都将成为我们科学知识的主题。

I have said that the phenotypic approach categorizes processes according to their external similarities. Marx commented on the phenotypic approach in a most general form when he stated that “if the essence of objects coincided with the form of their outer manifestations, then every science would be superfluous”—an extremely reasonable observation.5 If every object was phenotypically and genotypically equivalent (that is, if the true principles of its construction and operation were expressed by its outer manifestation), then everyday experience would fully suffice to replace scientific analysis. Everything we saw would be the subject of our scientific knowledge.

事实上，心理学在每一个步骤中都告诉我们，尽管两种类型的活动可以具有相同的外部表现，无论是起源还是本质，但它们的性质可能存在着巨大的差异。在这种情况下，需要特殊的科学分析手段来揭示被外部相似性所隐藏的内部差异。分析的任务就是揭示这些关系。从这个意义上讲，真正的科学分析与主观的、内省的分析截然不同，后者本质上不可能超越纯粹的描述。我们提倡的客观分析力求揭示心理现象的本质，而不是感知到的特征。

In reality, psychology teaches us at every step that though two types of activity can have the same external manifestation, whether in origin or essence, their nature may differ most profoundly. In such cases special means of scientific analysis are necessary in order to lay bare internal differences that are hidden by external similarities. It is the task of analysis to reveal these relations. In that sense, real scientific analysis differs radically from subjective, introspective analysis, which by its very nature cannot hope to go beyond pure description. The kind of objective analysis we advocate seeks to lay bare the essence rather than the perceived characteristics of psychological phenomena.

例如，我们对内省分析向我们揭示的闪光所引发的直接体验的描述不感兴趣；相反，我们试图了解外部刺激和内部反应之间的真正联系，这些联系是内省描述所命名的更高级行为形式的基础。因此，我们意义上的心理分析拒绝名义描述，而是寻求确定因果动态关系。然而，如果我们忽略事物的外在表现，这种解释也是不可能的。客观分析必然包括对外在表现和研究过程的科学解释。分析不仅限于发展视角。它并不否定对当前表型特质的解释，而是使它们服从于对其实际起源的发现。

For example, we are not interested in a description of the immediate experience elicited by a flashing light as it is revealed to us by introspective analysis; rather we seek to understand the real links between the external stimuli and internal responses that underlie the higher form of behavior named by introspective descriptions. Thus, psychological analysis in our sense rejects nominal descriptions and seeks instead to determine causal-dynamic relations. However, such explanation would also be impossible if we ignored the external manifestations of things. By necessity, objective analysis includes a scientific explanation of both external manifestations and the process under study. Analysis is not limited to a developmental perspective. It does not repudiate the explanation of current phenotypical idiosyncrasies, but rather subordinates them to the discovery of their actual origin.

“行为僵化”问题。 我们分析方法的第三个原则基于这样一个事实：在心理学中，我们经常遇到已经消亡的过程，即经历了很长的历史发展阶段并已僵化的过程。这些僵化的行为形式最容易在所谓的自动化或机械化的心理过程中找到，这些心理过程由于其古老的起源而现在正在重复 无数次重复，变得机械化。它们失去了原有的面貌，而它们的外表根本无法告诉我们它们内在的本质。它们的自动性给心理分析带来了巨大的困难。

The problem of “fossilized behavior.” The third principle underlying our analytic approach is based on the fact that in psychology we often meet with processes that have already died away, that is, processes that have gone through a very long stage of historical development and have become fossilized. These fossilized forms of behavior are most easily found in the so-called automated or mechanized psychological processes which, owing to their ancient origins, are now being repeated for the millionth time and have become mechanized. They have lost their original appearance, and their outer appearance tells us nothing whatsoever about their internal nature. Their automatic character creates great difficulties for psychological analysis.

传统上被称为自愿和非自愿注意的过程提供了一个基本的例子，它表明本质上不同的过程如何由于这种自动化而获得外在的相似性。从发展上讲，这两个过程有很大的不同。但在实验心理学中，铁钦纳认为，自愿注意一旦建立，其功能就与非自愿注意一样。6 用铁 钦纳的话来说，“次级”注意力不断转变为“初级”注意力。在描述和对比了这两种注意力之后，铁钦纳说：“然而，注意力的发展存在第三个阶段，它无非就是回到第一阶段。”任何过程发展的最后和最高阶段可能表现出与第一阶段或初级阶段纯粹表型的相似性，如果我们采用表型方法，就不可能区分这个过程的高级和低级形式。研究注意力发展的第三和最高阶段的唯一方法是了解它的所有特性和差异。简而言之，我们需要了解它的起源。因此，我们需要关注的不是 发展的结果，而是高级形式建立的过程本身 。为此，研究人员常常被迫改变高级行为形式的自动、机械化、僵化的特征，并通过实验将其转变回其源头。这就是动态分析的目的。

The processes that have traditionally been referred to as voluntary and involuntary attention provide an elementary example that demonstrates how essentially different processes acquire outer similarity as a result of this automation. Developmentally speaking, these two processes differ very profoundly. But in experimental psychology it is considered a fact, as formulated by Titchener, that voluntary attention, once established, functions just like involuntary attention.6 In Titchener’s terms, “secondary” attention constantly changes into “primary” attention. Having described and contrasted the two types of attention, Titchener then says, “There exists, however, a third stage in the development of attention, and it consists in nothing less than a return to the first stage.” The last and highest stage in the development of any process may demonstrate a purely phenotypic similarity with the first or primary stages, and if we take a phenotypic approach, it is impossible to distinguish between higher and lower forms of this process. The only way to study this third and highest stage in the development of attention is to understand it in all its idiosyncrasies and differences. In short, we need to understand its origin. It follows, then, that we need to concentrate not on the product of development but on the very process by which higher forms are established. To do so the researcher is often forced to alter the automatic, mechanized, fossilized character of the higher form of behavior and to turn it back to its source through the experiment. This is the aim of dynamic analysis.

不活跃的、基本功能不是生物进化的活体残留，而是行为历史发展的残留。因此，基本功能研究必须是心理实验中发展历史视角的出发点。正是在这里，过去和现在融合在一起，现在被置于历史的光芒之下。在这里，我们同时处于两个层面：现在和过去。化石形式是将现在与过去、发展高级阶段与初级阶段联系起来的线索的末端。

Inactive, rudimentary functions stand not as the living remnants of biological evolution but as those of the historical development of behavior. Consequently, the study of rudimentary functions must be the point of departure for evolving a historical perspective in psychological experiments. It is here that the past and the present are fused and the present is seen in the light of history. Here we find ourselves simultaneously on two planes: that which is and that which was. The fossilized form is the end of the thread that ties the present to the past, the higher stages of development to the primary ones.

大多数研究儿童发展的研究人员都误解了历史心理学的概念。对他们来说，从历史上研究某件事，顾名思义，就是研究过去的事件。因此，他们天真地想象了历史研究和当今行为形式的研究之间存在着不可逾越的障碍。 历史地研究事物的变化过程， 这是辩证法的基本要求。研究事物从生到死的各个阶段和变化过程，从根本上说，就是要发现事物的性质、本质，因为“只有在运动中，物体才能显示其本质”。因此，行为的历史研究不是理论研究的辅助方面，而是理论研究的基础。正如 P.P.布朗斯基所说：“行为只能被理解为行为​​的历史。” 7

The concept of a historically based psychology is misunderstood by most researchers who study child development. For them, to study something historically means, by definition, to study some past event. Hence, they naively imagine an insurmountable barrier between historic study and study of present-day behavioral forms. To study something historically means to study it in the process of change; that is the dialectical method’s basic demand. To encompass in research the process of a given thing’s development in all its phases and changes—from birth to death—fundamentally means to discover its nature, its essence, for “it is only in movement that a body shows what it is.” Thus, the historical study of behavior is not an auxiliary aspect of theoretical study, but rather forms its very base. As P. P. Blonsky has stated, “Behavior can be understood only as the history of behavior.”7

寻找方法成为理解人类独特心理活动形式的整个事业中最重要的问题之一。在这种情况下，方法既是研究的前提，又是研究的成果，既是研究的工具，也是研究的结果 。

The search for method becomes one of the most important problems of the entire enterprise of understanding the uniquely human forms of psychological activity. In this case, the method is simultaneously prerequisite and product, the tool and the result of the study .

总之，心理分析的目的和基本要素如下：（1）过程分析，而不是对象分析；（2）揭示真实、因果或动态关系的分析，而不是列举过程的外部特征，即解释性分析，而不是描述性分析；（3）发展分析，回到源头并重建给定结构发展中的所有点。发展的结果既不是描述心理学认为的纯粹心理结构，也不是联想心理学认为的基本过程的简单总和，而是在发展过程中出现的质的新形式。

In summary, then, the aim of psychological analysis and its essential factors are as follows: (1) process analysis as opposed to object analysis; (2) analysis that reveals real, causal or dynamic relations as opposed to enumeration of a process’s outer features, that is, explanatory, not descriptive, analysis; and (3) developmental analysis that returns to the source and reconstructs all the points in the development of a given structure. The result of development will be neither a purely psychological structure such as descriptive psychology considers the result to be, nor a simple sum of elementary processes such as associationistic psychology saw it, but a qualitatively new form that appears in the process of development.

复杂选择反应的心理学

THE PSYCHOLOGY OF COMPLEX CHOICE RESPONSES

为了说明心理分析的两种截然不同的方法，我将详细讨论对同一任务的两种不同分析。在我选择的任务中，受试者会得到一个或多个刺激（通常是视觉或听觉刺激）。所需的反应因刺激的数量和研究者的兴趣而异：一些方法试图将反应分解为一系列基本过程，这些过程的持续时间可以相加或相减，以确定它们的组合规律；其他方法则试图描述受试者对刺激作出反应时的情绪反应。无论哪种情况，受试者对其反应的内省分析都被用作基本数据。在这些实验中，先前公式的不足之处为我们的基本分析原理提供了有用的例证。8

In order to illustrate the contrasting approaches to psychological analysis, I will discuss in some detail two different analyses of one task. In the task I have chosen, the subject is presented one or more stimuli (visually or auditorily as a rule). The required response differs according to the number of stimuli and the interests of the investigator: some approaches seek to break the reaction down into a series of elementary processes whose durations can be added and subtracted to establish the laws of their combination; others seek to describe the emotional reaction of the subject as he responds to the stimulus. In either case, the subjects’ introspective analyses of their responses are used as basic data. In these experiments the inadequacies of prior formulations provide useful illustrations of our basic analytic principles.8

这些分析的另一个特点是，复杂反应和简单反应主要通过刺激的定量复杂性来区分：简单反应发生在单一刺激 呈现的刺激越多，反应的复杂性就越高。这种思路的一个基本假设是，任务的复杂性与受试者内部反应的复杂性相同。

It is also characteristic of these analyses that complex and simple responses are distinguished primarily by the quantitative complexity of the stimuli: a simple reaction is said to occur when a single stimulus is presented, and the complexity of the response is said to increase with an increasing number of stimuli. An essential presumption in this line of thinking is that the complexity of the task is identical to the complexity of the subject’s internal response.

这种恒等式在分析此类任务的反应时常用的代数公式中得到了清晰的表达。如果我们呈现单一刺激，我们可以写出一个方程，其中复杂反应等同于简单反应（感觉识别）：R t = R s ，其中 R t 是整个复杂反应的反应时间，R s 是单一识别反应的反应时间。如果我们呈现两个或多个刺激，受试者必须从中选择一个，则该方程变为：R t = R s + D，其中 D 是区分目标刺激和其余刺激所需的时间。使用这两个方程，我们可以确定简单反应和区分反应所需的时间。如果我们通过要求受试者对每个刺激选择不同的反应来使任务复杂化（例如，按下左边的键来表示刺激 A，按下右边的键来表示刺激 B），我们会得到经典的选择反应公式：R t = R s + D + C，其中 C 是选择正确动作所需的时间，例如，按下与呈现的刺激相对应的键。

This identity is clearly expressed in the algebraic formulas commonly used in the analysis of responses to such tasks. If we present a single stimulus, we can write an equation in which the complex reaction is equivalent to a simple reaction (sensory recognition): Rt = Rs where Rt is the response time for the total, complex reaction and Rs is the response time for a single recognition reaction. If we present two or more stimuli, from which the subject must select one, this equation becomes: Rt = Rs + D, where D is the time taken to discriminate between the target stimulus and the remainder. Using these two equations, we could establish the time required both for a simple reaction and for the discriminative reaction. If we complicate the task by requiring the subject to choose a different response for each stimulus (for example, press the left-hand key for stimulus A and the right-hand key for stimulus B), we obtain the classical choice reaction formula: Rt = Rs + D + C, where C is the time required to choose the correct movement, for example, to press the key corresponding to the stimulus presented.

这组公式背后的理论可以用以下的文字描述来描述：辨别反应是简单反应加辨别；选择反应是简单反应加辨别加选择。更高级、更复杂的反应被视为其基本成分的算术总和。

A verbal description of the theory underlying this set of formulas would be the following: the discrimination response is a simple reaction plus discrimination; the choice reaction is a simple reaction plus discrimination plus choice. The higher, more complex response is seen as the arithmetic sum of its elementary components.

这种分析方法的支持者将其应用得相当广泛。例如，卡特尔认为，通过从理解、将一个单词翻译成另一种语言并命名所需的时间中减去理解和命名一个单词所需的时间，我们可以获得翻译过程的纯粹测量值。9简而言之 ，甚至更高级的过程，例如语音理解和生成，都可以用这些方法进行分析。很难想象对复杂、更高级的行为形式有更机械的概念。

Proponents of this analytic approach apply it quite widely. Thus, for example, Cattell believes that by subtracting the time needed to comprehend and name a word from the time needed to comprehend, translate a word into another language, and name it, we can obtain a pure measure of the translation process.9 In short, even higher processes such as speech comprehension and production can be analyzed by these methods. A more mechanical notion of the complex, higher forms of behavior would be hard to imagine.

然而，这种分析方法已被证明会导致各种困难。与这一理论相矛盾的最基本、最实证的观察来自铁钦纳，他指出，执行精心准备的选择反应的时间可能等于简单的感官反应的反应时间。根据上面给出的方程式中总结的分析逻辑，这种情况是不可能的。

However, this analytic approach has been shown to lead to a variety of difficulties. The most basic, empirical observation that contradicts this theory comes from Titchener, who pointed out that the time to execute a carefully prepared choice reaction may be equal to the reaction time for a simple, sensory response. By the logic of the analysis summarized in the equations given above, this state of affairs is impossible.

我们认为，这整个分析思路的基本前提是错误的。复杂反应由一系列反应组成，这是不正确的。 独立过程可以任意添加或删除。任何此类反应都反映了依赖于实践各个层面的整个学习过程的过程。这种机械分析用刺激之间存在的关系取代了选择过程背后的真实关系。这种替代反映了心理学中的一种普遍的理智主义，它试图在构成实验本身的操作中理解心理过程；实验程序成为心理过程的替代品。

In our view, the basic premise underlying this entire line of analysis is incorrect. It is not true that a complex reaction consists of a chain of separate processes which may be arbitrarily added and subtracted. Any such reaction reflects processes that depend upon the entire process of learning at every level of practice. This mechanical analysis substitutes relations existing between stimuli for the real relations underlying the process of choosing. This kind of substitution reflects a general intellectualism in psychology which seeks to understand psychological processes in the manipulations that make up the experiment itself; experimental procedures become surrogates for psychological processes.

虽然许多学者已经证明了基于将反应机械分解为元素的心理分析的不足，但这些批评者面临的问题是，他们对复杂反应的内省分析必须局限于描述：外部反应的描述被内部感受的描述所取代。无论哪种情况，我们都局限于表型心理分析。

While various scholars have demonstrated the inadequacy of psychological analysis based upon a mechanical decomposition of responses into their elements, these critics face the problem that their introspective analyses of complex reactions must be restricted to description: the description of external responses is replaced by the description of internal feelings. In either case, we are restricted to phenotypical psychological analysis.

内省分析要求训练有素的观察者注意自己意识体验的各个方面，但这种分析并不能使我们走得更远。正如阿奇在讨论选择反应研究时所说，这项工作的一个奇怪结果是，人们发现在选择反应中没有有意识的选择感觉。10铁钦纳 强调，人们必须记住这样一个事实：复杂或简单反应的名称（例如“分化”或“选择”）指的是任务的外部条件。我们在分化反应中不进行分化，在选择反应中也不进行选择。

Introspective analysis in which highly trained observers are instructed to note every aspect of their own conscious experience cannot carry us very far. A curious result of this work, as Ach put it in discussing choice reaction studies, has been the discovery that there are no conscious feelings of choice in the choice reaction.10 Titchener emphasized that one must keep in mind the fact that the names given to a complex or simple reaction (for example, “differentiation” or “choice") refer to the external conditions of the task. We do not differentiate in the differentiation reaction and we do not choose in the choice reaction.

这种分析打破了实验程序和心理过程之间的同一性。诸如“选择”和“区分”之类的过程名称被视为心理学上一个时代的遗留物，当时实验尚不为人所知：为了规避这个问题，内省观察者被训练明确区分过程名称和他们的意识体验。

This kind of analysis broke the identity between experimental procedures and psychological processes. Process names like “choosing” and “differentiating” were treated as leftovers from a previous era of psychology when experimentation was still unknown: introspective observers were trained to make a clear distinction between process names and their conscious experience in order to circumvent this problem.

这些内省研究得出的结论是，似乎需要选择过程的情况没有理由谈论心理选择反应；对这种反应的讨论被实验过程中受试者的感受的描述所取代。但没有人能提供证据证明这些感受是特定反应过程不可分割的一部分。它们似乎只是其中的一个组成部分，本身需要解释；我们得出结论，内省往往无法提供准确的描述，更不用说正确的解释，即使是反应的主观方面。出于同样的原因，不同观察者的内省描述之间经常存在差异 困扰这一研究领域的问题是可以预料的。应该清楚的是，内省分析不能为过程提供真正的因果或动态解释；要做到这一点，我们必须放弃对表型的依赖，转向发展的观点。

These introspective studies resulted in the conclusion that a situation which seems to require choice processes furnishes no grounds for speaking of a psychological choice response; talk of such responses was replaced by a description of the subjects’ feelings during the experiment. But no one could provide evidence that these feelings were an integral part of the particular response process. It seems more likely that they are only one of its components, and require explanation themselves; we are led to conclude that introspection is often unable to provide an accurate description, let alone a correct explanation, for even the subjective aspect of the response. For the same reasons, the frequent discrepancies among the introspective descriptions of various observers which plague this area of research might be expected. It should be clear that introspective analysis cannot provide a real causal or dynamic explanation of a process; for that to occur, we must give up reliance on phenotypic appearances and move to a developmental viewpoint.

对复杂反应的研究也表明，心理学只依赖于对僵化过程的分析。这一点是 Titchener 指出的，他指出研究人员专注于他们研究的反应的反应时间，而不是学习过程或反应本身的内容。在标准实践中，当反应正在建立时，丢弃早期会话的数据，这一点也清楚地表明了同样的结论。人们追求统一性，因此永远不可能掌握动态过程；相反，研究人员经常丢弃反应出现的关键时间以及建立和调整其功能链接的时间。这种做法导致我们将反应描述为“僵化”。它们反映了这些心理学家对复杂反应作为一种发展过程不感兴趣的事实。这种方法也是导致对具有表面相似性的复杂反应和简单反应产生混淆的主要原因。可以说，复杂反应是在死后研究的。

Research on complex reactions also illustrates psychology’s reliance on the analysis of processes only after they have become fossilized. This point was noted by Titchener, who remarked that researchers have concentrated on the reaction time of the responses they study, not on the learning processes or the content of the reaction itself. This same conclusion is seen clearly in the standard practice of discarding the data from early sessions when the response is being established. Uniformity was sought, so that it was never possible to grasp the process in flight; instead, researchers routinely discarded the critical time when a reaction appears and when its functional links are established and adjusted. Such practices lead us to characterize the responses as “fossilized.” They reflect the fact that these psychologists were not interested in complex reactions as a process of development. This approach is also a major cause of the confusions which arose concerning complex and simple reactions that have surface similarities. It might be said that complex reactions have been studied postmortem.

可以通过比较复杂反应和反射来获得对这个问题的另一种看法，从心理学角度看，复杂反应和反射在许多方面是不同的。为了说明这一点，一个比较点就足够了。众所周知，复杂反应的潜伏期比反射的潜伏期长。但是，冯特很久以前就确定，复杂反应的潜伏期会随着练习而减少。结果，复杂反应和简单反射的潜伏期变得相等。复杂反应和反射之间最重要的区别通常在反应处于早期阶段时最为明显；随着练习的进行，区别变得越来越模糊。因此，应该在分析这两种行为的发展时寻找它们之间的区别。但是，对经过良好练习的选择反应和反射的研究并没有增加它们之间可辨别的差异，反而掩盖了这些差异。标准实验方法所要求的准备试验通常持续数个长时间。当这些数据被丢弃或忽略时，研究人员得到的是自动化反应，这种反应已经失去了与反射的发展差异，并获得了表面的、表型的相似性。这些因素导致我们断言，以前的研究人员只是在反应僵化之后才在心理实验中研究它们。

Another perspective on this issue can be gained from comparing complex reactions with reflexes, which are psychologically different in many respects. One point of comparison will suffice for purposes of illustration. It is well known that the latent period for a complex reaction is longer than the latent period for a reflex. But Wundt long ago established that the latent period of a complex reaction decreases with practice. As a result, the latency of the complex reaction and the simple reflex become equivalent. The most important differences between a complex reaction and a reflex are usually most apparent when the reaction is in its early stages; as practice proceeds, the differences become more and more obscured. Therefore, the differences between these two forms of behavior should be sought in the analysis of their development. But instead of increasing the discernible differences between them, investigations of well-practiced choice reactions and reflexes hide these differences. The preparatory trials demanded by standard experimental methods often last for several long sessions. When these data are then discarded or ignored, the researcher is left with an automatized reaction that has lost its developmental difference from a reflex and has acquired a surface, phenotypical similarity to it. These factors have led to our assertion that previous researchers have studied reactions in psychological experiments only after they have become fossilized.

对传统复杂反应分析的讨论，虽然是负面的，但定义了我们面临的基本任务。为了获得我们一直倡导的因果动态分析，我们必须转移研究重点。

This discussion of traditional analyses of complex reaction defines, albeit negatively, the basic tasks confronting us. In order to obtain the kind of causal-dynamic analysis we have been advocating, we will have to shift the focus of our research.

选择反应的因果动态研究

A CAUSAL-DYNAMIC STUDY OF CHOICE REACTIONS

显然，反应形成的早期阶段至关重要，因为只有这一时期的数据才能揭示反应的真正起源及其与其他过程的联系。通过客观研究反应的整个历史，我们可以对其内部和表面表现进行综合解释。因此，我们希望研究反应的最初出现、形成和牢固形成后的情况，并始终牢记其整个发展过程的动态流动。

Obviously, the early sessions during which a reaction is formed are of crucial concern because only data from this period will reveal the reaction’s true origin and its links to other processes. Through an objective study of the entire history of the reaction, we can obtain an integrated explanation of both its internal and surface manifestations. Thus, we will want to study the reaction as it appears initially, as it takes shape, and after it is firmly formed, constantly keeping in mind the dynamic flow of the entire process of its development.

从我之前的讨论中，任务的另一部分是明确的：复杂反应必须作为一个生命过程来研究，而不是作为一个对象。如果我们以自动化形式遇到反应，我们必须将反应转换回其来源。

From my previous discussion, another part of the task is clear: the complex reaction must be studied as a living process, not as an object. We must transform the reaction back to its source if we encounter it in automatized form.

当我们研究复杂反应中使用的实验程序时，我们发现所有程序都局限于刺激和反应之间毫无意义的联系。实验对象被呈现几种刺激，他必须以不同的方式做出反应：从实验对象的角度来看，刺激和所需反应之间的关系以及刺激呈现的顺序都没有任何意义。当需要运动反应（例如按键）时，实验对象可以以任何他们喜欢的方式进行运动。这些惯例使问题元素之间的关系在原则上变得机械化，并将程序与使用无意义刺激的记忆研究放在同一平面上。

When we examine the experimental procedures used in complex reactions, we find that all are restricted to meaningless connections between stimuli and responses. The subject is presented several stimuli to which he must respond in different ways: neither the relations between the stimuli and the required responses nor the sequence in which the stimuli are presented have any significance from the subject’s point of view. When a motor response, such as a key press, is required, subjects may make the movement in any way they like. These conventions render the relations among the elements of the problem mechanical in principle and place the procedures on a plane with the research on memory that uses nonsense stimuli.

选择反应和记忆研究之间的这种相似性可以通过考虑重复在这两个任务中的作用的相似性来扩展。虽然没有人对选择反应研究中的练习试验进行过深入研究，但可以肯定地得出结论，如果反应是通过重复训练（或训练加上书面或口头指导）形成的，那么它就是死记硬背的，就像学习两个无意义音节之间的联系是一个死记硬背的过程一样。如果涉及简单的反应，并且事先对受试者进行了广泛的解释，以便刺激和反应之间的关系有意义（例如，当我说“一”时按下键 1，当我说“二”时按下键 2），我们将处理已经存在的链接。在 在这两种情况下，我们都无法研究组织反应的过程，而在此过程中，我们无法发现其潜在的联系。

This analogy between choice reaction and memory studies can be extended by considering the similarity of the role of repetition in the two tasks. Although no one has dwelt on a study of the practice trials in choice reaction studies, it is safe to conclude that if the reaction is formed through repeated training (or training plus written or oral instruction), it has been learned by rote, just as learning the connection between two nonsense syllables is a rote process. If simple reactions were involved and the subject was given extensive explanation ahead of time so that the relation between stimulus and response were meaningful (for example, push key number 1 when I say “one,” push key number 2 when I say “two”), we would be dealing with already existing links. In neither case could we study the process of organizing the reaction, during which its underlying links would be discoverable.

为了清楚地说明这一切，让我们追踪选择反应所经历的阶段，首先是针对成人的实验，然后是针对儿童的实验。

To make all of this clear, let us trace the stages through which the choice reaction moves, first in experiments with adults and then with children.

如果我们设置一个相对简单的选择反应，比如，当显示红色刺激时用左手按下按钮，当显示绿色刺激时用右手按下按钮，成年人很快就会获得稳定的反应。然而，假设我们将刺激和反应的数量增加到五到六个，并使反应多样化，这样受试者不仅要用双手做出反应，有时还要按下按钮，有时只需移动手指。有了这么多的刺激-反应配对，任务就会变得更加困难。进一步假设，我们不是让受试者在漫长的训练前学习刺激-反应关系，而是只给出最少的指示。面对这种情况，成年人往往拒绝尝试解决这个问题，因为他们不记得该怎么做。即使在课程开始后，他们仍会不断对自己重复这些指示，询问他们忘记的任务方面，并且通常试图掌握整个关系系统，然后他们才能按照通常的设想安定下来完成任务。

If we set up a relatively simple choice reaction, say, pressing a button with the left hand when a red stimulus is shown and pressing with the right hand when a green stimulus is shown, adults quickly acquire a stable response. Suppose, however, we increase the number of stimuli and responses to five or six and diversify the responses so that the subject has to respond not only with both hands, but sometimes pressing a button and sometimes simply by moving a finger. With this larger number of stimulus-response pairings, the task is considerably more difficult. Suppose further that instead of a lengthy pretraining period in which the subject is allowed to learn the stimulus-response relations, we give only minimal instructions. Faced with this situation, adults often refused even to attempt to deal with the problem, objecting that they could not remember what to do. Even after the session started, they kept repeating the instructions to themselves, asked about aspects of the task they had forgotten, and generally sought to master the entire system of relations as a whole before they settled down to the task as it is usually conceived.

然而，如果我们以类似于前面描述的记忆研究中的程序的方式在响应按钮和按键上放置额外的刺激，成年人会立即使用这些辅助手段来记住必要的刺激-反应关系。

However, if we placed additional stimuli on the response buttons and keys in a manner analogous to the procedures in previously described memory studies, the adults immediately used these auxiliary means to remember the necessary stimulus-response relations.

在幼儿中，情况则有所不同。我们首先像对待成年人一样提出问题，要求孩子对不同的刺激做出许多不同的反应。与成年人不同，6 至 8 岁的儿童通常在听完指示后立即开始执行任务，并毫不犹豫地尝试遵循指示。实验一开始，大多数儿童就发现自己遇到了很大困难。如果一个孩子回忆起一两个所需的关系并对这些刺激做出正确的反应，他会天真地询问其余的刺激，将它们彼此孤立地对待。这种行为与成年人的行为形成鲜明对比，成年人通常无法有效地处理单个刺激，直到掌握所有必要的关系。我们认为儿童的这种行为表明他们正处于以自然或原始方式响应任务的阶段，因为他们依靠非中介记忆来处理任务元素。事实上，儿童会毫不犹豫地 接受建立对多达十种刺激的复杂选择反应的挑战表明他们还不知道自己的能力和局限性。他们处理复杂任务的方式与处理简单任务的方式相同。

Among young children, a different picture emerged. We first presented the problem as we did with adults, by asking the child to make a number of different responses to different stimuli. Unlike the adults, children six to eight years of age often started right into the task after listening to the instructions and attempted to follow them without the slightest hesitation. As soon as the experiment began, most children found themselves in great difficulty. If a child recalled one or two of the required relations and responded correctly to those stimuli, he would naively ask about the remaining stimuli, treating each of them in isolation from each other. This behavior contrasted with that of the adults who generally failed to deal effectively with the individual stimuli until all the necessary relations were mastered. We view this behavior on the part of the children as evidence that they are in the stage of responding to the task in a natural or primitive manner because they rely on unmediated memory for the task elements. The fact that children would unhesitatingly accept the challenge of establishing a complex choice response to as many as ten stimuli suggests that they do not yet know their own capacities and limitations. They operate with complex tasks in the same way they operate with simple ones.

当我们引入辅助刺激时，儿童的行为也不同于成人的行为，尽管我们可以辨别出成人特征的重组的开端。

The child’s behavior also differs from adult behavior when we introduce auxiliary stimuli, although we can discern the beginnings of the restructuring that characterize the adult.

首先，我们引入与我们开始时的主要刺激有明确关系的辅助刺激。例如，如果主要刺激是一匹马，作为回应，孩子应该用左手食指按下一个键，我们在该键上粘贴了一张雪橇的图片。在与一条面包相对应的键上，我们粘贴了一张刀的图片。在这种情况下，孩子明白雪橇与马相配，刀与面包相配，等等。选择反应从一开始就顺利建立起来。此外，无论涉及多少刺激和反应，反应的定性特征都保持不变。孩子很快就能找出解决问题的规则，并根据该规则做出选择。

First, we introduce auxiliary stimuli that bear a clear relation to the primary stimuli with which we began. For example, if the primary stimulus was a horse, in response to which the child was supposed to press a key with his left index finger, we pasted a picture of a sleigh on that key. On the key corresponding to a loaf of bread we pasted a picture of a knife. In this case, the child understands that sleigh goes with horse, the knife with bread, and so on. Choice reactions are smoothly established from the outset. Furthermore, it does not matter how many stimuli and responses are involved; the qualitative features of responding remain the same. The child quickly works out a rule for the problem’s solution and makes his choice on the basis of this rule.

然而，认为孩子已经掌握了成人形式的完整中介行为系统是不正确的。我们只需改变主要刺激和辅助刺激之间的关系，就能发现孩子反应系统的极限。如果我们以不同的方式将刺激配对（例如，马和刀，面包和雪橇），孩子将不再以适当的方式使用辅助刺激。孩子只记得马以某种方式帮助找到了雪橇。他的反应表明，他一直在使用马和雪橇的传统关联来指导选择，但还没有掌握使用一种刺激来调节对另一种刺激的反应的内部逻辑。

It would be incorrect, however, to assume that the child has mastered a mediated system of behavior in its full, adult form. We need only to change the relations among the primary and auxiliary stimuli to discover the limits of the child’s response system. If we pair the stimuli in a different way (say, horse with knife, bread with sleigh) the child will no longer use the auxiliary stimuli in a proper way. The child recalls only that horse helped to find sleigh in some way. He reveals by his responses that he had been using the conventional association of horse and sleigh to guide the choice, but had not mastered the internal logic of using one stimulus to mediate the response to another.

如果我们继续进行实验，我们将开始看到儿童反应方式的变化。在对任意相关刺激作出反应的第一阶段，儿童没有足够的经验来有效地组织自己的行为。他天真地运用经验。但在实验过程中，他获得了重组行为所必需的经验。正如儿童在操作物体时获得天真的物理知识一样，儿童在努力执行选择反应任务时获得了心理操作的知识。当他试图回忆起哪些刺激与哪些反应相关时，他开始了解在这种情况下记忆的内容，并开始有效地使用一种或另一种辅助刺激。孩子开始意识到刺激和辅助图片之间的某些关系会产生正确的选择反应，而其他关系则不会。他很快 开始反对图片的排列，要求按键上的图片排列符合与按键相关的主要刺激。当被告知要按面包键来回应马的图片时，孩子回答“不，我想要雪橇键。”这表明孩子正在积累经验，这正在改变他自己的记忆结构。

If we continue our experiment long enough, we will begin to see changes in the way the child responds. In the first stage of responding to arbitrarily related stimuli, the child has insufficient experience with the task to organize his behavior effectively. He uses experience naively. But in the course of the experiment, he gains experience necessary for restructuring his behavior. Just as naive physical knowledge is acquired as the child operates with objects, knowledge of psychological operations is acquired as the child strives to carry out the choice reaction task. As he attempts to recall which stimuli are linked to which responses, the child begins to learn what remembering in this situation consists of and begins to use one or another of the auxiliary stimuli effectively. The child begins to realize that certain relations among the stimuli and auxiliary pictures produce correct choice responses, while others do not. He soon begins to object to the arrangement of pictures, asking that the pictures on the keys be arranged to fit the primary stimuli that are associated with the key. When told to press the bread key in response to the horse picture, the child answers “No, I want the sleigh key.” This shows that the child is accumulating experience which is changing the structure of his own memorizing.

在天真地理解了记忆操作需要什么之后，孩子进入了下一个阶段。如果以看似杂乱无章的方式呈现主要刺激和辅助刺激，孩子会要求将它们按特殊顺序排列，从而亲自建立它们之间的特定关系。此时，孩子表明他知道某些手势将有助于实现某些操作。简而言之，他开始通过使用手势进行记忆。

Having naively comprehended what the memorizing operations require, the child moves to the following stage. If presented with primary and auxiliary stimuli in an arrangement that seems haphazard, the child will ask to put them in a special order, thus personally establishing a specific relation between them. At this point the child is showing that he knows that certain signs will help to achieve certain operations. In short, he is beginning to memorize through the use of signs.

一旦发生这种情况，儿童在建立和使用关系方面就不再遇到困难。给定一些主要和辅助刺激的配对，儿童不再局限于使用已有的关系（例如马—雪橇），而是可以创建自己的关系。这可以称为外部符号使用阶段。其特点是儿童使用外部呈现的符号在内部操作中独立形成新的关系。现在，儿童正在组织外部刺激以进行其反应。这个基本阶段之后是儿童开始组织内部刺激的阶段。

Once this happens, the child no longer experiences difficulties in creating relations and using them. Given some pairing of primary and auxiliary stimuli, the child is no longer restricted to using already available relations (such as horse—sleigh) but can create relations of his own. This may be called the stage of external sign use. It is characterized by the independent formation of new relations in the child’s internal operations using externally presented signs. Now the child is organizing external stimuli to carry out its responses. This fundamental stage is then followed by the stage at which the child begins to organize stimuli of an internal nature.

这些变化体现在选择反应实验的过程中。在经过大量的选择实验练习后，反应时间开始变得越来越短。如果对特定刺激的反应时间是 500 毫秒或更长，则减少到仅仅 200 毫秒。较长的反应时间反映了儿童正在使用外部手段来执行记住要按哪个键的操作。逐渐地，儿童摆脱了外部刺激，不再关注它们。对外部辅助刺激的反应被对内部产生的刺激的反应所取代。在最发达的形式中，这种内部操作包括儿童掌握过程的结构，学习理解必须使用外部符号的规律。当达到这个阶段时，孩子会说：“我不再需要图片了。我自己来做。”

These changes are manifested in the course of the choice reaction experiment. After considerable practice in the choice experiment, the reaction time begins to grow shorter and shorter. If the reaction time to a particular stimulus had been 500 milliseconds or more, it reduces to a mere 200 milliseconds. The longer reaction time reflected the fact that the child was using external means to carry out the operations of remembering which key to push. Gradually, the child casts off the external stimuli, no longer paying attention to them. The response to the external auxiliary stimuli is replaced by a response to internally produced stimuli. In its most developed form, this internal operation consists of the child grasping the very structure of the process, learning to understand the laws according to which external signs must be used. When this stage is reached, the child will say, “I don’t need pictures anymore. I’ll do it myself.”

新方法的特点

CHARACTERISTICS OF THE NEW METHOD

我试图证明，儿童发展过程的特点是大脑结构发生了根本性改变。 行为；在每个新阶段，儿童不仅会改变自己的反应，而且会以新的方式执行反应，利用新的行为“工具”，用一种心理功能取代另一种心理功能。早期阶段通过直接适应形式实现的心理操作后来通过间接方式实现。儿童行为的日益复杂反映在他们用于完成新任务的方式的变化以及心理过程的相应重建中。

I have attempted to demonstrate that the course of child development is characterized by a radical alteration in the very structure of behavior; at each new stage the child changes not only her response but carries out that response in new ways, drawing on new “instruments” of behavior and replacing one psychological function by another. Psychological operations that were achieved through direct forms of adaptation at early stages are later accomplished through indirect means. The growing complexity of children’s behavior is reflected in the changed means they use to fulfill new tasks and the corresponding reconstruction of their psychological processes.

我们的发展概念意味着拒绝接受人们普遍持有的观点，即认知发展是各个变化逐渐积累的结果。我们认为，儿童发展是一个复杂的辩证过程，其特点是周期性、不同功能发展不均衡、一种形式向另一种形式的蜕变或质变、内外因素交织以及克服儿童遇到的障碍的适应过程。大多数儿童心理学工作者沉迷于进化变化的概念，忽视了儿童发展史上经常发生的那些转折点、那些间歇性和革命性的变化。在天真的人看来，革命和进化似乎是不相容的，历史发展只有在遵循直线的情况下才会继续。在发生动乱的地方，在历史结构破裂的地方，天真的人只看到灾难、差距和不连续性。历史似乎停滞了，直到它再次走上直接的、线性的发展道路。

Our concept of development implies a rejection of the frequently held view that cognitive development results from the gradual accumulation of separate changes. We believe that child development is a complex dialectical process characterized by periodicity, unevenness in the development of different functions, metamorphosis or qualitative transformation of one form into another, intertwining of external and internal factors, and adaptive processes which overcome impediments that the child encounters. Steeped in the notion of evolutionary change, most workers in child psychology ignore those turning points, those spasmodic and revolutionary changes that are so frequent in the history of child development. To the naive mind, revolution and evolution seem incompatible and historic development continues only so long as it follows a straight line. Where upheavals occur, where the historical fabric is ruptured, the naive mind sees only catastrophe, gaps, and discontinuity. History seems to stop dead, until it once again takes the direct, linear path of development.

相反，科学思维认为革命和进化是两种相互关联、相互依存的发展形式。在科学思维看来，儿童发展的飞跃只不过是发展总体路线中的一个瞬间。

Scientific thought, on the contrary, sees revolution and evolution as two forms of development that are mutually related and mutually presuppose each other. Leaps in the child’s development are seen by the scientific mind as no more than a moment in the general line of development.

正如我反复强调的那样，儿童成长过程中发生的重建过程的一个基本机制是创造和使用大量人工刺激。这些刺激起着辅助作用，使人类能够控制自己的行为，最初是通过外部手段，后来是通过更复杂的内部操作。我们研究认知功能的方法不需要实验者为受试者提供现成的外部或人工手段，以便他们能够成功完成给定的任务。如果实验者不给孩子们提供人工手段，而是等到他们自发地应用一些新的辅助方法或符号，然后将其融入到他们的操作中，那么实验同样有效。

As I have repeatedly emphasized, an essential mechanism of the reconstructive processes that take place during a child’s development is the creation and use of a number of artificial stimuli. These play an auxiliary role that permits human beings to master their own behavior, at first by external means and later by more complex inner operations. Our approach to the study of cognitive functioning does not require the experimenter to furnish subjects with ready-made, external or artificial means in order that they may successfully complete the given task. The experiment is equally valid if, instead of giving children artificial means, the experimenter waits until they spontaneously apply some new auxiliary method or symbol that they then incorporate into their operations.

我们将这种方法应用到的具体领域并不重要。 我们可以通过向儿童提供解决给定任务的新方法，然后观察他们解决问题的努力程度和特点，来研究儿童记忆的发展。我们可以用这种方法研究儿童如何借助外部手段来组织他们的主动注意力。我们可以通过让儿童操纵物体并应用他们建议或“发明”的方法来追踪儿童算术技能的发展。至关重要的是，在所有这些情况下，我们都必须坚持一个原则。我们不仅研究操作的最终效果，还研究其特定的心理结构 。在所有这些情况下，发展的心理结构都比简单的刺激-反应实验的传统方法更加丰富和多样。尽管刺激-反应方法可以非常容易地确定受试者的反应，但当我们的目标是发现受试者用来组织自己行为的手段和方法时，它就毫无用处了。

The specific area to which we apply this approach is not important. We might study the development of memorizing in children by making available to them new means for solving the given task and then observing the degree and character of their problem-solving efforts. We might use this method to study how children organize their active attention with the aid of external means. We might trace the development of arithmetic skills in young children by making them manipulate objects and apply methods either suggested to them or “invented” by them. What is crucial is that in all these cases we must adhere to one principle. We study not only the final effect of the operation, but its specific psychological structure . In all these cases, the psychological structure of the development appears with much greater richness and variety than in the classic method of the simple stimulus-response experiment. Although stimulus-response methodology makes it extremely easy to ascertain subjects’ responses, it proves useless when our objective is to discover the means and methods that subjects use to organize their own behavior.

我们研究这些过程的方法是使用所谓的双重刺激功能方法 。实验环境中儿童面临的任务通常超出了他目前的能力，无法通过现有的技能解决。在这种情况下，一个中性物体被放置在儿童附近，我们经常能够观察到中性刺激如何被引入情境并发挥符号的功能。因此，儿童会积极地将这些中性物体纳入解决问题的任务中。我们可以说，当出现困难时，中性刺激就会发挥符号的功能，从那时起，操作的结构就会呈现出本质上不同的特征。

Our approach to the study of these processes is to use what we call the functional method of double stimulation . The task facing the child in the experimental context is, as a rule, beyond his present capabilities and cannot be solved by existing skills. In such cases a neutral object is placed near the child, and frequently we are able to observe how the neutral stimulus is drawn into the situation and takes on the function of a sign. Thus, the child actively incorporates these neutral objects into the task of problem solving. We might say that when difficulties arise, neutral stimuli take on the function of a sign and from that point on the operation’s structure assumes an essentially different character.

通过使用这种方法，我们不会局限于通常的方法，即向受试者提供我们期望直接反应的简单刺激。相反，我们同时提供具有特殊功能的第二系列刺激 。通过这种方式，我们能够研究借助特定辅助手段完成任务的过程； 因此，我们也能够发现更高级心理过程的内部结构和发展。

By using this approach, we do not limit ourselves to the usual method of offering the subject simple stimuli to which we expect a direct response. Rather, we simultaneously offer a second series of stimuli that have a special function. In this way, we are able to study the process of accomplishing a task by the aid of specific auxiliary means; thus we are also able to discover the inner structure and development of the higher psychological processes.

双重刺激法可以激发所有年龄段的人的行为中关键过程的表现。无论是儿童还是成人，打结作为提醒只是人类行为普遍调节原则的一个例子，即意义 ，人们在解决问题的过程中建立临时联系并赋予先前中性的刺激以意义。

The method of double stimulation elicits manifestations of the crucial processes in the behavior of people of all ages. Tying a knot as a reminder, in both children and adults, is but one example of a pervasive regulatory principle of human behavior, that of signification , wherein people create temporary links and give significance to previously neutral stimuli in the context of their problem-solving efforts.

我们认为我们的方法很重要，因为它有助于客观化 内在心理过程；刺激-反应方法是客观的， 但它们仅限于研究通常首先存在于主体能力范围之内的外部反应。我们认为，就心理学研究的目标而言，我们对内部心理过程进行客观化的方法比研究预先存在的客观反应的方法更为合适。11只有 内部过程的客观化才能保证获得特定形式的高级行为，而不是从属形式。

We regard our method as important because it helps to objectify inner psychological processes; stimulus-response methods are objective, but they are limited to the study of external responses that are usually in the subject’s repertoire to begin with. We believe that our approach to objectifying inner psychological processes is much more adequate, where the goals of psychological research are concerned, than the method of studying preexisting, objective responses.11 Only the objectification of the inner process guarantees access to specific forms of higher behavior as opposed to subordinate forms.

第二部分 / 社会中的心态

Part Two / Mind in Society

教育意义

Educational Implications

6

6

学习与发展的互动

Interaction between Learning and Development

如果不解决学龄儿童的学习与发展之间的关系，就无法正确解决甚至阐述教学心理分析中遇到的问题。然而，在将儿童发展理论应用于教育过程的所有基本问题中，学习与发展的关系是最不明确的。毋庸置疑，理论不明确并不意味着这个问题完全从当前的学习研究中消失；没有一项研究可以避开这个核心理论问题。但是，学习与发展之间的关系在方法论上仍然不明确，因为具体的研究包含了理论上模糊、未经批判性评估、有时内部相互矛盾的假设、前提和对这一基本关系问题的特殊解决方案；当然，这些会导致各种错误。

The problems encountered in the psychological analysis of teaching cannot be correctly resolved or even formulated without addressing the relation between learning and development in school-age children. Yet it is the most unclear of all the basic issues on which the application of child development theories to educational processes depends. Needless to say, the lack of theoretical clarity does not mean that the issue is removed altogether from current research efforts into learning; not one study can avoid this central theoretical issue. But the relation between learning and development remains methodologically unclear because concrete research studies have embodied theoretically vague, critically unevaluated, and sometimes internally contradictory postulates, premises, and peculiar solutions to the problem of this fundamental relationship; and these, of course, result in a variety of errors.

本质上，所有当前关于儿童发展和学习之间关系的概念都可以归结为三种主要的理论立场。

Essentially, all current conceptions of the relation between development and learning in children can be reduced to three major theoretical positions.

第一种观点认为，儿童的发展过程与学习无关。学习被认为是一种纯粹的外部过程，不积极参与发展。它只是利用发展的成果，而不是提供改变其进程的动力。

The first centers on the assumption that processes of child development are independent of learning. Learning is considered a purely external process that is not actively involved in development. It merely utilizes the achievements of development rather than providing an impetus for modifying its course.

在对学龄儿童思维发展的实验研究中，人们一直认为，推理和理解、世界观的形成、物理因果关系的解释、逻辑思维形式和抽象逻辑的掌握等过程都是自然发生的，不受学校的影响。 学习。这种理论的一个例子是皮亚杰极其复杂和有趣的理论原理，这些原理也塑造了他所采用的实验方法。皮亚杰在与儿童的“临床谈话”过程中提出的问题清楚地说明了他的方法。当一个五岁的孩子被问到“为什么太阳不落下？”时，人们认为这个孩子既没有现成的答案，也没有提出问题的一般能力。提出远远超出儿童智力能力范围的问题的目的是为了消除先前经验和知识的影响。实验者试图以“纯粹”的形式获得儿童思维的倾向，完全独立于学习。1

In experimental investigations of the development of thinking in school children, it has been assumed that processes such as deduction and understanding, evolution of notions about the world, interpretation of physical causality, and mastery of logical forms of thought and abstract logic all occur by themselves, without any -influence from school learning. An example of such a theory is Piaget’s extremely complex and interesting theoretical principles, which also shape the experimental methodology he employs. The questions Piaget uses in the course of his “clinical conversations” with children clearly illustrate his approach. When a five-year-old is asked “why doesn’t the sun fall?” it is assumed that the child has neither a ready answer for such a question nor the general capabilities for generating one. The point of asking questions that are so far beyond the reach of the child’s intellectual skills is to eliminate the influence of previous experience and knowledge. The experimenter seeks to obtain the tendencies of children’s thinking in “pure” form, entirely independent of learning.1

同样，心理学经典著作，如比奈等人的作品，认为发展始终是学习的先决条件，如果孩子的心智功能（智力运作）尚未成熟到能够学习某一特定科目的程度，那么任何指导都是无用的。他们特别担心过早指导，即在孩子还没有准备好之前就教授某一科目。所有的努力都集中在寻找学习能力的最低门槛，即某种特定学习方式首次成为可能的年龄。

Similarly, the classics of psychological literature, such as the works by Binet and others, assume that development is always a prerequisite for learning and that if a child’s mental functions (intellectual operations) have not matured to the extent that he is capable of learning a particular subject, then no instruction will prove useful. They especially feared premature instruction, the teaching of a subject before the child was ready for it. All effort was concentrated on finding the lower threshold of learning ability, the age at which a particular kind of learning first becomes possible.

由于这种方法基于这样的前提：学习落后于发展，发展总是领先于学习，因此它排除了学习可能在学习过程中激活的那些功能的发展或成熟过程中发挥作用的观点。发展或成熟被视为学习的先决条件，但绝不是学习的结果。总结一下这个观点：学习构成了发展的上层建筑，而后者基本上没有改变。

Because this approach is based on the premise that learning trails behind development, that development always outruns learning, it precludes the notion that learning may play a role in the course of the development or maturation of those functions activated in the course of learning. Development or maturation is viewed as a precondition of learning but never the result of it. To summarize this position: Learning forms a superstructure over development, leaving the latter essentially unaltered.

第二个主要的理论立场是学习就是发展。这一观点是一组起源各异的理论的精髓。

The second major theoretical position is that learning is development. This identity is the essence of a group of theories that are quite diverse in origin.

其中一种理论基于反射的概念，反射是一个本质上很古老的概念，但最近又被广泛地复兴。无论是阅读、写作还是算术，发展都被视为条件反射的掌握；也就是说，学习过程与发展过程完全密不可分。詹姆斯详细阐述了这一概念，他将学习过程简化为习惯养成，并将学习过程等同于发展。

One such theory is based on the concept of reflex, an essentially old notion that has been extensively revived recently. Whether reading, writing, or arithmetic is being considered, development is viewed as the mastery of conditioned reflexes; that is, the process of learning is completely and inseparably blended with the process of development. This notion was elaborated by James, who reduced the learning process to habit formation and identified the learning process with development.

反射理论至少与皮亚杰的理论有一个共同点：在这两种理论中，发展都被认为是先天反应的完善和替代。正如詹姆斯所言，“教育， 简而言之，没有比称之为后天习得的行为习惯和行为倾向的组织更好的描述了。” 2 发展本身主要归结为所有可能的反应的积累。任何后天反应都被认为是先天反应的更复杂形式或替代品。

Reflex theories have at least one thing in common with theories such as Piaget’s: in both, development is conceived of as the elaboration and substitution of innate responses. As James expressed it, “Education, in short, cannot be better described than by calling it the organization of acquired habits of conduct and tendencies to behavior.”2 Development itself is reduced primarily to the accumulation of all possible responses. Any acquired response is considered either a more complex form of or a substitute for the innate response.

但是，尽管第一种和第二种理论立场相似，但他们对学习和发展过程之间的时间关系的假设却有很大不同。持第一种观点的理论家认为，发展周期先于学习周期；成熟先于学习，而指导必须落后于心智成长。对于第二组理论家来说，这两个过程是同时发生的；学习和发展在所有点上都是一致的，就像两个相同的几何图形叠加时一致一样。

But despite the similarity between the first and second theoretical positions, there is a major difference in their assumptions about the temporal relationship between learning and developmental processes.
