Theorists who hold the first view assert that developmental cycles precede learning cycles; maturation precedes learning and instruction must lag behind mental growth. For the second group of theorists, both processes occur simultaneously; learning and development coincide at all points in the same way that two identical geometrical figures coincide when superimposed.

关于学习与发展关系的第三种理论立场试图通过简单地将前两种理论结合起来来克服前两种理论的极端性。这种方法的一个明显例子是科夫卡的理论，其中发展基于两个本质上不同但相关的过程，每个过程都相互影响。3一方面 是成熟，它直接取决于神经系统的发育；另一方面是学习，它本身也是一个发展过程。

The third theoretical position on the relation between learning and development attempts to overcome the extremes of the other two by simply combining them. A clear example of this approach is Koffka’s theory, in which development is based on two inherently different but related processes, each of which influences the other.3 On the one hand is maturation, which depends directly on the development of the nervous system; on the other hand is learning, which itself is also a developmental process.

这一理论有三个方面是新颖的。首先，正如我们已经指出的，是两种看似相反的观点的结合，这两种观点在科学史上都是单独遇到的。这两种观点可以结合成一个理论，这一事实本身就表明它们不是对立和相互排斥的，而是有一些基本的共同点。另一个新颖之处在于，构成发展的两个过程是相互依赖和相互作用的。当然，在考夫卡的著作中，这种相互作用的性质几乎没有被探究，他的著作仅限于对这两个过程之间关系的非常笼统的评论。很明显，对于考夫卡来说，成熟过程为特定的学习过程做好了准备，并使之成为可能。学习过程随后刺激并推动成熟过程。这一理论的第三个也是最重要的新方面是它赋予学习在儿童发展中更大的作用。这种强调直接将我们引向一个古老的教学问题，即正式纪律和迁移问题。

Three aspects of this theory are new. First, as we already noted, is the combination of two seemingly opposite viewpoints, each of which has been encountered separately in the history of science. The very fact that these two viewpoints can be combined into one theory indicates that they are not opposing and mutually exclusive but have something essential in common. Also new is the idea that the two processes that make up development are mutually dependent and interactive. Of course, the nature of the interaction is left virtually unexplored in Koffka’s work, which is limited solely to very general remarks regarding the relation between these two processes. It is clear that for Koffka the process of maturation prepares and makes possible a specific process of learning. The learning process then stimulates and pushes forward the maturation process. The third and most important new aspect of this theory is the expanded role it ascribes to learning in child development. This emphasis leads us directly to an old pedagogical problem, that of formal discipline and the problem of transfer.

强调正式学科并提倡教授古典语言、古代文明和数学的教育运动认为，无论这些学科是否无关紧要， 某些学科对于日常生活至关重要，它们对学生的智力发展具有最大的价值。各种研究都对这一想法的合理性提出了质疑。研究表明，在一个领域学习对整体发展影响很小。例如，反射理论家伍德沃思和桑代克发现，经过特殊训练后，成年人在确定短线长度方面取得了相当大的成功，但在确定长线长度方面几乎没有进步。这些成年人成功地接受了估计给定二维图形大小的训练，但这种训练并没有使他们成功地估计一系列其他各种大小和形状的二维图形的大小。

Pedagogical movements that have emphasized formal discipline and urged the teaching of classical languages, ancient civilizations, and mathematics have assumed that regardless of the irrelevance of these particular subjects for daily living, they were of the greatest value for the pupil’s mental development. A variety of studies have called into question the soundness of this idea. It has been shown that learning in one area has very little influence on overall development. For example, reflex theorists Woodworth and Thorndike found that adults who, after special exercises, had achieved considerable success in determining the length of short lines, had made virtually no progress in their ability to determine the length of long lines. These same adults were successfully trained to estimate the size of a given two-dimensional figure, but this training did not make them successful in estimating the size of a series of other two-dimensional figures of various sizes and shapes.

根据桑代克的说法，心理学和教育学的理论家认为，每一种特定的反应都会直接提高整体能力。4教师们相信并根据这一理论行事，即心智是 一种能力的复合体——观察力、注意力、记忆力、思考力等等——任何特定能力的提高都会导致所有能力的普遍提高。根据这一理论，如果学生更加关注拉丁语法，他就会提高集中注意力完成任何任务的能力。“准确性”、“机智”、“推理能力”、“记忆力”、“观察力”、“注意力”、“专注力”等词据说表示实际的基本能力，这些能力会根据它们所操作的材料而变化；这些基本能力在学习特定科目时会发生实质性的改变，当它们转向其他领域时，这些改变会保留下来。因此，如果一个人学会做好任何一件事，由于某种秘密联系，他也能够做好其他完全不相关的事情。人们认为，心理能力的发挥与其所运用的材料无关，一种能力的发展需要其他能力的发展。

According to Thorndike, theoreticians in psychology and education believe that every particular response acquisition directly enhances overall ability in equal measure.4 Teachers believed and acted on the basis of the theory that the mind is a complex of abilities—powers of observation, attention, memory, thinking, and so forth—and that any improvement in any specific ability results in a general improvement in all abilities. According to this theory, if the student increased the attention he paid to Latin grammar, he would increase his abilities to focus attention on any task. The words “accuracy,” “quick-wittedness,” “ability to reason,” “memory,” “power of observation,” “attention,” “concentration,” and so forth are said to denote actual fundamental capabilities that vary in accordance with the material with which they operate; these basic abilities are substantially modified by studying particular subjects, and they retain these modifications when they turn to other areas. Therefore, if someone learns to do any single thing well, he will also be able to do other entirely unrelated things well as a result of some secret connection. It is assumed that mental capabilities function independently of the material with which they operate, and that the development of one ability entails the development of others.

桑代克本人反对这种观点。他通过各种研究指出，特定形式的活动（如拼写）依赖于掌握完成该特定任务所需的特定技能和材料。一种特定能力的发展很少意味着其他能力的发展。桑代克认为，能力的专业化程度甚至比表面观察所能显示的还要高。例如，如果我们从一百个人中挑选出十个表现出检测拼写错误或测量长度的能力的人，那么这十个人不太可能表现出更好的能力，例如，在估计物体的重量方面。在 同样，加数字的速度和准确性与想出反义词的速度和准确性完全无关。

Thorndike himself opposed this point of view. Through a variety of studies he showed that particular forms of activity, such as spelling, are dependent on the mastery of specific skills and material necessary for the performance of that particular task. The development of one particular capability seldom means the development of others. Thorndike argued that specialization of abilities is even greater than superficial observation may indicate. For example, if, out of a hundred individuals we choose ten who display the ability to detect spelling errors or to measure lengths, it is unlikely that these ten will display better abilities regarding, for example, the estimation of the weight of objects. In the same way, speed and accuracy in adding numbers are entirely unrelated to speed and accuracy in being able to think up antonyms.

这项研究表明，心智并不是由观察、注意力、记忆、判断等一般 能力组成的复杂网络，而是一组特定能力，每种能力在某种程度上都独立于其他能力，并独立发展。学习不仅仅是获得思考能力，它还获得了许多专门思考各种事物的能力。学习不会改变我们集中注意力的整体能力，而是发展出将注意力集中在各种事物上的各种能力。根据这种观点，特殊训练只有在其要素、材料和过程在特定领域相似时才会影响整体发展；习惯支配着我们。这导致这样的结论：由于每项活动都依赖于其运作的材料，因此意识的发展就是一组特定的、独立的能力或一组特定的习惯的发展。意识的一种功能或其活动的一个方面的改善只有在两种功能或活动都有共同的元素的情况下才能影响另一种功能或活动的发展。

This research shows that the mind is not a complex network of general capabilities such as observation, attention, memory, judgment, and so forth, but a set of specific capabilities, each of which is, to some extent, independent of the others and is developed independently. Learning is more than the acquisition of the ability to think; it is the acquisition of many specialized abilities for thinking about a variety of things. Learning does not alter our overall ability to focus attention but rather develops various abilities to focus attention on a variety of things. According to this view, special training affects overall development only when its elements, material, and processes are similar across specific domains; habit governs us. This leads to the conclusion that because each activity depends on the material with which it operates, the development of consciousness is the development of a set of particular, independent capabilities or of a set of particular habits. Improvement of one function of consciousness or one aspect of its activity can affect the development of another only to the extent that there are elements common to both functions or activities.

考夫卡和格式塔学派等发展理论家——他们坚持前面概述的第三种理论立场——反对桑代克的观点。他们断言学习的影响从来都不是特定的。从他们对结构原则的研究来看，他们认为学习过程绝不能简单地归结为技能的形成，而是体现了一种智力秩序，这种秩序使得能够在解决一项任务时发现的一般原则转移到各种其他任务中。从这个角度来看，儿童在学习特定操作时，获得了创建某种类型结构的能力，无论她使用的材料有多多样化，也无论涉及哪些特定元素。因此，考夫卡并不认为学习仅限于习惯和技能习得的过程。他所假设的学习与发展之间的关系不是身份关系，而是一种更复杂的关系。根据桑代克的说法，学习和发展在所有方面都是一致的，但对考夫卡来说，发展总是比学习更大。从示意图上看，这两个过程之间的关系可以用两个同心圆来描绘，小圆象征学习过程，大圆象征学习引起的发展过程。

Developmental theorists such as Koffka and the Gestalt School—who hold to the third theoretical position outlined earlier—oppose Thorndike’s point of view. They assert that the influence of learning is never specific. From their study of structural principles, they argue that the learning process can never be reduced simply to the formation of skills but embodies an intellectual order that makes it possible to transfer general principles discovered in solving one task to a variety of other tasks. From this point of view, the child, while learning a particular operation, acquires the ability to create structures of a certain type, regardless of the diverse materials with which she is working and regardless of the particular elements involved. Thus, Koffka does not conceive of learning as limited to a process of habit and skill acquisition. The relationship he posits between learning and development is not that of an identity but of a more complex relationship. According to Thorndike, learning and development coincide at all points, but for Koffka, development is always a larger set than learning. Schematically, the relationship between the two processes could be depicted by two concentric circles, the smaller symbolizing the learning process and the larger the developmental process evoked by learning.

一旦孩子学会了执行操作，他就会吸收一些结构原理，这些原理的应用范围不仅仅是 因此，儿童在学习上迈出一步，在发展上迈出两步，也就是说，学习和发展并不同步。这个概念是我们讨论的第三组理论的本质方面。

Once a child has learned to perform an operation, he thus assimilates some structural principle whose sphere of application is other than just the operations of the type on whose basis the principle was assimilated Consequently, in making one step in learning, a child makes two steps in development, that is, learning and development do not coincide. This concept is the essential aspect of the third group of theories we have discussed.

近侧发展区：一种新方法

ZONE OF PROXIMAL DEVELOPMENT: A NEW APPROACH

尽管我们拒绝接受上述三种理论立场，但分析它们可以让我们更充分地了解学习与发展之间的关系。解决这个问题需要提出的问题很复杂。它由两个独立的问题组成：第一，学习与发展之间的一般关系；第二，儿童达到学龄时这种关系的具体特征。

Although we reject all three theoretical positions discussed above, analyzing them leads us to a more adequate view of the relation between learning and development. The question to be framed in arriving at a solution to this problem is complex. It consists of two separate issues: first, the general relation between learning and development; and second, the specific features of this relationship when children reach school age.

孩子们的学习早在他们上学之前就开始了，这是本次讨论的出发点。孩子在学校遇到的任何学习总是有一段历史。例如，孩子们在学校开始学习算术，但早在这之前，他们就已经对数量有了一些经验——他们必须处理除法、加法、减法和确定大小的运算。因此，孩子们有自己的学前算术，只有目光短浅的心理学家才会忽视这一点。

That children’s learning begins long before they attend school is the starting point of this discussion. Any learning a child encounters in school always has a previous history. For example, children begin to study arithmetic in school, but long beforehand they have had some experience with quantity—they have had to deal with operations of division, addition, subtraction, and determination of size. Consequently, children have their own preschool arithmetic, which only myopic psychologists could ignore.

毋庸置疑，学龄前儿童的学习与学校学习有着显著的不同，学校学习主要关注科学知识的基础知识的吸收。但即使在孩子第一次提出问题时，他们就记住了周围物体的名称，这也是在学习。事实上，毫无疑问，孩子是从成人那里学习语言的；孩子通过提问和回答获得了各种各样的信息；孩子通过模仿成人和被教导如何行动，发展出一整套技能。从孩子出生的第一天起，学习和发展就是相互关联的。

It goes without saying that learning as it occurs in the preschool years differs markedly from school learning, which is concerned with the assimilation of the fundamentals of scientific knowledge. But even when, in the period of her first questions, a child assimilates the names of objects in her environment, she is learning. Indeed, can it be doubted that children learn speech from adults; or that, through asking questions and giving answers, children acquire a variety of information; or that, through imitating adults and through being instructed about how to act, children develop an entire repository of skills? Learning and development are interrelated from the child’s very first day of life.

考夫卡试图阐明儿童学习的规律及其与智力发展的关系，他把注意力集中在最简单的学习过程上，即学龄前阶段的学习过程。他的错误在于，虽然看到了学龄前学习和学校学习之间的相似之处，但他没有辨别出两者的区别——他没有看到学校学习引入的具体新元素。他和其他人认为，学龄前学习和学校学习的区别在于非系统的 一种情况是学习，另一种情况是系统学习。但“系统性”并不是唯一的问题；还有一个事实是，学​​校学习为儿童的发展引入了一些全新的内容。为了阐述学校学习的各个方面，我们将描述一个新的、极其重要的概念，没有这个概念，这个问题就无法解决：近侧发展区。

Koffka, attempting to clarify the laws of child learning and their relation to mental development, concentrates his attention on the simplest learning processes, those that occur in the preschool years. His error is that, while seeing a similarity between preschool and school learning, he fails to discern the difference—he does not see the specifically new elements that school learning introduces. He and others assume that the difference between preschool and school learning consists of non-systematic learning in one case and systematic learning in the other. But “systematicness” is not the only issue; there is also the fact that school learning introduces something fundamentally new into the child’s development. In order to elaborate the dimensions of school learning, we will describe a new and exceptionally important concept without which the issue cannot be resolved: the zone of proximal development.

一个众所周知的、经验证实的事实是，学​​习应该以某种方式与儿童的发展水平相匹配。例如，已经确定阅读、写作和算术的教学应该在特定的年龄水平开始。然而，直到最近，人们才注意到，如果我们想发现发展过程与学习能力的实际关系，我们不能仅仅局限于确定发展水平。我们必须确定至少两个发展水平。

A well known and empirically established fact is that learning should be matched in some manner with the child’s developmental level. For example, it has been established that the teaching of reading, writing, and arithmetic should be initiated at a specific age level. Only recently, however, has attention been directed to the fact that we cannot limit ourselves merely to determining developmental levels if we wish to discover the actual relations of the developmental process to learning capabilities. We must determine at least two developmental levels.

第一个层次可以称为实际发展水平 ，即儿童的心理功能发展水平，这是某些已经完成的 发展周期的结果。当我们通过测试确定儿童的心理年龄时，我们几乎总是在处理实际发展水平。在儿童心理发展的研究中，通常认为只有儿童能够独立完成的事情才表明其心理能力。我们给孩子们一系列测试或各种不同难度的任务，我们根据他们解决问题的方式和难度来判断他们的心理发展程度。另一方面，如果我们提出引导性问题或展示如何解决问题，然后孩子解决了问题，或者如果老师发起解决方案，孩子完成或与其他孩子合作解决问题——简而言之，如果孩子几乎没有独立解决问题——那么这个解决方案就不被视为他的心理发展的指标。这个“事实”是众所周知的，并得到了常识的强化。十多年来，即使是最深刻的思想家也从未质疑过这个假设；他们从未想过，孩子在别人帮助下所能做的事情在某种意义上比他们独自所能做的事情更能体现他们的智力发展。

The first level can be called the actual developmental level , that is, the level of development of a child’s mental functions that has been established as a result of certain already completed developmental cycles. When we determine a child’s mental age by using tests, we are almost always dealing with the actual developmental level. In studies of children’s mental development it is generally assumed that only those things that children can do on their own are indicative of mental abilities. We give children a battery of tests or a variety of tasks of varying degrees of difficulty, and we judge the extent of their mental development on the basis of how they solve them and at what level of difficulty. On the other hand, if we offer leading questions or show how the problem is to be solved and the child then solves it, or if the teacher initiates the solution and the child completes it or solves it in collaboration with other children—in short, if the child barely misses an independent solution of the problem—the solution is not regarded as indicative of his mental development. This “truth” was familiar and reinforced by common sense. Over a decade even the profoundest thinkers never questioned the assumption; they never entertained the notion that what children can do with the assistance of others might be in some sense even more indicative of their mental development than what they can do alone.

举个简单的例子。假设我调查了两个刚入学的孩子，他们的年龄都是十岁，智力发育都是八岁。我能说他们的智力是同龄人吗？当然。这是什么意思？这意味着他们可以独立处理八岁水平标准化的难度的任务。如果我 如果我的实验就此结束，人们会认为这些孩子接下来的智力发展和学校学习过程将是相同的，因为这取决于他们的智力。当然，也可能有其他因素，例如，如果一个孩子生病了半年，而另一个孩子从未缺课；但一般来说，这些孩子的命运应该是一样的。现在想象一下，我不在此时结束我的研究，而只是开始研究。这些孩子似乎能够处理八岁儿童水平以下的问题，但不会超过这个水平。假设我向他们展示了解决问题的各种方法。不同的实验者可能会在不同情况下采用不同的演示模式：一些人可能会进行整个演示并要求孩子们重复，其他人可能会提出解决方案并要求孩子完成它，或者提出引导性问题。简而言之，我建议孩子们在我的帮助下以某种方式解决问题。在这种情况下，第一个孩子可以处理十二岁儿童水平的问题，第二个孩子可以处理九岁儿童水平的问题。那么，这些孩子的心智是否都一样呢？

Let us take a simple example. Suppose I investigate two children upon entrance into school, both of whom are ten years old chronologically and eight years old in terms of mental development. Can I say that they are the same age mentally? Of course. What does this mean? It means that they can independently deal with tasks up to the degree of difficulty that has been standardized for the eight-year-old level. If I stop at this point, people would imagine that the subsequent course of mental development and of school learning for these children will be the same, because it depends on their intellect. Of course, there may be other factors, for example, if one child was sick for half a year while the other was never absent from school; but generally speaking, the fate of these children should be the same. Now imagine that I do not terminate my study at this point, but only begin it. These children seem to be capable of handling problems up to an eight-year-old’s level, but not beyond that. Suppose that I show them various ways of dealing with the problem. Different experimenters might employ different modes of demonstration in different cases: some might run through an entire demonstration and ask the children to repeat it, others might initiate the solution and ask the child to finish it, or offer leading questions. In short, in some way or another I propose that the children solve the problem with my assistance. Under these circumstances it turns out that the first child can deal with problems up to a twelve-year-old’s level, the second up to a nine-year-old’s. Now, are these children mentally the same?

当人们首次发现智力发展水平相同的儿童在老师指导下学习的能力差异很大时，人们就发现这些儿童的智力年龄并不相同，他们随后的学习过程显然会有所不同。十二岁和八岁之间或九岁和八岁之间的这种差异就是我们所说的最近发展区。它是独立解决问题所确定的实际发展水平与在成人指导下或与更有能力的同龄人合作解决问题所确定的潜在发展水平之间的差距 。

When it was first shown that the capability of children with equal levels of mental development to learn under a teacher’s guidance varied to a high degree, it became apparent that those children were not mentally the same age and that the subsequent course of their learning would obviously be different. This difference between twelve and eight, or between nine and eight, is what we call the zone of proximal development. It is the distance between the actual developmental level as determined by independent problem solving and the level of potential development as determined through problem solving under adult guidance or in collaboration with more capable peers .

如果我们天真地问实际发展水平是什么，或者更简单地说，更独立的问题解决揭示了什么，最常见的答案是，儿童的实际发展水平定义了已经成熟的功能，即发展的最终产品。如果一个孩子可以独立做某事，这意味着她身上的某事功能已经成熟。那么，通过儿童无法独立解决而只能在他人帮助下解决的问题来确定的近侧发展区又是什么呢？近侧发展区定义了那些尚未成熟但正在成熟过程中的功能，这些功能明天就会成熟，但目前处于胚胎状态。这些功能可以称为发展的“花蕾”或“花朵”，而不是发展的“果实”。实际发展水平回顾性地描述了心理发展，而近侧发展区则描述了心理发展。 近侧发展前瞻性地描述了心理发展。

If we naively ask what the actual developmental level is, or, to put it more simply, what more independent problem solving reveals, the most common answer would be that a child’s actual developmental level defines functions that have already matured, that is, the end products of development. If a child can do such-and-such independently, it means that the functions for such-and-such have matured in her. What, then, is defined by the zone of proximal development, as determined through problems that children cannot solve independently but only with assistance? The zone of proximal development defines those functions that have not yet matured but are in the process of maturation, functions that will mature tomorrow but are currently in an embryonic state. These functions could be termed the “buds” or “flowers” of development rather than the “fruits” of development. The actual developmental level characterizes mental development retrospectively, while the zone of proximal development characterizes mental development prospectively.

近侧发展区为心理学家和教育家提供了一种工具，通过它可以了解内部发展过程。通过这种方法，我们不仅可以考虑已经完成的周期和成熟过程，还可以考虑当前处于形成状态、刚刚开始成熟和发展的过程。因此，近侧发展区使我们能够描绘出儿童的近期未来及其动态发展状态，不仅可以考虑已经取得的发展成就，还可以考虑正在成熟过程中的发展。我们例子中的两个孩子从已经完成的发展周期的角度来看表现出相同的心理年龄，但两者的发展动态完全不同。只有明确儿童心理发展的两个水平，才能确定其状态：实际发展水平和近侧发展区。

The zone of proximal development furnishes psychologists and educators with a tool through which the internal course of development can be understood. By using this method we can take account of not only the cycles and maturation processes that have already been completed but also those processes that are currently in a state of formation, that are just beginning to mature and develop. Thus, the zone of proximal development permits us to delineate the child’s immediate future and his dynamic developmental state, allowing not only for what already has been achieved developmentally but also for what is in the course of maturing. The two children in our example displayed the same mental age from the viewpoint of developmental cycles already completed, but the developmental dynamics of the two were entirely different. The state of a child’s mental development can be determined only by clarifying its two levels: the actual developmental level and the zone of proximal development.

我将讨论一项针对学龄前儿童的研究，以证明今天处于近侧发展区的东西将成为明天的实际发展水平，也就是说，孩子今天在别人的帮助下能做的事情，明天就能自己做。

I will discuss one study of preschool children to demonstrate that what is in the zone of proximal development today will be the actual developmental level tomorrow—that is, what a child can do with assistance today she will be able to do by herself tomorrow.

美国研究员 Dorothea McCarthy 指出，3 至 5 岁儿童有两组功能：儿童已经具备的功能，以及他们可以在指导、小组和相互协作下完成但尚未独立掌握的功能。McCarthy 的研究表明，第二组功能处于 5 至 7 岁儿童的实际发展水平。她的研究对象在 3 至 5 岁时只能在指导、协作和小组中完成的功能，在 5 至 7 岁时可以独立完成。5因此， 如果我们只确定心理年龄（即只确定已经成熟的功能），我们只能得到已完成发展的总结，而如果我们确定成熟的功能，我们可以预测这些 5 至 7 岁儿童在保持相同发展条件的情况下会发生什么。近侧发展区可以成为发展研究中的一个强大概念，可以显著提高心理发展诊断在教育问题中的应用的有效性和实用性。

The American researcher Dorothea McCarthy showed that among children between the ages of three and five there are two groups of functions: those the children already possess, and those they can perform under guidance, in groups, and in collaboration with one another but which they have not mastered independently. McCarthy’s study demonstrated that this second group of functions is at the actual developmental level of five-to-seven-year-olds. What her subjects could do only under guidance, in collaboration, and in groups at the age of three-to-five years they could do independently when they reached the age of five-to-seven years.5 Thus, if we were to determine only mental age—that is, only functions that have matured—we would have but a summary of completed development, while if we determine the maturing functions, we can predict what will happen to these children between five and seven, provided the same developmental conditions are maintained. The zone of proximal development can become a powerful concept in developmental research, one that can markedly enhance the effectiveness and utility of the application of diagnostics of mental development to educational problems.

充分理解近侧发展区的概念，必然导致对模仿在学习中的作用的重新评估。古典心理学的一个不可动摇的原则是，只有独立的 儿童的活动，而不是他们的模仿活动，表明了他们的智力发展水平。所有现行的测试系统都表达了这一观点。在评估智力发展时，只考虑儿童在没有他人帮助、没有演示、没有引导性问题的情况下对测试问题的解决方案。模仿和学习被认为是纯粹的机械过程。但最近心理学家表明，一个人只能模仿她发展水平之内的东西。例如，如果一个孩子在算术上遇到困难，老师在黑板上解决了这个问题，孩子可能会立即掌握答案。但如果老师要解决高等数学问题，无论孩子模仿多少次，她都无法理解答案。

A full understanding of the concept of the zone of proximal development must result in reevaluation of the role of imitation in learning. An unshakable tenet of classical psychology is that only the independent activity of children, not their imitative activity, indicates their level of mental development. This view is expressed in all current testing systems. In evaluating mental development, consideration is given to only those solutions to test problems which the child reaches without the assistance of others, without demonstrations, and without leading questions. Imitation and learning are thought of as purely mechanical processes. But recently psychologists have shown that a person can imitate only that which is within her developmental level. For example, if a child is having difficulty with a problem in arithmetic and the teacher solves it on the blackboard, the child may grasp the solution in an instant. But if the teacher were to solve a problem in higher mathematics, the child would not be able to understand the solution no matter how many times she imitated it.

动物心理学家，尤其是科勒，已经很好地处理了模仿问题。6科勒的实验试图确定灵长类动物是否具有图形思维能力。主要问题是灵长类动物是否独立解决问题，或者它们是否仅仅模仿 它们以前见过的解决方案，例如，观察其他动物或人类使用棍棒和其他工具，然后模仿它们。科勒的特殊实验旨在确定灵长类动物可以模仿什么，结果表明，灵长类动物只能通过模仿来解决那些难度与它们单独解决的问题相同的问题。然而，科勒没有考虑到一个重要事实，即灵长类动物无法通过模仿来教导（就人类的意义上而言），也无法发展它们的智力，因为它们没有近侧发展区。灵长类动物可以通过训练利用其机械和心理技能学到很多东西，但无法变得更聪明，也就是说，无法教会它独立解决各种更高级的问题。因此，动物无法进行人类意义上的学习；人类的学习以特定的社会性质和儿童成长为周围人的智力生活的过程为前提 。

Animal psychologists, and in particular Köhler, have dealt with this question of imitation quite well.6 Köhler’s experiments sought to determine whether primates are capable of graphic thought. The principal question was whether primates solved problems independently or whether they merely imitated solutions they had seen performed earlier, for example, watching other animals or humans use sticks and other tools and then imitating them. Köhler’s special experiments, designed to determine what primates could imitate, reveal that primates can use imitation to solve only those problems that are of the same degree of difficulty as those they can solve alone. However, Köhler failed to take account of an important fact, namely, that primates cannot be taught (in the human sense of the word) through imitation, nor can their intellect be developed, because they have no zone of proximal development. A primate can learn a great deal through training by using its mechanical and mental skills, but it cannot be made more intelligent, that is, it cannot be taught to solve a variety of more advanced problems independently. For this reason animals are incapable of learning in the human sense of the term; human learning presupposes a specific social nature and a process by which children grow into the intellectual life of those around them .

儿童可以模仿各种远远超出其自身能力范围的行为。通过模仿，儿童能够在集体活动或在成人指导下做更多的事情。这一事实本身似乎意义不大，但却具有根本性的意义，因为它要求彻底改变有关儿童学习与发展关系的整个理论。一个直接后果是可以从发展诊断测试中得出的结论发生变化。

Children can imitate a variety of actions that go well beyond the limits of their own capabilities. Using imitation, children are capable of doing much more in collective activity or under the guidance of adults. This fact, which seems to be of little significance in itself, is of fundamental importance in that it demands a radical alteration of the entire doctrine concerning the relation between learning and development in children. One direct consequence is a change in conclusions that may be drawn from diagnostic tests of development.

过去，人们认为，通过测试，我们可以确定教育应考虑的智力发展水平以及教育不应超出的限度。这种方法将学习导向昨天的发展，导向已经完成的发展阶段。这种观点的错误在实践中比在理论上更早被发现。在智力迟钝儿童的教学中，这一点表现得最为明显。研究表明，智力迟钝儿童的抽象思维能力不强。由此，特殊学校的教学法得出了一个看似正确的结论，即对这类儿童的所有教学都应该基于具体的观察和实践方法。然而，对这种方法的大量经验导致了深刻的幻灭。事实证明，完全基于具体性的教学体系——一种从教学中排除与抽象思维相关的一切的教学体系——不仅无法帮助智力迟钝儿童克服他们先天的缺陷，而且还会通过让孩子们完全习惯于具体思维并因此抑制这些孩子仍然具有的任何抽象思维的雏形来强化他们的缺陷。正是因为智障儿童如果任其发展，就永远无法形成精细的抽象思维形式，所以学校应该尽一切努力推动他们朝着这个方向发展，培养他们自身发展中内在缺乏的东西。在智障儿童特殊学校的当前实践中，我们可以看到一种有益的转变，即摆脱这种具体性的概念，让观察和实践方法恢复其应有的作用。现在，具体性被视为必要和不可避免的，只是作为发展抽象思维的垫脚石——作为一种手段，而不是目的本身。

Formerly, it was believed that by using tests, we determine the mental development level with which education should reckon and whose limits it should not exceed. This procedure oriented learning toward yesterday’s development, toward developmental stages already completed. The error of this view was discovered earlier in practice than in theory. It is demonstrated most clearly in the teaching of mentally retarded children. Studies have established that mentally retarded children are not very capable of abstract thinking. From this the pedagogy of the special school drew the seemingly correct conclusion that all teaching of such children should be based on the use of concrete, look-and-do methods. And yet a considerable amount of experience with this method resulted in profound disillusionment. It turned out that a teaching system based solely on concreteness—one that eliminated from teaching everything associated with abstract thinking—not only failed to help retarded children overcome their innate handicaps but also reinforced their handicaps by accustoming children exclusively to concrete thinking and thus suppressing the rudiments of any abstract thought that such children still have. Precisely because retarded children, when left to themselves, will never achieve well-elaborated forms of abstract thought, the school should make every effort to push them in that direction and to develop in them what is intrinsically lacking in their own development. In the current practices of special schools for retarded children, we can observe a beneficial shift away from this concept of concreteness, one that restores look-and-do methods to their proper role. Concreteness is now seen as necessary and unavoidable only as a stepping stone for developing abstract thinking—as a means, not as an end in itself.

同样，对于正常儿童来说，以已经达到的发展水平为导向的学习从儿童的全面发展角度来看是无效的。它不以发展过程的新阶段为目标，而是落后于这一过程。因此，最近发展区的概念使我们能够提出一个新的公式，即唯一的“好的学习”是领先于发展的学习。

Similarly, in normal children, learning which is oriented toward developmental levels that have already been reached is ineffective from the viewpoint of a child’s overall development. It does not aim for a new stage of the developmental process but rather lags behind this process. Thus, the notion of a zone of proximal development enables us to propound a new formula, namely that the only “good learning” is that which is in advance of development.

语言习得可以为学习与发展之间关系的整个问题提供一个范例。语言最初是作为儿童与周围人之间交流的一种手段而出现的。只有随后，在转化为内部语言后，它才会组织儿童的思想，即成为一种内部心理功能。皮亚杰和其他人已经表明，推理发生在儿童群体中，目的是论证 在证明自己的观点之前，儿童会将其作为一种内部活动，其显著特点是儿童开始感知和检查自己思想的基础。这些观察促使皮亚杰得出结论，交流产生了检查和确认思想的需要，这一过程是成人思维的特征。7正如 内部言语和反思性思维源于儿童与周围环境中的人之间的互动一样，这些互动为儿童自愿行为的发展提供了源泉。皮亚杰已经表明，合作为儿童道德判断的发展提供了基础。早期的研究表明，儿童首先能够在团体游戏中使自己的行为服从规则，然后才出现自愿的自我行为调节作为一种内部功能。

The acquisition of language can provide a paradigm for the entire problem of the relation between learning and development. Language arises initially as a means of communication between the child and the people in his environment. Only subsequently, upon conversion to internal speech, does it come to organize the child’s thought, that is, become an internal mental function. Piaget and others have shown that reasoning occurs in a children’s group as an argument intended to prove one’s own point of view before it occurs as an internal activity whose distinctive feature is that the child begins to perceive and check the basis of his thoughts. Such observations prompted Piaget to conclude that communication produces the need for checking and confirming thoughts, a process that is characteristic of adult thought.7 In the same way that internal speech and reflective thought arise from the interactions between the child and persons in her environment, these interactions provide the source of development of a child’s voluntary behavior. Piaget has shown that cooperation provides the basis for the development of a child’s moral judgment. Earlier research established that a child first becomes able to subordinate her behavior to rules in group play and only later does voluntary self-regulation of behavior arise as an internal function.

这些个别例子说明了高级心理功能的一般发展规律，我们认为这些规律可以完全应用于儿童的学习过程。我们认为，学习的一个基本特征是它创造了近侧发展区；也就是说，学习唤醒了各种内部发展过程，这些过程只有在儿童与周围环境中的人互动并与同龄人合作时才能发挥作用。一旦这些过程被内化，它们就成为儿童独立发展成就的一部分。

These individual examples illustrate a general developmental law for the higher mental functions that we feel can be applied in its entirety to children’s learning processes. We propose that an essential feature of learning is that it creates the zone of proximal development; that is, learning awakens a variety of internal developmental processes that are able to operate only when the child is interacting with people in his environment and in cooperation with his peers. Once these processes are internalized, they become part of the child’s independent developmental achievement.

从这个角度来看，学习不是发展；然而，适当组织的学习会导致心理发展，并启动一系列发展过程，而这些发展过程只有在学习之外才不可能实现。因此，学习是文化组织的特定人类心理功能发展过程中必不可少且普遍的方面。

From this point of view, learning is not development; however, properly organized learning results in mental development and sets in motion a variety of developmental processes that would be impossible apart from learning. Thus, learning is a necessary and universal aspect of the process of developing culturally organized, specifically human, psychological functions.

总而言之，我们假设的最重要特征是发展过程与学习过程不一致。相反，发展过程落后于学习过程；这种顺序导致了近侧发展区。我们的分析改变了传统观点，即当儿童吸收单词的含义或掌握加法或书面语言等运算时，她的发展过程就基本完成了。事实上，它们在那一刻才刚刚开始。以这种方式分析教育过程的主要结果是表明，最初掌握例如四种算术运算为儿童思维中各种高度复杂的内部过程的后续发展奠定了基础。

To summarize, the most essential feature of our hypothesis is the notion that developmental processes do not coincide with learning processes. Rather, the developmental process lags behind the learning process; this sequence then results in zones of proximal development. Our analysis alters the traditional view that at the moment a child assimilates the meaning of a word, or masters an operation such as addition or written language, her developmental processes are basically completed. In fact, they have only just begun at that moment. The major consequence of analyzing the educational process in this manner is to show that the initial mastery of, for example, the four arithmetic operations provides the basis for the subsequent development of a variety of highly complex internal processes in children’s thinking.

我们的假设确立了学习的统一性，但没有确立学习的同一性 儿童发展分为外在过程和内在发展过程，其前提是前者转化为后者，因此，揭示儿童外部知识和能力如何内化成为心理学研究的重要内容。

Our hypothesis establishes the unity but not the identity of learning processes and internal developmental processes. It presupposes that the one is converted into the other. Therefore, it becomes an important concern of psychological research to show how external knowledge and abilities in children become internalized.

任何调查都会探索现实的某个领域。发展心理分析的一个目的是描述学校学习所激发的智力过程的内部关系。在这方面，这种分析将指向内部，类似于使用 x 射线。如果成功，它应该向教师揭示学校学习课程所激发的发展过程是如何在每个孩子的头脑中进行的。揭示这种内部的、地下的学校学科发展网络是心理和教育分析的首要任务。

Any investigation explores some sphere of reality. An aim of the psychological analysis of development is to describe the internal relations of the intellectual processes awakened by school learning. In this respect, such analysis will be directed inward and is analogous to the use of x-rays. If successful, it should reveal to the teacher how developmental processes stimulated by the course of school learning are carried through inside the head of each individual child. The revelation of this internal, subterranean developmental network of school subjects is a task of primary importance for psychological and educational analysis.

我们的假设的第二个基本特征是，尽管学习与儿童发展过程直接相关，但两者永远不会平等或并行。儿童的发展永远不会像影子跟随投射它的物体那样跟随学校学习。实际上，发展和学习过程之间存在高度复杂的动态关系，无法用一个不变的假设公式来涵盖。

A second essential feature of our hypothesis is the notion that, although learning is directly related to the course of child development, the two are never accomplished in equal measure or in parallel. Development in children never follows school learning the way a shadow follows the object that casts it. In actuality, there are highly complex dynamic relations between developmental and learning processes that cannot be encompassed by an unchanging hypothetical formulation.

每门学科与儿童发展过程都有其特定的关系，这种关系随着儿童从一个阶段到另一个阶段而变化。这直接导致我们重新审视正式纪律的问题，即从整体心理发展的角度审视每门特定学科的意义。显然，这个问题不能用任何一个公式来解决；要解决这个问题，需要基于近侧发展区概念进行广泛而高度多样化的具体研究。

Each school subject has its own specific relation to the course of child development, a relation that varies as the child goes from one stage to another. This leads us directly to a reexamination of the problem of formal discipline, that is, to the significance of each particular subject from the viewpoint of overall mental development. Clearly, the problem cannot be solved by using any one formula; extensive and highly diverse concrete research based on the concept of the zone of proximal development is necessary to resolve the issue.

7

7

游戏在发展中的作用

The Role of Play in Development

将游戏定义为一种给孩子带来快乐的活动是不准确的，原因有二。首先，许多活动给孩子带来的快乐体验比游戏要强烈得多，例如，即使孩子没有感到满足，吸吮奶嘴也会如此。其次，有些游戏活动本身并不令人愉快，例如，主要在学前班末期和学龄初期进行的游戏，只有当孩子觉得结果有趣时，才会给孩子带来快乐。体育游戏（不仅是体育运动，还有其他可以赢或输的游戏）的结果对孩子不利时，孩子往往会感到不快。

To define play as an activity that gives pleasure to the child is inaccurate for two reasons. First, many activities give the child much keener experiences of pleasure than play, for example, sucking a pacifier, even though the child is not being satiated. And second, there are games in which the activity itself is not pleasurable, for example, games, predominantly at the end of preschool and the beginning of school age, that give pleasure only if the child finds the result interesting. Sporting games (not only athletic sports, but other games that can be won or lost) are very often accompanied by displeasure when the outcome is unfavorable to the child.

但是，虽然快乐不能被视为游戏的决定性特征，但在我看来，那些忽视游戏可以满足儿童需求这一事实的理论，会导致游戏的迂腐理性化。在更笼统地谈论儿童发展时，许多理论家错误地忽视了儿童的需求——广义上理解为包括一切行动动机。我们经常将儿童的发展描述为智力功能的发展；每个孩子都站在我们面前，作为一个理论家，他的智力发展水平有高有低，从一个阶段过渡到另一个阶段。但是，如果我们忽视儿童的需求，以及促使他行动的有效激励，我们将永远无法理解他从一个发展阶段过渡到下一个发展阶段的过程，因为每一次进步都与动机、倾向和激励的显著变化有关。婴儿最感兴趣的东西几乎不再引起幼儿的兴趣。需求的成熟是本次讨论的主要问题，因为不可能忽视 事实上，儿童在游戏中满足了某些需求。如果我们不理解这些需求的特殊性，我们就无法理解游戏作为一种活动形式的独特性。

But while pleasure cannot be regarded as the defining characteristic of play, it seems to me that theories which ignore the fact that play fulfills children’s needs result in a pedantic intellectualization of play. In speaking of child development in more general terms, many theorists mistakenly disregard the child’s needs—understood in the broadest sense to include everything that is a motive for action. We often describe a child’s development as the development of his intellectual functions; every child stands before us as a theoretician who, characterized by a higher or lower level of intellectual development, moves from one stage to another. But if we ignore the child’s needs, and the incentives which are effective in getting him to act, we will never be able to understand his advance from one developmental stage to the next, because every advance is connected with a marked change in motives, inclinations, and incentives. That which is of the greatest interest to the infant has almost ceased to interest the toddler. The maturing of needs is a dominant issue in this discussion because it is impossible to ignore the fact that the child satisfies certain needs in play. If we do not understand the special character of these needs, we cannot understand the uniqueness of play as a form of activity.

幼儿倾向于立即满足自己的欲望；通常，欲望与欲望实现之间的间隔非常短。没有人见过三岁以下的孩子想在几天后做某事。然而，在学龄前，会出现许多无法实现的倾向和欲望。我相信，如果在学龄期间没有发展出无法立即实现的需求，就不会有游戏，因为游戏似乎是在孩子开始体验无法实现的倾向时​​发明的。假设一个非常年幼（可能是两岁半）的孩子想要某样东西——例如，扮演母亲的角色。她想立即得到它。如果她得不到它，她可能会发脾气，但通常可以转移注意力并安抚她，让她忘记自己的愿望。在学龄前期，当无法立即满足或忘记的欲望出现，并且保留了前一阶段特有的立即满足欲望的倾向时，儿童的行为就会发生变化。为了解决这种紧张关系，学龄前儿童进入了一个虚构的、虚幻的世界，在这个世界中，无法实现的欲望可以实现，这个世界就是我们所说的游戏。想象力对儿童来说是一种新的心理过程；它不存在于幼儿的意识中，在动物中完全不存在，它代表了一种特定的人类意识活动形式。像所有意识功能一样，它最初源于行动。古老的格言说，儿童的游戏是行动中的想象力，现在必须颠倒过来：我们可以说，青少年和学童的想象力是没有行动的游戏。

A very young child tends to gratify her desires immediately; normally the interval between a desire and its fulfillment is extremely short. No one has met a child under three years old who wants to do something a few days in the future. However, at the preschool age, a great many unrealizable tendencies and desires emerge. It is my belief that if needs that could not be realized immediately did not develop during the school years, there would be no play, because play seems to be invented at the point when the child begins to experience unrealizable tendencies. Suppose that a very young (perhaps two-and-a-half-year-old) child wants something—for example, to occupy her mother’s role. She wants it at once. If she cannot have it, she may throw a temper tantrum, but she can usually be sidetracked and pacified so that she forgets her desire. Toward the beginning of preschool age, when desires that cannot be immediately gratified or forgotten make their appearance and the tendency to immediate fulfillment of desires, characteristic of the preceding stage, is retained, the child’s behavior changes. To resolve this tension, the preschool child enters an imaginary, illusory world in which the unrealizable desires can be realized, and this world is what we call play. Imagination is a new psychological process for the child; it is not present in the consciousness of the very young child, is totally absent in animals, and represents a specifically human form of conscious activity. Like all functions of consciousness, it originally arises from action. The old adage that child’s play is imagination in action must be reversed: we can say that imagination in adolescents and school children is play without action.

从这个角度来看，很明显，学龄前儿童玩耍的乐趣是由不同的动机控制的，而不是简单地吮吸奶嘴。这并不是说玩耍是每个未满足的愿望的结果（例如，当孩子想坐出租车，但愿望没有立即得到满足时，孩子就会走进她的房间假装她正在乘坐出租车）。这种情况很少发生。玩耍中存在这种普遍的情感也并不意味着孩子自己理解引起游戏的动机。在这方面，游戏与工作和其他形式的活动有很大不同。

From this perspective it is clear that the pleasure derived from preschool play is controlled by different motives than simple sucking on a pacifier. This is not to say that play arises as the result of every unsatisfied desire (as when, for example, the child wants to ride in the cab, but the wish is not immediately gratified, so the child goes into her room and pretends she is riding in a cab). It rarely happens in just this way. Nor does the presence of such generalized emotions in play mean that the child herself understands the motives giving rise to the game. In this respect play differs substantially from work and other forms of activity.

因此，在建立区分儿童游戏与其他形式活动的标准时，我们得出结论，儿童在游戏中创造了一种想象的情境。这并不是一个新想法，因为想象的情境 游戏中的情境一直受到重视；但以前它们仅被视为游戏活动的一个示例。想象的情境并不被认为是一般游戏的定义特征，而是被视为特定游戏子类别的属性。

Thus, in establishing criteria for distinguishing a child’s play from other forms of activity, we conclude that in play a child creates an imaginary situation. This is not a new idea, in the sense that imaginary situations in play have always been recognized; but they were previously regarded as only one example of play activities. The imaginary situation was not considered the defining characteristic of play in general but was treated as an attribute of specific subcategories of play.

我认为以前的观点在三个方面不能令人满意。首先，如果把游戏理解为象征性的，那么游戏就有可能被视为一种类似于代数的活动；也就是说，游戏和代数一样，可能被认为是一种概括现实的符号系统，没有我认为游戏所特有的特征。孩子会被视为一个不成功的代数学家，他还不能写出符号，但能用行动来描绘它们。我相信游戏不是真正意义上的象征性活动，因此，展示动机在游戏中的作用至关重要。其次，这种强调认知过程重要性的论点不仅忽视了儿童活动的动机，也忽视了儿童活动的环境。第三，以前的方法无助于我们理解游戏在以后的发展中的作用。

I find previous ideas unsatisfactory in three respects. First, if play is understood as symbolic, there is the danger that it might come to be viewed as an activity akin to algebra; that is, play, like algebra, might be considered a system of signs that generalize reality, with no characteristics that I consider specific to play. The child would be seen as an unsuccessful algebraist who cannot yet write the symbols but can depict them in action. I believe that play is not symbolic action in the proper sense of the term, so it becomes essential to show the role of motivation in play. Second, this argument stressing the importance of cognitive processes neglects not only the motivation for, but also the circumstances of, the child’s activity. And third, previous approaches do not help us to understand the role of play in later development.

如果一切游戏实际上都是以游戏形式实现那些无法立即满足的倾向，那么想象情境的元素就会自动成为游戏本身的情感基调的一部分。考虑一下儿童在游戏中的活动。儿童在想象情境中的行为意味着什么？我们知道，玩有规则的游戏的发展始于学龄前晚期，并在学龄期发展。许多研究者虽然不属于辩证唯物主义阵营，但他们按照马克思所建议的思路来探讨这个问题，马克思说：“人的结构是猿猴结构的关键。”他们开始根据后来的基于规则的游戏来考察早期游戏，并由此得出结论：涉及想象情境的游戏实际上就是基于规则的游戏。

If all play is really the realization in play form of tendencies that cannot be immediately gratified, then elements of imaginary situations will automatically be a part of the emotional tone of play itself. Consider the child’s activity during play. What does a child’s behavior in- an imaginary situation mean? We know that the development of playing games with rules begins in the late preschool period and develops during school age. A number of investigators, although not belonging to the camp of dialectical materialists, have approached this issue along the lines recommended by Marx when he said that “the anatomy of man is the key to the anatomy of the ape.” They have begun their examination of early play in the light of later rule-based play and have concluded from this that play involving an imaginary situation is, in fact, rule-based play.

我们可以更进一步提出，没有规则的游戏是不存在的。任何形式的游戏的想象情境都已经包含了行为规则，尽管它可能不是事先制定好规则的游戏。孩子把自己想象成母亲，而洋娃娃则是孩子，所以他必须遵守母亲行为的规则。苏利很早就注意到，年幼的孩子能够将游戏情境与现实相一致，这真是令人惊讶。1他 描述了一个案例，两个姐妹，一个五岁，一个七岁，对彼此说：“我们来玩姐妹吧。”她们在玩现实游戏。在某些情况下，我发现很容易在孩子身上引发这样的游戏。例如，很容易让孩子扮演孩子的角色，而母亲则扮演母亲的角色，也就是说，扮演真实的东西。 正如苏利所描述的，孩子在玩耍时试图成为她认为的姐妹应该成为的样子。在生活中，孩子的行为不会想到她是姐姐的姐妹。然而，在姐妹们扮演“姐妹”的游戏中，她们都关心展示姐妹情谊；两个姐妹决定扮演姐妹这一事实促使她们都获得了行为规则。只有符合这些规则的行为才是游戏情境所接受的：她们穿着相似，说话相似，简而言之，她们做出任何强调她们作为姐妹与成年人和陌生人的关系的行为。姐姐牵着妹妹的手，可能会不停地告诉她关于其他人的事：“那是他们的，不是我们的。”这意味着：“我和姐姐的行为相同，我们受到的待遇相同，但其他人受到的待遇不同。”在这个例子中，强调的是与孩子对姐妹的概念相关的一切事物的相同性；通过玩耍，孩子开始明白姐妹彼此之间的关系与与其他人的关系不同。孩子在现实生活中没有注意到的事情，在游戏中却成为了行为规则。

One could go even further and propose that there is no such thing as play without rules. The imaginary situation of any form of play already contains rules of behavior, although it may not be a game with formulated rules laid down in advance. The child imagines himself to be the mother and the doll to be the child, so he must obey the rules of maternal behavior. Sully early noted that, remarkably, young children could make the play situation and reality coincide.1 He described a case where two sisters, aged five and seven, said to each other, “Let’s play sisters.” They were playing at reality. In certain cases, I have found it easy to elicit such play in children. It is very easy, for example, to have a child play at being a child while the mother is playing the role of mother, that is, playing at what is actually true. The vital difference, as Sully describes it, is that the child in playing tries to be what she thinks a sister should be. In life the child behaves without thinking that she is her sister’s sister. In the game of sisters playing at “sisters,” however, they are both concerned with displaying their sisterhood; the fact that two sisters decided to play sisters induces them both to acquire rules of behavior. Only actions that fit these rules are acceptable to the play situation: they dress alike, talk alike, in short, they enact whatever emphasizes their relationship as sisters vis-à-vis adults and strangers. The elder, holding the younger by the hand, may keep telling her about other people: “That is theirs, not ours.” This means: “My sister and I act the same, we are treated the same, but others are treated differently.” In this example the emphasis is on the sameness of everything that is connected with the child’s concept of a sister; as a result of playing, the child comes to understand that sisters possess a different relationship to each other than to other people. What passes unnoticed by the child in real life becomes a rule of behavior in play.

如果游戏的结构中没有想象中的情境，那么会剩下什么呢？规则会保留下来。只要游戏中有想象中的情境，就会有规则——不是事先制定并在游戏过程中发生变化的规则，而是源于想象中的情境的规则。因此，认为孩子可以在没有规则的情况下在想象的情境中行动的想法是不准确的。如果孩子扮演母亲的角色，那么她就有母性行为的规则。孩子所扮演的角色以及她与对象的关系（如果对象的含义发生了变化）将始终源于规则。

What would remain if play were structured in such a way that there were no imaginary situation? The rules would remain. Whenever there is an imaginary situation in play, there are rules—not rules that are formulated in advance and change during the course of the game but ones that stem from an imaginary situation. Therefore, the notion that a child can behave in an imaginary situation without rules is simply inaccurate. If the child is playing the role of a mother, then she has rules of maternal behavior. The role the child fulfills, and her relation to the object (if the object has changed its meaning), will always stem from the rules.

起初，研究者在分析游戏时的唯一任务似乎是揭示所有游戏中隐藏的规则，但事实已经证明，所谓的纯规则游戏本质上是具有假想情境的游戏。正如假想情境必须包含行为规则一样，每个有规则的游戏都包含一个假想情境。例如，下棋会产生一个假想情境。为什么？因为骑士、国王、王后等只能以特定的方式移动；因为掩护和吃掉棋子是纯粹的国际象棋概念。虽然在国际象棋游戏中没有直接替代现实生活关系的东西，但它仍然是一种假想情境。最简单的有规则的游戏立即变成了一种假想情境，因为一旦游戏受到某些规则的约束，许多行动的可能性就会被排除在外。

At first it seemed that the investigator’s only task in analyzing play was to disclose the hidden rules in all play, but it has been demonstrated that the so-called pure games with rules are essentially games with imaginary situations. Just as the imaginary situation has to contain rules of behavior, so every game with rules contains an imaginary situation. For example, playing chess creates an imaginary situation. Why? Because the knight, king, queen, and so forth can only move in specified ways; because covering and taking pieces are purely chess concepts. Although in the chess game there is no direct substitute for real-life relationships, it is a kind of imaginary situation nevertheless. The simplest game with rules immediately turns into an imaginary situation in the sense that as soon as the game is regulated by certain rules, a number of possibilities for action are ruled out.

正如我们在开始时能够证明的那样，每一个想象的情况都包含着隐藏形式的规则，我们也证明了 相反，所有有规则的游戏都包含着一种隐蔽形式的想象情境。从具有显性想象情境和隐性规则的游戏到具有显性规则和隐性想象情境的游戏的发展概述了儿童游戏的演变。

Just as we were able to show at the beginning that every imaginary situation contains rules in a concealed form, we have also demonstrated the reverse—that every game with rules contains an imaginary situation in a concealed form. The development from games with an overt imaginary situation and covert rules to games with overt rules and a covert imaginary situation outlines the evolution of children’s play.

游戏中的动作和意义

ACTION AND MEANING IN PLAY

游戏对儿童发展的影响是巨大的。对于三岁以下的儿童来说，在想象的情境中游戏基本上是不可能的，因为这是一种将儿童从限制中解放出来的新行为形式。正如列文等人的实验所表明的那样，在相当大的程度上，幼儿的行为——在绝对程度上，婴儿的行为——是由活动发生的条件决定的。2例如 ，列文证明了一个小孩很难意识到他必须先背对着石头才能坐在上面，这说明了幼儿在每一个动作中都受到情境限制的程度。列文的实验表明情境对活动的限制，我们很难想象还有比我们在游戏中观察到的更大的反差。正是在这里，孩子学会在认知领域而不是外部视觉领域行动，依靠的是内在的倾向和动机，而不是外部事物提供的激励。列文 (Lewin) 曾研究过事物对幼儿的激励性质，他得出的结论是，事物 决定了孩子必须做什么：门需要打开和关闭，楼梯需要爬，铃需要响。简而言之，事物对幼儿的行为具有如此内在的激励力，并且如此广泛地决定了孩子的行为，以至于列文 (Lewin) 想到了创建心理拓扑的概念：他根据具有不同吸引力或排斥力的事物的分布，用数学的方式表达了孩子在场中的运动轨迹。

The influence of play on a child’s development is enormous. Play in an imaginary situation is essentially impossible for a child under three in that it is a novel form of behavior liberating the child from constraints. To a considerable extent the behavior of a very young child—and to an absolute extent, that of an infant—is determined by the conditions in which the activity takes place, as the experiments of Lewin and others have shown.2 For example, Lewin’s demonstration of the great difficulty a small child has in realizing that he must first turn his back to a stone in order to sit on it illustrates the extent to which a very young child is bound in every action by situational constraints. It is hard to imagine a greater contrast to Lewin’s experiments showing the situational constraints on activity than what we observe in play. It is here that the child learns to act in a cognitive, rather than an externally visual, realm by relying on internal tendencies and motives and not on incentives supplied by external things. A study by Lewin on the motivating nature of things for a very young child concludes that things dictate to the child what he must do: a door demands to be opened and closed, a staircase to be climbed, a bell to be rung. In short, things have such an inherent motivating force with respect to a very young child’s actions and so extensively determine the child’s behavior that Lewin arrived at the notion of creating a psychological topology: he expressed mathematically the trajectory of the child’s movement in a field according to the distribution of things with varying attracting or repelling forces.

情境对儿童的限制根源于幼儿意识的一个核心特征：动机和感知的结合。在这个年龄，感知通常不是一个独立的运动反应，而是一个综合特征。每一种感知都是活动的刺激。由于情境是通过感知在心理上传达的，而且感知与动机和运动活动是分不开的，因此可以理解，在意识如此结构化的情况下，儿童会受到自己所处情境的限制。

The root of situational constraints upon a child lies in a central fact of consciousness characteristic of early childhood: the union of motives and perception. At this age perception is generally not an independent but rather an integrated feature of a motor reaction. Every perception is a stimulus to activity. Since a situation is communicated psychologically through perception, and since perception is not separated from motivational and motor activity, it is understandable that with her consciousness so structured, the child is constrained by the situation in which she finds herself.

但在玩耍中，事物失去了决定性的力量。孩子看到一个 孩子会看事物，但会根据所见做出不同的行为。因此，孩子开始独立于所见做出行为 。某些脑损伤患者会失去独立于所见行为的能力。考虑这些患者，我们可以理解，成人和更成熟的孩子享有的行动自由不是一蹴而就的，而是需要经过一个漫长的发展过程。

But in play, things lose their determining force. The child sees one thing but acts differently in relation to what he sees. Thus, a condition is reached in which the child begins to act independently of what he sees . Certain brain-damaged patients lose the ability to act independently of what they see. In considering such patients one can appreciate that the freedom of action adults and more mature children enjoy is not acquired in a flash but has to go through a long process of development.

在想象的情境中行动，不仅教会孩子通过对物体的直接感知或直接影响她的情境来指导自己的行为，而且还教会孩子通过这种情境的意义来指导自己的行为。实验和日常观察清楚地表明，非常年幼的孩子不可能将意义领域与视觉领域分开， 因为意义和所见事物之间存在着如此紧密的融合。即使是一个两岁的孩子，当被要求重复“塔尼娅站起来了”这句话时，而塔尼娅正坐在她面前，她也会把这句话改成“塔尼娅坐下了”。在某些疾病中，也会遇到完全相同的情况。戈尔茨坦和盖尔布描述了一些无法说出不真实事情的患者。3盖尔布有关于一名左撇子患者的数据，他无法写出“我可以 用右手写得很好”这句话。在晴朗的日子里，当他向窗外望去时，他无法重复“今天天气很糟糕”，但会说“天气很好”。我们经常发现，患有语言障碍的患者无法重复无意义的短语，例如“雪是黑色的”，而其他语法和语义结构同样困难的短语却可以重复。这种感知和意义之间的联系可以在儿童语言发展过程中看到。你对孩子说“时钟”，他就会开始寻找时钟。这个词最初表示特定的空间位置。

Action in an imaginary situation teaches the child to guide her behavior not only by immediate perception of objects or by the situation immediately affecting her but also by the meaning of this situation. Experiments and day-to-day observation clearly show that it is impossible for very young children to separate the field of meaning from the visual field because there is such intimate fusion between meaning and what is seen. Even a child of two years, when asked to repeat the sentence “Tanya is standing up” when Tanya is sitting in front of her, will change it to “Tanya is sitting down.” In certain diseases, exactly the same situation is encountered. Goldstein and Gelb described a number of patients who were unable to state something that was not true.3 Gelb has data on one patient who was left-handed and incapable of writing the sentence “I can write well with my right hand.” When looking out of the window on a fine day he was unable to repeat “The weather is nasty today,” but would say “The weather is fine.” Often we find that a patient with a speech disturbance is incapable of repeating senseless phrases, for example, “Snow is black,” while other phrases equally difficult in their grammatical and semantic construction can be repeated. This tie between perception and meaning can be seen in the process of children’s speech development. You say to the child, “clock,” and he starts looking for the clock. The word originally signifies a particular spatial location.

意义领域和视觉领域的分歧首先发生在学龄前。在游戏中，思维与物体分离，行动源于想法而不是事物：一块木头开始变成一个娃娃，一根棍子变成一匹马。按照规则的行动开始由想法而不是物体本身决定。这是儿童与现实、直接、具体情况关系的彻底逆转，很难低估其全部意义。儿童不会一下子做到这一点，因为儿童很难将思想（一个词的意义）与物体分开。

A divergence between the fields of meaning and vision first occurs at preschool age. In play thought is separated from objects and action arises from ideas rather than from things: a piece of wood begins to be a doll and a stick becomes a horse. Action according to rules begins to be determined by ideas and not by objects themselves. This is such a reversal of the child’s relation to the real, immediate, concrete situation that it is hard to underestimate its full significance. The child does not do this all at once because it is terribly difficult for a child to sever thought (the meaning of a word) from object.

每当一个物体（例如一根棍子）成为将马的含义与真正的马区分开来的关键点时，游戏就为这个方向提供了一个过渡阶段。孩子还不能将思想与物体分开。孩子的弱点是，为了想象一匹马，他需要通过使用“棍子上的马”作为关键点来定义自己的行为。但同样，决定孩子与现实关系的基本结构在这个关键点发生了根本性的变化，因为他的感知结构发生了变化。

Play provides a transitional stage in this direction whenever an object (for example, a stick) becomes a pivot for severing the meaning of horse from a real horse. The child cannot as yet detach thought from object. The child’s weakness is that in order to imagine a horse, he needs to define his action by means of using “the-horse-in-the-stick” as the pivot. But all the same, the basic structure determining the child’s relation to reality is radically changed at this crucial point, because the structure of his perceptions changes.

正如我在前面几章中讨论过的，人类感知的一个特殊特征（在很早的时候就出现了）是所谓的真实物体感知，即不仅对颜色和形状的感知，而且对意义的感知。这是动物感知无法比拟的。人类不仅能看到带有两个指针的圆形和黑色物体；他们还能看到时钟，并能区分一个事物和另一个事物。因此，人类感知的结构可以形象地表示为一个比率，其中物体是分子，意义是分母（物体/意义）。这个比率象征着这样一种观点，即所有人类感知都是由普遍的而不是孤立的感知组成的。对于孩子来说，物体在物体/意义比率中占主导地位，意义从属于它。在关键时刻，当一根棍子成为将马的意义与真马分离的关键时，这个比率被颠倒过来，意义占主导地位，赋予意义/物体。

As I discussed in earlier chapters, a special feature of human perception (one arising at a very early age) is the so-called perception of real objects, that is, the perception of not only colors and shapes, but also meaning. This is something to which there is no analogy in animal perception. Humans do not merely see something round and black with two hands; they see a clock and can distinguish one thing from another. Thus, the structure of human perception could be figuratively expressed as a ratio in which the object is the numerator and the meaning is the denominator (object/meaning). This ratio symbolizes the idea that all human perception is made up of generalized rather than isolated perceptions. For the child the object dominates in the object/meaning ratio and meaning is subordinated to it. At the crucial moment when a stick becomes the pivot for detaching the meaning of horse from a real horse, this ratio is inverted and meaning predominates, giving meaning/object.

这并不是说事物本身的属性没有意义。任何棍子都可以是一匹马，但例如，明信片对于孩子来说不能是一匹马。歌德认为在游戏中，任何东西对于孩子来说都可以是任何东西，这是不正确的。当然，对于能够有意识地使用符号的成年人来说，明信片可以 是一匹马。如果我想显示某物的位置，我可以放下一根火柴说：“这是一匹马。”这就足够了。对于孩子来说，它不能是一匹马，因为必须使用棍子；由于缺乏自由替代，孩子的活动是游戏而不是象征。符号是一种符号，但对于孩子来说，棍子不能起到马的符号的作用，孩子保留了事物的属性，但改变了它们的含义。在游戏中，它们的含义成为中心点，物体从主导地位移到了从属地位。

This is not to say that properties of things as such have no meaning. Any stick can be a horse but, for example, a postcard cannot be a horse for a child. Goethe’s contention that in play any thing can be anything for a child is incorrect. Of course, for adults who can make conscious use of symbols, a postcard can be a horse. If I want to show the location of something, I can put down a match and say, “This is a horse.” That would be enough. For a child it cannot be a horse because one must use a stick; because of the lack of free substitution, the child’s activity is play and not symbolism. A symbol is a sign, but the stick does not function as the sign of a horse for the child, who retains the properties of things but changes their meaning. Their meaning, in play, becomes the central point and objects are moved from a dominant to a subordinate position.

儿童在玩耍时，其意义与其通常的物体和行为无关；然而，当他将真实的行为和真实的物体融合在一起时，就会出现一个非常有趣的矛盾。这体现了游戏的过渡性；它是幼儿期纯粹的情境约束与成人思维之间的一个阶段，可以完全摆脱现实情境。

The child at play operates with meanings detached from their usual objects and actions; however, a highly interesting contradiction arises in which he fuses real actions and real objects. This characterizes the transitional nature of play; it is a stage between the purely situational constraints of early childhood and adult thought, which can be totally free of real situations.

当棍子成为将“马”的意义从真实的马中分离出来的支点时，孩子就让一个物体在语义上影响另一个物体。他无法将意义从一个物体中分离出来，也无法将一个词从一个 孩子接受单词作为事物的属性，除非在其他事物中找到支点。意义的转移得益于孩子接受单词作为事物的属性；他看到的不是单词，而是单词所指的事物。对于孩子来说，将单词“horse”应用于棍子意味着“有一匹马”，因为他在心理上看到单词后面的物体。当孩子第一次像对待物体一样对待意义时（例如当他把棍子当作马一样对待它时），就会发生一个重要的过渡阶段。后来，他有意识地执行这些行为。这种变化也体现在这样一个事实中：在孩子掌握语法和书面语言之前，他知道如何做事，但不知道自己知道。他不是自愿掌握这些活动的。在游戏中，孩子会自发地利用自己将意义与物体区分开的能力，而不知道自己在做什么，就像他不知道自己在用散文说话，但说话时不注意单词一样。因此，通过玩耍，孩子可以实现概念或物体的功能性定义，而单词则成为事物的一部分。

When the stick becomes the pivot for detaching the meaning of “horse” from a real horse, the child makes one object influence another semantically. He cannot detach meaning from an object, or a word from an object, except by finding a pivot in something else. Transfer of meanings is facilitated by the fact that the child accepts a word as the property of a thing; he sees not the word but the thing it designates. For a child, the word “horse” applied to the stick means “there is a horse,” because mentally he sees the object standing behind the word. A vital transitional stage toward operating with meanings occurs when a child first acts with meanings as with objects (as when he acts with the stick as though it were a horse). Later he carries out these acts consciously. This change is seen, too, in the fact that before a child has acquired grammatical and written language, he knows how to do things but does not know that he knows. He does not master these activities voluntarily. In play a child spontaneously makes use of his ability to separate meaning from an object without knowing he is doing it, just as he does not know he is speaking in prose but talks without paying attention to the words. Thus, through play the child achieves a functional definition of concepts or objects, and words become parts of a thing.

创造一个想象中的情境并不是孩子生活中的偶然事件，而是孩子从情境限制中解放出来的第一种表现。游戏的主要悖论是，孩子在现实情境中以一种异化的意义进行游戏。第二个悖论是，在游戏中，她会采取阻力最小的路线——她做她最想做的事情，因为游戏与快乐有关——同时，她学会遵循阻力最大的路线，服从规则，从而放弃她想要的东西，因为服从规则和放弃冲动行为是游戏中获得最大快乐的途径。

The creation of an imaginary situation is not a fortuitous fact in a child’s life, but is rather the first manifestation of the child’s emancipation from situational constraints. The primary paradox of play is that the child operates with an alienated meaning in a real situation. The second paradox is that in play she adopts the line of least resistance—she does what she most feels like doing because play is connected with pleasure—and at the same time she learns to follow the line of greatest resistance by subordinating herself to rules and thereby renouncing what she wants, since subjection to rules and renunciation of impulsive action constitute the path to maximum pleasure in play.

游戏不断要求孩子违背即时冲动行事。孩子每走一步都面临着游戏规则与他突然自发行动时会做的事情之间的冲突。在游戏中，他的行为与他想要的行为方式相反。孩子最大的自我控制发生在游戏中。当他放弃游戏中的即时吸引力时（例如糖果，根据游戏规则，他被禁止吃糖果，因为它代表着不可食用的东西），他的意志力得到了最大程度的展现。通常，孩子在放弃他想要的东西时会体验到服从规则，但在这里，服从规则和放弃即时冲动的行动是获得最大快乐的手段。

Play continually creates demands on the child to act against immediate impulse. At every step the child is faced with a conflict between the rules of the game and what he would do if he could suddenly act spontaneously. In the game he acts counter to the way he wants to act. A child’s greatest self-control occurs in play. He achieves the maximum display of willpower when he renounces an immediate attraction in the game (such as candy, which by the rules of the game he is forbidden to eat because it represents something inedible). Ordinarily a child experiences subordination to rules in the renunciation of something he wants, but here subordination to a rule and renunciation of action on immediate impulse are the means to maximum pleasure.

因此，游戏的本质属性是规则变成了欲望。斯宾诺莎所说的“观念变成了欲望，概念变成了激情”的原型就是游戏，游戏是自发性和自由的领域。规则的执行是游戏的源泉。 快乐的规则。规则之所以获胜，是因为它是最强烈的冲动。这样的规则是一种内在的规则，一种自我约束和自我决定的规则，正如皮亚杰所说，而不是儿童像物理定律那样遵守的规则。简而言之，游戏给孩子一种新的欲望形式 。它通过将她的欲望与虚构的“我”、她在游戏中的角色及其规则联系起来，教会她欲望。这样，孩子最大的成就就可能在游戏中实现，这些成就明天将成为她实际行动和道德的基本水平。

Thus, the essential attribute of play is a rule that has become a desire. Spinoza’s notions of “an idea which has become a desire, a concept which has turned into a passion” finds its prototype in play, which is the realm of spontaneity and freedom. To carry out the rule is a source of pleasure. The rule wins because it is the strongest impulse. Such a rule is an internal rule, a rule of self-restraint and self-determination, as Piaget says, and not a rule the child obeys like a physical law. In short, play gives a child a new form of desires . It teaches her to desire by relating her desires to a fictitious “I,” to her role in the game and its rules. In this way a child’s greatest achievements are possible in play, achievements that tomorrow will become her basic level of real action and morality.

分离行动和意义

SEPARATING ACTION AND MEANING

现在我们可以对孩子的活动说同样的话

Now we can say the same thing about the child’s activity that we

关于物体的说法。正如我们有比率一样 ，我们也有 比率。而在发展早期，动作占主导地位，这意味着这种结构是颠倒的；意义成为分子，而动作取代了分母。

said about objects. Just as we had the ratio, we also have the ratio. Whereas action dominates early in development, meaning this structure is inverted; meaning becomes the numerator, while action takes the place of the denominator.

对于学龄前儿童来说，行动最初比意义占主导地位，而且意义尚未完全被理解。儿童能够做的比他能理解的要多。但正是在这个年龄，一种行动结构才开始出现，其中意义是决定因素，尽管意义必须在行动结构特征所提供的约束范围内影响儿童的行为。儿童在玩从盘子里吃东西的游戏时，已经显示出用手做出让人联想到真正吃东西的动作，而所有不表示吃东西的动作都是不可能的。把手向后甩而不是伸向盘子是不可能的，因为这样的动作会对游戏产生破坏性的影响。儿童在游戏中的行为并不是纯粹的象征性方式；相反，他希望并实现他的愿望，方法是让现实的基本范畴贯穿他的经历。儿童在希望时实现了他的愿望。在思考时，他行动。内部和外部行动是不可分割的：想象、解释和意志是外部行动所携带的内部过程。所谓将意义从物体中分离出来的说法同样适用于孩子自己的行为。一个孩子跺着脚，想象自己骑着马，因此将比率颠倒 为 。

In a child of preschool age, action is initially dominant over meaning and is incompletely understood. The child is able to do more than he can understand. But it is at this age that an action structure first arises in which meaning is the determinant, although meaning must influence the child’s behavior within constraints provided by structural features of the action. Children, in playing at eating from a plate, have been shown to perform actions with their hands reminiscent of real eating, while all actions that did not designate eating were impossible. Throwing one’s hands back instead of stretching them toward the plate turned out to be impossible, for such an action would have a destructive effect on the game. A child does not behave in a purely symbolic fashion in play; rather he wishes and realizes his wishes by letting the basic categories of reality pass through his experience. The child, in wishing, carries out his wishes. In thinking, he acts. Internal and external action are inseparable: imagination, interpretation, and will are the internal processes carried by external action. What was said about detaching meaning from objects applies equally well to the child’s own actions. A child who stamps on the ground and imagines herself riding a horse has thereby inverted the ratio to .

意义与行动关系的发展史类似于意义/对象关系的发展史。为了将行动的意义与实际行动（骑马，但没有机会）区分开来，儿童需要 以动作形式出现的支点取代了真实的支点。虽然动作一开始是结构的分子 ，但现在结构被颠倒了，意义成为分子。动作退居第二位并成为支点；意义再次通过不同的动作与动作分离。这是人类行为依赖于基于意义的操作的另一个例子，其中引发行为的动机与满足感截然不同。然而，将意义与对象和动作分离会产生不同的后果。正如操作事物的意义会导致抽象思维一样，我们发现，当儿童操作动作 的意义时，意志的发展，即做出有意识选择的能力就会发生 。在游戏中，一个动作取代另一个动作，就像一个物体取代另一个物体一样。

The developmental history of the relation between meaning and action is analogous to the development history of the meaning/object relation. In order to detach the meaning of the action from the real action (riding a horse, without the opportunity to do so), the child requires a pivot in the form of an action to replace the real one. While action begins as the numerator of the structure, now the structure is inverted and meaning becomes the numerator. Action retreats to second place and becomes the pivot; meaning is again detached from action by means of a different action. This is another example of the way in which human behavior comes to depend upon operations based on meanings where the motive that initiates the behavior is sharply separated from fulfillment. The separation of meaning from objects and action has different consequences, however. Just as operating with the meaning of things leads to abstract thought, we find that the development of will, the ability to make conscious choices, occurs when the child operates with the meaning of actions . In play, an action replaces another action just as an object replaces another object.

儿童如何从一个物体移动到另一个物体，从一个动作移动到另一个动作？这是通过意义场中的运动来实现的——意义场将所有现实物体和动作都置于其自身之下。行为不受直接感知场的约束。意义场中的这种运动在游戏中占主导地位。一方面，它代表抽象场中的运动（因此，抽象场在游戏中先于有意义的自愿操作出现）。另一方面，运动的方法是情境化的和具体的。（这是一种情感变化，而不是逻辑变化）。换句话说，意义场出现了，但其中的动作就像在现实中一样发生。这就是游戏的主要发展矛盾。

How does the child float from one object to another, from one action to another? This is accomplished by movement in the field of meaning—which subordinates all real objects and actions to itself. Behavior is not bound by the immediate perceptual field. This movement in the field of meaning predominates in play. On the one hand, it represents movement in an abstract field (which thus makes an appearance in play prior to the appearance of voluntary operation with meanings). On the other hand, the method of movement is situational and concrete. (It is an affective, not a logical change). In other words, the field of meaning appears, but action within it occurs just as in reality. Herein lies the main developmental contradiction of play.

结论

CONCLUSION

在结束关于游戏的讨论之前，我想首先指出，游戏不是童年的主要特征，但它是发展的主要因素。其次，我想说明游戏本身的发展中从想象情境占主导地位转变为规则占主导地位的重要意义。第三，我想指出游戏给儿童发展带来的内在转变。

I would like to close this discussion of play by first showing that play is not the predominant feature of childhood but it is a leading factor in development. Second, I want to demonstrate the significance of the change from predominance of the imaginary situation to predominance of rules in the development of play itself. And third, I want to point out internal transformations in the child’s development brought about by play.

游戏与发展有何关系？ 在基本的日常情况下，孩子的行为与游戏行为相反。在游戏中，行动服从于意义，但在现实生活中，行动当然主导意义。因此，将游戏视为儿童日常活动的原型及其主要形式是完全错误的。

How does play relate to development? In fundamental, everyday situations a child’s behavior is the opposite of his behavior in play. In play, action is subordinated to meaning, but in real life, of course, action dominates meaning. Therefore, to consider play as the prototype of a child’s everyday activity and its predominant form is completely incorrect.

这是考夫卡理论的主要缺陷。他认为游戏是孩子的另一个世界。4与孩子有关的一切都是游戏现实，而 与成人有关的一切都是严肃的现实。给定的对象在游戏中具有一种意义，在游戏之外具有另一种意义。在孩子的世界中，愿望和满足冲动的逻辑占主导地位，而不是现实逻辑。游戏的虚幻性质转移到了生活中。如果游戏确实是儿童活动的主要形式，那么这一切都是真的。但是，如果我们所说的活动形式成为儿童日常活动的主要形式，即使只是部分转移到现实生活中，也很难接受脑海中浮现的疯狂画面。

This is the main flaw in Koffka’s theory. He considers play as the child’s other world.4 Everything that concerns a child is play reality, while everything that concerns an adult is serious reality. A given object has one meaning in play and another outside of it. In a child’s world the logic of wishes and of satisfying urges dominates, and not real logic. The illusory nature of play is transferred to life. This would all be true if play were indeed the predominant form of a child’s activity. But it is difficult to accept the insane picture that comes to mind if the form of activity we have been speaking of were to become the predominant form of a child’s everyday activity, even if only partially transferred to real life.

科夫卡举了许多例子来说明儿童如何将游戏情境转移到生活中。但是，游戏行为普遍转移到现实生活中只能被视为一种不健康的症状。在现实情境中表现得像在虚幻情境中一样是精神错乱的第一个迹象。现实生活中的游戏行为通常只出现在游戏类型中，即儿童开始玩他们实际上正在做的事情，显然会产生有助于执行不愉快行为的联想（例如，当不想睡觉的孩子说“让我们玩吧，现在是晚上，我们必须去睡觉”时）。因此，在我看来，游戏并不是学龄前的主要活动类型。只有那些认为儿童不必满足生活的基本要求，但可以为了寻求快乐而生活的理论才可能表明儿童的世界是一个游戏世界。

Koffka gives a number of examples to show how a child transfers a situation from play into life. But the ubiquitous transference of play behavior to real life could only be regarded as an unhealthy symptom. To behave in a real situation as in an illusory one is the first sign of delirium. Play behavior in real life is normally seen only in the type of game when children begin to play at what they are in fact doing, evidently creating associations that facilitate the execution of an unpleasant action (as when children who do not want to go to bed say, “Let’s play that it’s nighttime and we have to go to sleep”). Thus, it seems to me that play is not the predominant type of activity at preschool age. Only theories which maintain that a child does not have to satisfy the basic requirements of life but can live in search of pleasure could possibly suggest that a child’s world is a play world.

从相反的角度看，我们是否可以认为孩子的行为总是受意义的引导，而学龄前儿童的行为却如此枯燥，以至于他从来不会自发地行动，仅仅因为他认为自己应该以其他方式行动？这种严格遵守规则在生活中是完全不可能的，但在游戏中却有可能：因此，游戏为孩子创造了一个近端发展区。在游戏中，孩子的行为总是超出他的平均年龄，超出他的日常行为；在游戏中，他好像比自己高出一个头。就像放大镜的焦点一样，游戏以浓缩的形式包含了所有发展趋势，它本身就是发展的主要来源。

Looking at the matter from the opposite perspective, could one suppose that a child’s behavior is always guided by meaning, that a preschooler’s behavior is so arid that he never behaves spontaneously simply because he thinks he should behave otherwise? This strict subordination to rules is quite impossible in life, but in play it does become possible: thus, play creates a zone of proximal development of the child. In play a child always behaves beyond his average age, above his daily behavior; in play it is as though he were a head taller than himself. As in the focus of a magnifying glass, play contains all developmental tendencies in a condensed form and is itself a major source of development.

虽然游戏与发展的关系可以与教学与发展的关系相比较，但游戏为需求和意识的变化提供了更广泛的背景。在想象领域、在想象情境中的行为、自愿意图的产生以及现实生活计划和意志动机的形成——所有这些都出现在游戏中，并使其成为学龄前发展的最高水平。 孩子本质上是通过游戏活动来前进的。只有从这个意义上讲，游戏才可以被视为决定孩子发展的主导活动。

Though the play-development relationship can be compared to the instruction-development relationship, play provides a much wider background for changes in needs and consciousness. Action in the imaginative sphere, in an imaginary situation, the creation of voluntary intentions, and the formation of real-life plans and volitional motives—all appear in play and make it the highest level of preschool development. The child moves forward essentially through play activity. Only in this sense can play be considered a leading activity that determines the child’s development.

游戏是如何变化的？ 值得注意的是，孩子一开始会从一个与真实情况非常接近的假想情境开始。真实情境会重现。例如，玩洋娃娃的孩子几乎完全重复他妈妈对他做的事情。这意味着在原始情境中，规则以浓缩和压缩的形式运行。其中的想象很少。这是一个假想的情境，但只有在刚刚发生的真实情境的背景下才能理解。游戏更像是对实际发生的事情的回忆，而不是想象。它更多的是记忆在起作用，而不是一种新颖的假想情境。

How does play change? It is remarkable that the child starts with an imaginary situation that initially is so very close to the real one. A reproduction of the real situation takes place. For example, a child playing with a doll repeats almost exactly what his mother does with him. This means that in the original situation rules operate in a condensed and compressed form. There is very little of the imaginary. It is an imaginary situation, but it is only comprehensible in the light of a real situation that has just occurred. Play is more nearly recollection of something that has actually happened than imagination. It is more memory in action than a novel imaginary situation.

随着游戏的发展，我们看到了朝着有意识地实现其目的的方向发展。将游戏视为没有目的的活动是错误的。在体育比赛中，一个人可以赢或输；在比赛中，一个人可以排在第一位、第二位或最后一名。简而言之，目的决定了比赛并证明了活动的合理性。作为最终目标，目的决定了儿童对游戏的情感态度。在赛跑时，儿童可能会非常焦躁或苦恼，并且可能几乎没有乐趣，因为她觉得跑步会让她感到身体疼痛，如果她被超越，她将体验到很少的功能性乐趣。在体育运动中，游戏的目的是其主要特征之一，没有它就没有意义——就像检查一块糖果，把它放进嘴里，咀嚼，然后吐出来。在这样的游戏中，目标是获胜，这是预先被认识到的。

As play develops, we see a movement toward the conscious realization of its purpose. It is incorrect to conceive of play as activity without purpose. In athletic games one can win or lose; in a race one can come in first, second, or last. In short, the purpose decides the game and justifies the activity. Purpose, as the ultimate goal, determines the child’s affective attitude to play. When running a race, a child can be highly agitated or distressed and little pleasure may remain because she finds it physically painful to run, and if she is overtaken she will experience little functional pleasure. In sports the purpose of the game is one of its dominant features, without which there would be no point—like examining a piece of candy, putting it into one’s mouth, chewing it, and then spitting it out. In such play, the object, which is to win, is recognized in advance.

在发展的最后阶段，规则逐渐出现，规则越严格，对儿童应用的要求就越高，对儿童活动的管制就越严格，游戏就越紧张和激烈。没有目的或规则地四处奔跑是无聊的，对孩子没有吸引力。因此，在游戏发展的最后阶段，一系列原本未开发的特征开始显现——最初是次要的或偶然的特征在最后占据了中心位置，反之亦然。

At the end of development, rules emerge, and the more rigid they are the greater the demands on the child’s application, the greater the regulation of the child’s activity, the more tense and acute play becomes. Simply running around without purpose or rules is boring and does not appeal to children. Consequently, a complex of originally undeveloped features comes to the fore at the end of play development—features that had been secondary or incidental in the beginning occupy a central position at the end, and vice versa.

从某种意义上说，玩耍的孩子可以自由决定自己的行为。但从另一种意义上说，这是一种虚幻的自由，因为他的行为实际上服从于事物的意义，并据此采取行动。

In one sense a child at play is free to determine his own actions. But in another sense this is an illusory freedom, for his actions are in fact subordinated to the meanings of things, and he acts accordingly.

从发展的角度看，创造想象的情境可以看作是发展抽象思维的一种手段。相应的规则的发展导致了基于这些规则的行动 其中工作与娱乐之间的区分成为可能，这是在学龄阶段遇到的一个基本事实。

From the point of view of development, creating an imaginary situation can be regarded as a means of developing abstract thought. The corresponding development of rules leads to actions on the basis of which the division between work and play becomes possible, a division encountered at school age as a fundamental fact.

正如一位研究者形象地表达的那样，游戏对于三岁以下的孩子来说是一种严肃的游戏，就像对于青少年一样，尽管当然，这个词的含义不同；对于非常小的孩子来说，严肃的游戏意味着她在玩耍时不会将想象的情境与真实的情境分开。对于学龄儿童来说，游戏成为一种更有限的活动形式，主要是运动型活动，它在学龄儿童的发展中发挥着特殊的作用，但缺乏学龄前儿童游戏的意义。在学龄儿童中，游戏并没有消失，而是渗透到了对现实的态度中。它在学校教学和工作中有着自己的内在延续（基于规则的强制性活动）。游戏的本质是在意义领域和视觉领域之间建立了一种新的关系——即在思维情境和真实情境之间。

As figuratively expressed by one investigator, play for a child under three is a serious game, just as it is for an adolescent, although, of course, in a different sense of the word; serious play for a very young child means that she plays without separating the imaginary situation from the real one. For the school child, play becomes a more limited form of activity, predominantly of the athletic type, which fills a specific role in the school child’s development but lacks the significance of play for the preschooler. At school age play does not die away but permeates the attitude toward reality. It has its own inner continuation in school instruction and work (compulsory activity based on rules). It is the essence of play that a new relation is created between the field of meaning and the visual field—that is, between situations in thought and real situations.

从表面上看，游戏与它所导致的复杂、中介形式的思维和意志几乎没有相似之处。只有深刻的内部分析才有可能确定其变化过程及其在发展中的作用。

Superficially, play bears little resemblance to the complex, mediated form of thought and volition it leads to. Only a profound internal analysis makes it possible to determine its course of change and its role in development.

8

8

书面语言的史前史

The Prehistory of Written Language

到目前为止，写作在学校实践中占据的地位太过狭窄，而它在儿童文化发展中发挥着巨大的作用。写作教学一直被狭隘地视为实用主义。孩子们被教导描摹字母并将它们拼成单词，但没有被教导书面语言。阅读书面内容的技巧被过分强调，以至于掩盖了书面语言本身。

Until now, writing has occupied too narrow a place in school practice as compared to the enormous role that it plays in children’s cultural development. The teaching of writing has been conceived in narrowly practical terms. Children are taught to trace out letters and make words out of them, but they are not taught written language. The mechanics of reading what is written are so emphasized that they overshadow written language as such.

在向聋哑人教授口语时也发生了类似的事情。注意力完全集中在正确发音和清晰发音上。在这种情况下，聋哑人的老师没有辨别出这些发音技巧背后的口语，结果就是死语。

Something similar has happened in teaching spoken language to deaf-mutes. Attention has been concentrated entirely on correct production of particular letters and distinct articulation of them. In this case, teachers of deaf-mutes have not discerned spoken language behind these pronunciation techniques, and the result has been dead speech.
